translated: Known for his truthfulness, whose son is that Raghava.

original: rāmo nāma sa dharmātmā triṣu lokeṣu viśrutaḥ
analyzed: rāmaḥ nāma sa dharma ātmā triṣu lokeṣu viśrutaḥ
translated: The one named Rama, with dharma in his soul, is famous in the three worlds.

original: dīrghabāhur viśālākṣo daivataṃ sa patir mama
analyzed: dīrgha bāhuḥ viśāla akṣaḥ daivatam sa patiḥ mama
translated: He is long-armed, large-eyed, and is my divine husband.

original: ikṣvākūṇāṃ kule jātaḥ siṃhaskandho mahādyutiḥ
analyzed: ikṣvākūṇām kule jātaḥ siṃha skandhaḥ mahā dyutiḥ
translated: Born in the lineage of the Ikshvakus, with shoulders like a lion, greatly radiant,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā yas te prāṇāṃ hariṣyati
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā yaḥ te prāṇām hariṣyati
translated: Lakshmana, his brother, will take away your life.

original: pratyakṣaṃ yady ahaṃ tasya tvayā syāṃ dharṣitā balāt
analyzed: pratyakṣam yadi aham tasya tvayā syām dharṣitā balāt
translated: If I were forcibly violated by him in your presence,

original: śayitā tvaṃ hataḥ saṃkhye janasthāne yathā kharaḥ
analyzed: śayitā tvam hataḥ saṃkhye janasthāne yathā kharaḥ
translated: You will lie slain in battle, just as Khara was slain in Janasthana.

original: ya ete rākṣasāḥ proktā ghorarūpā mahābalāḥ
analyzed: ye ete rākṣasāḥ proktāḥ ghora rūpāḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: All these rakshasas who have been mentioned, terrible in form and greatly powerful,

original: rāghave nirviṣāḥ sarve suparṇe pannagā yathā
analyzed: rāghave nirviṣāḥ sarve suparṇe pannagāḥ yathā
translated: will become powerless against Raghava, like serpents against Garuda.

original: tasya jyāvipramuktās te śarāḥ kāñcanabhūṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: tasya jyā vipramuktāḥ te śarāḥ kāñcana bhūṣaṇāḥ
translated: Those arrows released from his bowstring, adorned with gold,

original: śarīraṃ vidhamiṣyanti gaṅgākūlam ivormayaḥ
analyzed: śarīram vidhamiṣyanti gaṅgā kūlam iva ūrmayaḥ
translated: will pierce your body, like waves against the bank of the Ganges.

original: asurair vā surair vā tvaṃ yady avadho 'si rāvaṇa
analyzed: asuraiḥ vā suraiḥ vā tvam yadi avadho si rāvaṇa
translated: If you are to be killed by asuras or gods, O Ravana,

original: utpādya sumahad vairaṃ jīvaṃs tasya na mokṣyase
analyzed: utpādya su mahat vairam jīvan tasya na mokṣyase
translated: having created great enmity, you will not escape him alive.

original: sa te jīvitaśeṣasya rāghavo 'ntakaro balī
analyzed: sa te jīvita śeṣasya rāghavaḥ ntakaraḥ balī
translated: That powerful Raghava will be the end of your remaining life,

original: paśor yūpagatasyeva jīvitaṃ tava durlabham
analyzed: paśoḥ yūpa gatasya iva jīvitam tava durlabham
translated: just as the life of an animal tied to the sacrificial post is difficult.

original: yadi paśyet sa rāmas tvāṃ roṣadīptena cakṣuṣā
analyzed: yadi paśyet sa rāmaḥ tvām roṣa dīptena cakṣuṣā
translated: If Rama were to see you with eyes blazing with anger,

original: rakṣas tvam adya nirdagdho gaccheḥ sadyaḥ parābhavam
analyzed: rakṣaḥ tvam adya nirdagdhaḥ gaccheḥ sadyas parābhavam
translated: you would be instantly consumed and defeated, O rakshasa.

original: yaś candraṃ nabhaso bhūmau pātayen nāśayeta vā
analyzed: yaḥ candram nabhasaḥ bhūmau pātayet nāśayeta vā
translated: He who could bring down the moon from the sky to the earth or destroy it,

original: sāgaraṃ śoṣayed vāpi sa sītāṃ mocayed iha
analyzed: sāgaram śoṣayet vā api sa sītām mocayet iha
translated: or dry up the ocean, could free Sita here.

original: gatāyus tvaṃ gataśrīko gatasattvo gatendriyaḥ
analyzed: gata āyuḥ tvam gata śrīkaḥ gata sattvaḥ gata indriyaḥ
translated: Your life is over, your glory is gone, your courage is lost, your senses are gone.

original: laṅkā vaidhavyasaṃyuktā tvatkṛtena bhaviṣyati
analyzed: laṅkā vaidhavya saṃyuktā tvad kṛtena bhaviṣyati
translated: Because of you, Lanka will be filled with widowhood.

original: na te pāpam idaṃ karma sukhodarkaṃ bhaviṣyati
analyzed: na te pāpam idam karma sukha udarkam bhaviṣyati
translated: This deed of yours will not lead to happiness,

original: yāhaṃ nītā vinā bhāvaṃ patipārśvāt tvayā vanāt
analyzed: yā aham nītā vinā bhāvam pati pārśvāt tvayā vanāt
translated: For you have taken me away from my husband's side in the forest, against my will.

original: sa hi daivatasaṃyukto mama bhartā mahādyutiḥ
analyzed: sa hi daivata saṃyuktaḥ mama bhartā mahā dyutiḥ
translated: My husband, of great splendor, is united with the gods,

original: nirbhayo vīryam āśritya śūnye vasati daṇḍake🔽sa te darpaṃ balaṃ vīryam utsekaṃ ca tathāvidham
analyzed: nirbhayaḥ vīryam āśritya śūnye vasati daṇḍake  sa te darpam balam vīryam utsekam ca tathāvidham
translated: And relying on his strength, he dwells fearlessly in the empty Dāndaka forest.🔽He will remove your pride, strength, valor, and insolence

original: apaneṣyati gātrebhyaḥ śaravarṣeṇa saṃyuge
analyzed: apaneṣyati gātrebhyaḥ śara varṣeṇa saṃyuge
translated: With a shower of arrows in battle, from your limbs.

original: yadā vināśo bhūtānāṃ dṛśyate kālacoditaḥ
analyzed: yadā vināśaḥ bhūtānām dṛśyate kāla coditaḥ
translated: When the destruction of beings is seen, impelled by time,

original: tadā kārye pramādyanti narāḥ kālavaśaṃ gatāḥ
analyzed: tadā kārye pramādyanti narāḥ kāla vaśam gatāḥ
translated: Then people, under the sway of time, become negligent in their duties.

original: māṃ pradhṛṣya sa te kālaḥ prāpto 'yaṃ rakṣasādhama
analyzed: mām pradhṛṣya sa te kālaḥ prāptaḥ yam rakṣasā adhama
translated: O worst of demons, that time has now arrived for you,

original: ātmano rākṣasānāṃ ca vadhāyāntaḥpurasya ca
analyzed: ātmanaḥ rākṣasānām ca vadhāya antaḥpurasya ca
translated: For your own destruction, and for the destruction of the demons and the inner quarters.🔽It is not possible for a Caṇḍāla to oppress

original: na śakyā yajñamadhyasthā vediḥ srugbhāṇḍa maṇḍitā
analyzed: na śakyā yajña madhya sthā vediḥ sruc bhāṇḍa maṇḍitā
translated: The altar in the midst of a sacrifice, adorned with the sacrificial ladle and vessels,

original: dvijātimantrasaṃpūtā caṇḍālenāvamarditum
analyzed: dvijāti mantra saṃpūtā caṇḍālena avamarditum
translated: Consecrated with the mantras of the twice-born.

original: idaṃ śarīraṃ niḥsaṃjñaṃ bandha vā ghātayasva vā
analyzed: idam śarīram niḥsaṃjñam bandha vā ghātayasva vā
translated: Either bind this unconscious body of mine or kill it,

original: nedaṃ śarīraṃ rakṣyaṃ me jīvitaṃ vāpi rākṣasa
analyzed: na idam śarīram rakṣyam me jīvitam vā api rākṣasa
translated: For I cannot protect this body or my life, O demon.

original: na hi śakṣyāmy upakrośaṃ pṛthivyāṃ dātum ātmanaḥ
analyzed: na hi śakṣyāmi upakrośam pṛthivyām dātum ātmanaḥ
translated: For I will not be able to give an accusation against myself on earth.

original: evam uktvā tu vaidehī kroddhāt suparuṣaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: evam uktvā tu vaidehī su paruṣam vacaḥ
translated: Having spoken these extremely harsh words out of anger,

original: rāvaṇaṃ maithilī tatra punar novāca kiṃ cana
analyzed: rāvaṇam maithilī tatra punar na uvāca kim cana
translated: Maithilee did not say anything further to Ravana.

original: sītāyā vacanaṃ śrutvā paruṣaṃ romaharṣaṇam
analyzed: sītāyāḥ vacanam śrutvā paruṣam roma harṣaṇam
translated: Hearing Sita's harsh words that made the hair stand on end,

original: pratyuvāca tataḥ sītāṃ bhayasaṃdarśanaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: pratyuvāca tatas sītām bhaya saṃdarśanam vacaḥ
translated: he replied to Sita with words that showed his fear.

original: śṛṇu maithili madvākyaṃ māsān dvādaśa bhāmini🔽kālenānena nābhyeṣi yadi māṃ cāruhāsini
analyzed: śṛṇu maithili mad vākyam māsān dvādaśa bhāmini  kālena anena na abhyeṣi yadi mām cāru hāsini
translated: Listen to my words, Maithili, O beautiful lady, for twelve months.🔽If within this time, O you of beautiful smiles, you do not accept me,

original: tatas tvāṃ prātarāśārthaṃ sūdāś chetsyanti leśaśaḥ
analyzed: tatas tvām prātarāśa artham sūdāḥ chetsyanti leśaśas
translated: then the cooks will cut you into pieces for my breakfast.

original: ity uktvā paruṣaṃ vākyaṃ rāvaṇaḥ śatrurāvaṇaḥ
analyzed: iti uktvā paruṣam vākyam rāvaṇaḥ śatru rāvaṇaḥ
translated: Having spoken these harsh words, Ravana, the enemy-scorcher,

original: rākṣasīś ca tataḥ kruddha idaṃ vacanam abravīt🔽śīghram evaṃ hi rākṣasyo vikṛtā ghoradarśanāḥ
analyzed: rākṣasīḥ ca tatas kruddhaḥ idam vacanam abravīt  śīghram evam hi rākṣasyaḥ vikṛtāḥ ghora darśanāḥ
translated: and then angrily spoke these words to the demonesses:🔽O demonesses, you who are ugly and terrible to behold,

original: darpam asyā vineṣyantu māṃsaśoṇitabhojanāḥ
analyzed: darpam asyāḥ vineṣyantu māṃsa śoṇita bhojanāḥ
translated: quickly remove her pride, you who feed on flesh and blood.

original: vacanād eva tās tasya vikṛtā ghoradarśanāḥ
analyzed: vacanāt eva tāḥ tasya vikṛtāḥ ghora darśanāḥ
translated: At his command, those who were ugly and terrible to behold,

original: kṛtaprāñjalayo bhūtvā maithilīṃ paryavārayan
analyzed: kṛta prāñjalayaḥ bhūtvā maithilīm paryavārayan
translated: with folded hands, surrounded Maithili.

original: sa tāḥ provāca rājā tu rāvaṇo ghoradarśanaḥ
analyzed: sa tāḥ provāca rājā tu rāvaṇaḥ ghora darśanaḥ
translated: That king Ravana, who was terrible to behold, spoke to them,

original: pracālya caraṇotkarṣair dārayann iva medinīm
analyzed: pracālya caraṇa utkarṣaiḥ dārayan iva medinīm
translated: shaking his feet and as if tearing apart the earth.

original: aśokavanikāmadhye maithilī nīyatām iti🔽tatreyaṃ rakṣyatāṃ gūḍham uṣmābhiḥ parivāritā
analyzed: aśoka vanikā madhye maithilī nīyatām iti  tatra iyam rakṣyatām gūḍham uṣmābhiḥ parivāritā
translated: Take Maithili to the middle of the Aśoka grove.🔽There, let her be guarded secretly, surrounded by hot-tempered ones.

original: tatraināṃ tarjanair ghoraiḥ punaḥ sāntvaiś ca maithilīm
analyzed: tatra enām tarjanaiḥ ghoraiḥ punar sāntvaiḥ ca maithilīm
translated: There, with terrible threats and again with conciliatory words,

original: ānayadhvaṃ vaśaṃ sarvā vanyāṃ gajavadhūm iva
analyzed: ānayadhvam vaśam sarvāḥ vanyām gaja vadhūm iva
translated: bring Maithili under control, like a wild female elephant.

original: iti pratisamādiṣṭā rākṣasyo rāvaṇena tāḥ
analyzed: iti pratisamādiṣṭāḥ rākṣasyaḥ rāvaṇena tāḥ
translated: Thus commanded by Rāvaṇa, those demonesses

original: aśokavanikāṃ jagmur maithilīṃ parigṛhya tām
analyzed: aśoka vanikām jagmuḥ maithilīm parigṛhya tām
translated: went to the Aśoka grove, taking Maithili with them.

original: sarvakāmaphalair vṛkṣair nānāpuṣpaphalair vṛtām
analyzed: sarva kāma phalaiḥ vṛkṣaiḥ nānā puṣpa phalaiḥ vṛtām
translated: Surrounded by trees bearing fruits of all desires and various flowers and fruits,

original: sarvakālamadaiś cāpi dvijaiḥ samupasevitām
analyzed: sarva kāla madaiḥ ca api dvijaiḥ samupasevitām
translated: and frequented by birds singing at all times,

original: sā tu śokaparītāṅgī maithilī janakātmajā
analyzed: sā tu śoka parīta aṅgī maithilī janakātmajā
translated: Maithili, the daughter of Janaka, with her limbs overwhelmed by grief,

original: rākṣasī vaśam āpannā vyāghrīṇāṃ hariṇī yathā
analyzed: rākṣasī vaśam āpannā vyāghrīṇām hariṇī yathā
translated: was under the control of the demonesses, like a female deer among tigresses.

original: na vindate tatra tu śarma maithilī /
analyzed: na vindate tatra tu śarma maithilī
translated: But Maithili found no peace there,

original: virūpanetrābhir atīva tarjitā
analyzed: virūpa netrābhiḥ atīva tarjitā
translated: terrified by those extremely ugly-eyed ones.

original: patiṃ smarantī dayitaṃ ca devaraṃ /
analyzed: patim smarantī dayitam ca devaram
translated: Remembering her husband and her beloved brother-in-law,

original: vicetanābhūd bhayaśokapīḍitā🔽rākṣasaṃ mṛgarūpeṇa carantaṃ kāmarūpiṇam
analyzed: vicetanā abhūt bhaya śoka pīḍitā  rākṣasam mṛga rūpeṇa carantam kāmarūpiṇam
translated: she became senseless, afflicted by fear and sorrow.🔽Having killed the demon who was wandering in the form of a deer, capable of assuming any form at will,

original: nihatya rāmo mārīcaṃ tūrṇaṃ pathi nyavartata
analyzed: nihatya rāmaḥ mārīcam tūrṇam pathi nyavartata
translated: Rāma quickly turned back on the path.

original: tasya saṃtvaramāṇasya draṣṭukāmasya maithilīm🔽krūrasvaro 'tha gomāyur vinanādāsya pṛṣṭhataḥ🔽sa tasya svaram ājñāya dāruṇaṃ romaharṣaṇam
analyzed: tasya saṃtvaramāṇasya draṣṭu kāmasya maithilīm  krūra svaraḥ tha gomāyuḥ vinanāda asya pṛṣṭhatas  sa tasya svaram ājñāya dāruṇam roma harṣaṇam
translated: As he was hurrying, eager to see Maithilee,🔽a jackal with a cruel voice howled behind him.🔽Recognizing that terrible howl, which made the hair stand on end,

original: cintayām āsa gomāyoḥ svareṇa pariśaṅkitaḥ
analyzed: cintayām āsa gomāyoḥ svareṇa pariśaṅkitaḥ
translated: he became anxious, suspecting it was the voice of a jackal.

original: aśubhaṃ bata manye 'haṃ gomāyur vāśyate yathā
analyzed: aśubham bata manye ham gomāyuḥ vāśyate yathā
translated: I think it is inauspicious, as the jackal is howling.

original: svasti syād api vaidehyā rākṣasair bhakṣaṇaṃ vinā
analyzed: svasti syāt api vaidehyāḥ rākṣasaiḥ bhakṣaṇam vinā
translated: May there be well-being for Vaidehi, without being devoured by the rakshasas.

original: mārīcena tu vijñāya svaram ālakṣya māmakam
analyzed: mārīcena tu vijñāya svaram ālakṣya māmakam
translated: But Maricha, having recognized my voice and seen me,

original: vikruṣṭaṃ mṛgarūpeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ śṛṇuyād yadi
analyzed: vikruṣṭam mṛga rūpeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ śṛṇuyāt yadi
translated: if Lakshmana hears the cry in the form of a deer,

original: sa saumitriḥ svaraṃ śrutvā tāṃ ca hitvātha maithilīm
analyzed: sa saumitriḥ svaram śrutvā tām ca hitvā atha maithilīm
translated: that son of Sumitra, having heard the voice and abandoned Maithili,

original: tayaiva prahitaḥ kṣipraṃ matsakāśam ihaiṣyati
analyzed: tayā eva prahitaḥ kṣipram mad sakāśam iha eṣyati
translated: sent by her alone, will quickly come here to me.

original: rākṣasaiḥ sahitair nūnaṃ sītāyā īpsito vadhaḥ
analyzed: rākṣasaiḥ sahitaiḥ nūnam sītāyāḥ īpsitaḥ vadhaḥ
translated: Surely, the desired killing of Sita along with the rakshasas

original: kāñcanaś ca mṛgo bhūtvā vyapanīyāśramāt tu mām
analyzed: kāñcanaḥ ca mṛgaḥ bhūtvā vyapanīya āśramāt tu mām
translated: having become a golden deer, having lured me away from the hermitage,

original: dūraṃ nītvā tu mārīco rākṣaso 'bhūc charāhataḥ
analyzed: dūram nītvā tu mārīcaḥ rākṣasaḥ bhūt śara āhataḥ
translated: having taken me far away, Maricha became a rakshasa, struck by an arrow.

original: hā lakṣmaṇa hato 'smīti yad vākyaṃ vyajahāra ha
analyzed: hā lakṣmaṇa hataḥ smi iti yat vākyam vyajahāra ha
translated: Alas, Lakshmana! I am killed, were the words he uttered.

original: api svasti bhaved dvābhyāṃ rahitābhyāṃ mayā vane
analyzed: api svasti bhavet dvābhyām rahitābhyām mayā vane
translated: May there be well-being for the two of them, separated from me in the forest.

original: janasthānanimittaṃ hi kṛtavairo 'smi rākṣasaiḥ
analyzed: janasthāna nimittam hi kṛta vairaḥ smi rākṣasaiḥ
translated: I have made an enmity with the demons on account of Janasthana,

original: nimittāni ca ghorāṇi dṛśyante 'dya bahūni ca
analyzed: nimittāni ca ghorāṇi dṛśyante bahūni ca
translated: and many terrible omens are seen today.

original: ity evaṃ cintayan rāmaḥ śrutvā gomāyuniḥsvanam
analyzed: iti evam cintayan rāmaḥ śrutvā gomāyu niḥsvanam
translated: Thinking thus, Rama, hearing the cry of the jackal,

original: ātmanaś cāpanayanaṃ mṛgarūpeṇa rakṣasā🔽ājagāma janasthānaṃ rāghavaḥ pariśaṅkitaḥ
analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca apanayanam mṛga rūpeṇa rakṣasā  ājagāma janasthānam rāghavaḥ pariśaṅkitaḥ
translated: and seeing his own abduction by the demon in the form of a deer,🔽suspicious, Raghava came to Janasthana.

original: taṃ dīnamānasaṃ dīnam āsedur mṛgapakṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tam dīna mānasam dīnam āseduḥ mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: The deer and birds approached the sorrowful and miserable one,

original: savyaṃ kṛtvā mahātmānaṃ ghorāṃś ca sasṛjuḥ svarān
analyzed: savyam kṛtvā mahātmānam ghorān ca sasṛjuḥ svarān
translated: making a circle around the great-souled one and emitting terrible sounds.

original: tāni dṛṣṭvā nimittāni mahāghorāṇi rāghavaḥ
analyzed: tāni dṛṣṭvā nimittāni mahā ghorāṇi rāghavaḥ
translated: Seeing those extremely terrible omens, Raghava

original: tato lakṣaṇam āyāntaṃ dadarśa vigataprabham
analyzed: tatas lakṣaṇam āyāntam dadarśa vigata prabham
translated: then saw Lakshmana coming, devoid of luster.

original: tato 'vidūre rāmeṇa samīyāya sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: tatas vidūre rāmeṇa samīyāya sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Then Lakshmana approached Rama not far away,

original: viṣaṇṇaḥ sa viṣaṇṇena duḥkhito duḥkhabhāginā
analyzed: viṣaṇṇaḥ sa viṣaṇṇena duḥkhitaḥ duḥkha bhāginā
translated: the sorrowful one with the sorrowful one, the afflicted one with the afflicted one.

original: saṃjagarhe 'tha taṃ bhrātā jeṣṭho lakṣmaṇam āgatam
analyzed: saṃjagarhe tha tam bhrātā jeṣṭhaḥ lakṣmaṇam āgatam
translated: Then the elder brother reproached Lakshmana who had come,

original: vihāya sītāṃ vijane vane rākṣasasevite
analyzed: vihāya sītām vijane vane rākṣasa sevite
translated: leaving Sita alone in the forest frequented by demons.

original: gṛhītvā ca karaṃ savyaṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ raghunandanaḥ
analyzed: gṛhītvā ca karam savyam lakṣmaṇam raghunandanaḥ
translated: And taking Lakshmana's left hand, the descendant of Raghu,

original: uvāca madhurodarkam idaṃ paruṣam ārtavat
analyzed: uvāca madhura udarkam idam paruṣam ārta vat
translated: spoke these harsh words, sweet in import, out of sorrow:

original: aho lakṣmaṇa garhyaṃ te kṛtaṃ yat tvaṃ vihāya tām
analyzed: aho lakṣmaṇa garhyam te kṛtam yat tvam vihāya tām
translated: Alas, Laksmana, you have done a reprehensible act in coming here, leaving Sita.

original: sītām ihāgataḥ saumya kaccit svasti bhaved iti
analyzed: sītām iha āgataḥ saumya kaccit svasti bhavet iti
translated: O gentle one, I hope all is well with her.

original: na me 'sti saṃśayo vīra sarvathā janakātmajā
analyzed: na me sti saṃśayaḥ vīra sarvathā janakātmajā
translated: O hero, I have no doubt that the daughter of Janaka

original: vinaṣṭā bhakṣitā vāpa rākṣasair vanacāribhiḥ
analyzed: vinaṣṭā bhakṣitā vā āpa rākṣasaiḥ vana cāribhiḥ
translated: has perished or been devoured by the Rakshasas roaming the forest.

original: aśubhāny eva bhūyiṣṭhaṃ yathā prādurbhavanti me
analyzed: aśubhāni eva bhūyiṣṭham yathā prādurbhavanti me
translated: Evil omens appear to me again and again.

original: api lakṣmaṇa sītāyāḥ sāmagryaṃ prāpnuyāvahe
analyzed: api lakṣmaṇa sītāyāḥ sāmagryam
translated: O Laksmana, will we ever be reunited with Sita?

original: idaṃ hi rakṣomṛgasaṃnikāśaṃ /
analyzed: idam hi rakṣaḥ mṛga saṃnikāśam
translated: This Rakshasa, appearing like a deer,

original: pralobhya māṃ dūram anuprayātam
analyzed: pralobhya mām dūram anuprayātam
translated: lured me far away,

original: hataṃ kathaṃ cin mahatā śrameṇa /
analyzed: hatam katham cit mahatā śrameṇa
translated: and I killed it with great effort,

original: sa rākṣaso 'bhūn mriyamāṇa eva
analyzed: sa rākṣasaḥ bhūt mriyamāṇaḥ eva
translated: but it turned out to be a Rakshasa on the verge of death.

original: manaś ca me dīnam ihāprahṛṣṭaṃ /
analyzed: manaḥ ca me dīnam iha a prahṛṣṭam
translated: My mind is distressed and unhappy here,

original: cakṣuś ca savyaṃ kurute vikāram
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ca savyam kurute vikāram
translated: and my left eye throbs.

original: asaṃśayaṃ lakṣmaṇa nāsti sītā /
analyzed: asaṃśayam lakṣmaṇa na asti sītā
translated: O Laksmana, there is no doubt that Sita

original: hṛtā mṛtā vā pathi vartate vā
analyzed: hṛtā mṛtā vā pathi vartate vā
translated: has been abducted, killed, or is on the way.

original: sa dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇaṃ dīnaṃ śūnye daśarathātmajaḥ
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇam dīnam śūnye daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: Seeing the distressed Laksmana alone in the empty forest,

original: paryapṛcchata dharmātmā vaidehīm āgataṃ vinā
analyzed: paryapṛcchata dharma ātmā vaidehīm āgatam vinā
translated: the righteous son of Dasharatha asked him about Vaidehi's absence.

original: prasthitaṃ daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ yā mām anujagāma ha
analyzed: prasthitam daṇḍaka araṇyam yā mām anujagāma ha
translated: She who followed me to the Dandaka forest,

original: kva sā lakṣmaṇa vaidehī yāṃ hitvā tvam ihāgataḥ
analyzed: kva sā lakṣmaṇa vaidehī yām hitvā tvam iha āgataḥ
translated: Where is that Vaidehi, Lakshmana, whom you have left and come here?

original: rājyabhraṣṭasya dīnasya daṇḍakān paridhāvataḥ
analyzed: rājya bhraṣṭasya dīnasya daṇḍakān paridhāvataḥ
translated: Deprived of the kingdom, miserable, wandering in the Dandaka forest,

original: kva sā duḥkhasahāyā me vaidehī tanumadhyamā
analyzed: kva sā duḥkha sahāyā me vaidehī tanu madhyamā
translated: where is that Vaidehi, slender-waisted, my companion in sorrow?

original: yāṃ vinā notsahe vīra muhūrtam api jīvitum
analyzed: yām vinā nā utsahe vīra muhūrtam api jīvitum
translated: Without her, O hero, I am not able to live even for a moment.

original: kva sā prāṇasahāyā me sītā surasutopamā
analyzed: kva sā prāṇa sahāyā me sītā sura sutā upamā
translated: Where is that Sita, like the daughter of a celestial, my companion in life?

original: patitvam amarāṇāṃ vā pṛthivyāś cāpi lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: pati tvam amarāṇām vā pṛthivyāḥ ca api lakṣmaṇa
translated: The fall of the immortals or of the earth, O Lakshmana,

original: vinā tāṃ tapanīyābhāṃ neccheyaṃ janakātmajām
analyzed: vinā tām tapanīya ābhām na iccheyam janakātmajām
translated: without that daughter of Janaka, shining like gold, I do not desire.

original: kaccij jīvati vaidehī prāṇaiḥ priyatarā mama
analyzed: kaccit jīvati vaidehī prāṇaiḥ priyatarā mama
translated: Does Vaidehi, dearer to me than life, live?

original: kaccit pravrājanaṃ saumya na me mithyā bhaviṣyati
analyzed: kaccit pravrājanam saumya na me mithyā bhaviṣyati
translated: O gentle one, will not my banishment be fruitless?

original: sītānimittaṃ saumitre mṛte mayi gate tvayi
analyzed: sītā nimittam saumitre mṛte mayi gate tvayi
translated: For Sita's sake, O son of Sumitra, with me dead and you gone,

original: kaccit sakāmā sukhitā kaikeyī sā bhaviṣyati🔽saputrarājyāṃ siddhārthāṃ mṛtaputrā tapasvinī
analyzed: kaccit sa kāmā sukhitā kaikeyī sā bhaviṣyati  sa putra rājyām siddhārthām mṛta putrā tapasvinī
translated: will Kaikeyi be happy and satisfied?🔽Will the miserable Kausalya, whose son is dead, serve Kaikeyi, who has attained her object with her son on the throne?

original: upasthāsyati kausalyā kaccin saumya na kaikayīm
analyzed: upasthāsyati kausalyā kaccit saumya na kaikayīm
translated: O gentle one, will Kausalya serve Kaikeyi?

original: yadi jīvati vaidehī gamiṣyāmy āśramaṃ punaḥ
analyzed: yadi jīvati vaidehī gamiṣyāmi āśramam punar
translated: If Vaidehi lives, I will go back to the hermitage.

original: suvṛttā yadi vṛttā sā prāṇāṃs tyakṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: su vṛttā yadi vṛttā sā prāṇān tyakṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa
translated: If the virtuous one is dead, I will give up my life, O Lakshmana.

original: yadi mām āśramagataṃ vaidehī nābhibhāṣate
analyzed: yadi mām āśrama gatam vaidehī na abhibhāṣate
translated: If Vaidehi does not speak to me when I return to the hermitage,

original: punaḥ prahasitā sītā vinaśiṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: punar prahasitā sītā vinaśiṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa
translated: Sita will laugh again and I will perish, O Lakshmana.

original: brūhi lakṣmaṇa vaidehī yadi jīvati vā na vā
analyzed: brūhi lakṣmaṇa vaidehī yadi jīvati vā na vā
translated: Tell me, Lakshmana, whether Vaidehi is alive or not.

original: tvayi pramatte rakṣobhir bhakṣitā vā tapasvinī
analyzed: tvayi pramatte rakṣobhiḥ bhakṣitā vā tapasvinī
translated: Perhaps the poor woman was devoured by the demons while you were careless.

original: sukumārī ca bālā ca nityaṃ cāduḥkhadarśinī
analyzed: sukumārī ca bālā ca nityam ca aduḥkha darśinī
translated: She is delicate and young, and has never seen suffering.

original: madviyogena vaidehī vyaktaṃ śocati durmanāḥ
analyzed: mad viyogena vaidehī vyaktam śocati durmanāḥ
translated: It is clear that Vaidehi is grieving, with a sorrowful mind, due to separation from me.

original: sarvathā rakṣasā tena jihmena sudurātmanā
analyzed: sarvathā rakṣasā tena jihmena su durātmanā
translated: In every way, by that deceitful and extremely evil-minded demon,

original: vadatā lakṣmaṇety uccais tavāpi janitaṃ bhayam
analyzed: vadatā lakṣmaṇa iti uccais tava api janitam bhayam
translated: who said 'Lakshmana' loudly, causing fear even in you.

original: śrutaś ca śaṅke vaidehyā sa svaraḥ sadṛśo mama
analyzed: śrutaḥ ca śaṅke vaidehyā sa svaraḥ sadṛśaḥ mama
translated: I suspect that Vaidehi heard a voice similar to mine,

original: trastayā preṣitas tvaṃ ca draṣṭuṃ māṃ śīghram āgataḥ
analyzed: trastayā preṣitaḥ tvam ca draṣṭum mām śīghram āgataḥ
translated: and sent you in fear to see me, and you came quickly.

original: sarvathā tu kṛtaṃ kaṣṭaṃ sītām utsṛjatā vane
analyzed: sarvathā tu kṛtam kaṣṭam sītām utsṛjatā vane
translated: In every way, it is a great misfortune that you abandoned Sita in the forest.

original: pratikartuṃ nṛśaṃsānāṃ rakṣasāṃ dattam antaram
analyzed: pratikartum nṛśaṃsānām rakṣasām dattam antaram
translated: An opportunity has been given to the cruel demons to retaliate.

original: duḥkhitāḥ kharaghātena rākṣasāḥ piśitāśanāḥ
analyzed: duḥkhitāḥ khara ghātena rākṣasāḥ piśita aśanāḥ
translated: The demons who eat flesh are sorrowful due to the killing of Khara.

original: taiḥ sītā nihatā ghorair bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: taiḥ sītā nihatāḥ ghoraiḥ bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that Sita has been killed by those terrible ones.

original: aho 'smi vyasane magnaḥ sarvathā ripunāśana
analyzed: aho smi vyasane magnaḥ sarvathā ripu nāśana
translated: Alas, I am sunk in misfortune, O destroyer of enemies, in every way.

original: kiṃ tv idānīṃ kariṣyāmi śaṅke prāptavyam īdṛśam
analyzed: kim tu idānīm kariṣyāmi śaṅke prāptavyam īdṛśam
translated: But what shall I do now? I fear that such a thing must have happened.

original: iti sītāṃ varārohāṃ cintayann eva rāghavaḥ
analyzed: iti sītām varārohām cintayan eva rāghavaḥ
translated: Thinking thus of the excellent Sītā, Rāghava

original: ājagāma janasthānaṃ tvarayā sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: ājagāma janasthānam tvarayā sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: hurriedly came to Janasthāna with Lakṣmaṇa.

original: vigarhamāṇo 'nujam ārtarūpaṃ /🔽kṣudhā śramāc caiva pipāsayā ca
analyzed: vigarhamāṇaḥ nujam ārta rūpam  kṣudhā śramāt ca eva pipāsayā ca
translated: Reproaching his miserable younger brother,🔽afflicted by hunger, fatigue, and thirst,

original: viniḥśvasañ śuṣkamukho viṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: viniḥśvasam śuṣka mukhaḥ viṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: sighing, his dry mouth dejected,

original: pratiśrayaṃ prāpya samīkṣya śūnyam
analyzed: pratiśrayam prāpya samīkṣya śūnyam
translated: having reached and seen the empty dwelling,

original: svam āśramaṃ saṃpravigāhya vīro /
analyzed: svam āśramam saṃpravigāhya vīro
translated: the hero entered his own hermitage,

original: vihāradeśān anusṛtya kāṃś cit
analyzed: vihāra deśān anusṛtya kān cit
translated: and in some of the places where he used to roam,

original: etat tad ity eva nivāsabhūmau /
analyzed: etat tat iti eva nivāsa bhūmau
translated: thinking This is it, in the place where he used to live,

original: prahṛṣṭaromā vyathito babhūva🔽athāśramād upāvṛttam antarā raghunandanaḥ
analyzed: prahṛṣṭa romā vyathitaḥ babhūva  atha āśramāt upāvṛttam antarā raghunandanaḥ
translated: his hair stood on end and he was distressed.🔽Then, the descendant of Raghu, afflicted with grief,

original: paripapraccha saumitriṃ rāmo duḥkhārditaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: paripapraccha saumitrim rāmaḥ duḥkha arditaḥ punar
translated: again asked Sumitrā's son, who had turned back from the hermitage,

original: tam uvāca kimarthaṃ tvam āgato 'pāsya maithilīm
analyzed: tam uvāca kimartham tvam āgataḥ u pāsya maithilīm
translated: Why did you leave the princess of Mithilā and come here?

original: yadā sā tava viśvāsād vane viharitā mayā
analyzed: yadā sā tava viśvāsāt vane viharitā mayā
translated: When she was roaming in the forest out of trust in you,

original: dṛṣṭvaivābhyāgataṃ tvāṃ me maithilīṃ tyajya lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā eva abhyāgatam tvām me maithilīm tyajya lakṣmaṇa
translated: having seen you come, O Lakṣmaṇa, abandoning the princess of Mithilā,

original: śaṅkamānaṃ mahat pāpaṃ yat satyaṃ vyathitaṃ manaḥ
analyzed: śaṅkamānam mahat pāpam yat satyam vyathitam manaḥ
translated: suspecting a great sin, my mind is indeed distressed.

original: sphurate nayanaṃ savyaṃ bāhuś ca hṛdayaṃ ca me
analyzed: sphurate nayanam savyam bāhuḥ ca hṛdayam ca me
translated: My right eye throbs, as does my right arm and my heart.

original: dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇa dūre tvāṃ sītāvirahitaṃ pathi
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇa dūre tvām sītā virahitam pathi
translated: O Lakshmana! Seeing you from a distance on the path, bereft of Sita,

original: evam uktas tu saumitrir lakṣmaṇaḥ śubhalakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu saumitriḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ śubha lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the auspicious Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra,

original: bhūyo duḥkhasamāviṣṭo duḥkhitaṃ rāmam abravīt
analyzed: bhūyas duḥkha samāviṣṭaḥ duḥkhitam rāmam abravīt
translated: Overcome with grief, again spoke to the sorrowful Rama:

original: na svayaṃ kāmakāreṇa tāṃ tyaktvāham ihāgataḥ
analyzed: na svayam kāmakāreṇa tām tyaktvā aham iha āgataḥ
translated: I did not abandon her and come here out of my own desire.

original: pracoditas tayaivograis tvatsakāśam ihāgataḥ
analyzed: pracoditaḥ tayā evā ugraiḥ tvad sakāśam iha āgataḥ
translated: Urged by those fierce ones, I have come to you.

original: āryeṇeva parikruṣṭaṃ hā sīte lakṣmaṇeti ca🔽paritrāhīti yad vākyaṃ maithilyās tac chrutiṃ gatam
analyzed: āryeṇa iva parikruṣṭam hā sīte lakṣmaṇa iti ca  paritrāhi iti yat vākyam maithilyāḥ tat śrutim gatam
translated: As if by a noble one, the cries of 'Alas Sita!' and 'Alas Lakshmana!'🔽And the words 'Save me' were heard by Maithilee.

original: sā tam ārtasvaraṃ śrutvā tava snehena maithilī
analyzed: sā tam ārta svaram śrutvā tava snehena maithilī
translated: Hearing that cry of distress out of affection for you, Maithili

original: gaccha gaccheti mām āha rudantī bhayavihvalā
analyzed: gaccha gaccha iti mām āha rudantī bhaya vihvalā
translated: Cried out, 'Go, go!' trembling with fear.

original: pracodyamānena mayā gaccheti bahuśas tayā
analyzed: pracodyamānena mayā gaccha iti bahuśas tayā
translated: Urged by her to 'Go' many times,

original: pratyuktā maithilī vākyam idaṃ tvatpratyayānvitam
analyzed: pratyuktā maithilī vākyam idam tvad pratyaya anvitam
translated: Maithilee replied with words full of confidence in you:

original: na tat paśyāmy ahaṃ rakṣo yad asya bhayam āvahet
analyzed: na tat paśyāmi aham rakṣaḥ yat asya bhayam āvahet
translated: 'I do not see any demon who could cause fear to him.

original: nirvṛtā bhava nāsty etat kenāpy evam udāhṛtam
analyzed: nirvṛtā bhava nā asti etat kena api evam udāhṛtam
translated: Be relieved, it is not so. This was said by someone else.

original: vigarhitaṃ ca nīcaṃ ca katham āryo 'bhidhāsyati
analyzed: vigarhitam ca nīcam ca katham āryaḥ bhidhāsyati
translated: And how could a noble one speak what is condemned and base?

original: trāhīti vacanaṃ sīte yas trāyet tridaśān api🔽kiṃnimittaṃ tu kenāpi bhrātur ālambya me svaram
analyzed: trāhi iti vacanam sīte yaḥ trāyet tridaśān api  kiṃnimittam tu kena api bhrātuḥ ālambya me svaram
translated: O Sita! He who would save even the thirty gods, if he were to utter the words Save me,🔽For what reason was the word Save me uttered by someone else, imitating my brother's voice,

original: visvaraṃ vyāhṛtaṃ vākyaṃ lakṣmaṇa trāhi mām iti
analyzed: visvaram vyāhṛtam vākyam lakṣmaṇa trāhi mām iti
translated: In a faltering voice, saying Lakshmana, save me?

original: na bhavatyā vyathā kāryā kunārījanasevitā
analyzed: na bhavatyā vyathā kāryā kunārī jana sevitā
translated: You should not be distressed, served by a class of women who are not good.

original: alaṃ vaiklavyam ālambya svasthā bhava nirutsukā🔽na cāsti triṣu lokeṣu pumān yo rāghavaṃ raṇe
analyzed: alam vaiklavyam ālambya svasthā bhava nirutsukā  na ca asti triṣu lokeṣu pumān yaḥ rāghavam raṇe
translated: Enough of resorting to weakness, be composed and free from anxiety.

original: jāto vā jāyamāno vā saṃyuge yaḥ parājayet
analyzed: jātaḥ vā jāyamānaḥ vā saṃyuge yaḥ parājayet
translated: And there is no man in the three worlds who, born or being born, could defeat Raghava in battle.

original: evam uktā tu vaidehī parimohitacetanā
analyzed: evam uktā tu vaidehī parimohita cetanā
translated: Thus addressed, Vaidehi, her mind deluded,

original: uvācāśrūṇi muñcantī dāruṇaṃ mām idaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: uvāca aśrūṇi muñcantī dāruṇam mām idam vacaḥ
translated: weeping, spoke to me these terrible words:

original: bhāvo mayi tavātyarthaṃ pāpa eva niveśitaḥ
analyzed: bhāvaḥ mayi tava atyartham pāpaḥ eva niveśitaḥ
translated: You have placed excessive affection in me, O sinful one.

original: vinaṣṭe bhrātari prāpte na ca tvaṃ mām avāpsyasi
analyzed: vinaṣṭe bhrātari prāpte na ca tvam mām avāpsyasi
translated: Even when your brother is destroyed and has come, you will not obtain me.

original: saṃketād bharatena tvaṃ rāmaṃ samanugacchasi🔽krośantaṃ hi yathātyarthaṃ nainam abhyavapadyase
analyzed: saṃketāt bharatena tvam rāmam samanugacchasi  krośantam hi yathā atyartham na enam abhyavapadyase
translated: From the agreement with Bharata, you follow Rama.🔽For though he cries out very much, you do not approach him.

original: ripuḥ pracchannacārī tvaṃ madartham anugacchasi
analyzed: ripuḥ pracchanna cārī tvam mad artham anugacchasi
translated: You are an enemy who moves in secret, following me for my sake.

original: rāghavasyāntaraprepsus tathainaṃ nābhipadyase
analyzed: rāghavasya antara prepsuḥ tathā enam na abhipadyase
translated: Seeking an opportunity for Raghava, you do not approach him in that way.

original: evam ukto hi vaidehyā saṃrabdho raktalocanaḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ hi vaidehyā saṃrabdhaḥ rakta locanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Vaidehi, he became angry, his eyes red,

original: krodhāt prasphuramāṇauṣṭha āśramād abhinirgataḥ
analyzed: krodhāt prasphuramāṇa oṣṭhaḥ āśramāt abhinirgataḥ
translated: his lips trembling with rage, he went out of the hermitage.

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaṃ saumitriṃ rāmaḥ saṃtāpamohitaḥ
analyzed: evam bruvāṇam saumitrim rāmaḥ saṃtāpa mohitaḥ
translated: Rama, deluded by grief, said to Saumitri, who was speaking thus,

original: abravīd duṣkṛtaṃ saumya tāṃ vinā yat tvam āgataḥ
analyzed: abravīt duṣkṛtam saumya tām vinā yat tvam āgataḥ
translated: O gentle one, it is not good that you have come without her.

original: jānann api samarthaṃ māṃ rakṣasāṃ vinivāraṇe
analyzed: jānan api samartham mām rakṣasām vinivāraṇe
translated: Even though knowing that I am capable of warding off the rakshasas,

original: anena krodhavākyena maithilyā niḥsṛto bhavān
analyzed: anena krodha vākyena maithilyāḥ niḥsṛtaḥ bhavān
translated: you have come out of the hermitage because of the angry words of Maithilee.

original: na hi te parituṣyāmi tyaktvā yad yāsi maithilīm
analyzed: na hi te parituṣyāmi tyaktvā yat yāsi maithilīm
translated: I am not at all pleased that you have left Maithilee and are going away.

original: kruddhāyāḥ paruṣaṃ śrutvā striyā yat tvam ihāgataḥ
analyzed: kruddhāyāḥ paruṣam śrutvā striyāḥ yat tvam iha āgataḥ
translated: You have come here after hearing the angry and harsh words of a woman.

original: sarvathā tv apanītaṃ te sītayā yat pracoditaḥ
analyzed: sarvathā tu apanītam te sītayā yat pracoditaḥ
translated: In every way, you have been abandoned by Sita, who has sent you.

original: krodhasya vaśam āgamya nākaroḥ śāsanaṃ mama
analyzed: krodhasya vaśam āgamya na akaroḥ śāsanam mama
translated: Coming under the influence of anger, you have not carried out my command.

original: asau hi rākṣasaḥ śete śareṇābhihato mayā
analyzed: asau hi rākṣasaḥ śete śareṇa abhihataḥ mayā
translated: That rakshasa lies there, struck down by my arrow,

original: mṛgarūpeṇa yenāham āśramād apavāditaḥ
analyzed: mṛga rūpeṇa yena aham āśramāt apavāditaḥ
translated: by whom I was driven away from the hermitage in the form of a deer.

original: vikṛṣya cāpaṃ paridhāya sāyakaṃ /
analyzed: vikṛṣya cāpam paridhāya sāyakam
translated: Drawing the bow and fixing an arrow,

original: salīla bāṇena ca tāḍito mayā
analyzed: salīla bāṇena ca tāḍitaḥ mayā
translated: I playfully struck him with an arrow.

original: mārgīṃ tanuṃ tyajya ca viklavasvaro /
analyzed: mārgīm tanum tyajya ca
translated: Abandoning his deer form and with a distressed voice,

original: babhūva keyūradharaḥ sa rākṣasaḥ
analyzed: babhūva keyūra dharaḥ sa rākṣasaḥ
translated: that rakshasa became one wearing bracelets.

original: śarāhatenaiva tadārtayā girā /
analyzed: śara āhatena eva tadā ārtayā girā
translated: With a voice afflicted by arrows,

original: svaraṃ mamālambya sudūrasaṃśravam
analyzed: svaram mama ālambya su dūra saṃśravam
translated: Taking up my voice, which can be heard from far away,

original: udāhṛtaṃ tad vacanaṃ sudāruṇaṃ /
analyzed: udāhṛtam tat vacanam su dāruṇam
translated: Those extremely terrible words were uttered:

original: tvam āgato yena vihāya maithilīm🔽bhṛśam āvrajamānasya tasyādhovāmalocanam
analyzed: tvam āgataḥ yena vihāya maithilīm  bhṛśam āvrajamānasya tasya adhas vāma locanam
translated: You have come, abandoning Maithilee.🔽As he was proceeding very quickly, the left eye below

original: prāsphurac cāskhalad rāmo vepathuś cāsya jāyate
analyzed: prāsphurat ca askhalat rāmaḥ vepathuḥ ca asya jāyate
translated: throbbed. Rama faltered and trembled arose in him.

original: upālakṣya nimittāni so 'śubhāni muhur muhuḥ
analyzed: upālakṣya nimittāni saḥ śubhāni muhur muhur
translated: Observing those inauspicious signs again and again,

original: api kṣemaṃ tu sītāyā iti vai vyājahāra ha
analyzed: api kṣemam tu sītāyāḥ iti vai vyājahāra ha
translated: he repeatedly said, Is Sita safe?

original: tvaramāṇo jagāmātha sītādarśanalālasaḥ
analyzed: tvaramāṇaḥ jagāma atha sītā darśana lālasaḥ
translated: Desiring to see Sita, he quickly proceeded.

original: śūnyam āvasathaṃ dṛṣṭvā babhūvodvignamānasaḥ
analyzed: śūnyam āvasatham dṛṣṭvā babhūva udvigna mānasaḥ
translated: Seeing the dwelling place empty, his mind became anxious.

original: udbhramann iva vegena vikṣipan raghunandanaḥ🔽tatra tatroṭajasthānam abhivīkṣya samantataḥ
analyzed: udbhraman iva vegena vikṣipan raghunandanaḥ  tatra tatra uṭaja sthānam abhivīkṣya samantataḥ
translated: As if whirling with speed, the descendant of Raghu,🔽looking all around at the huts here and there,

original: dadarśa parṇaśālāṃ ca rahitāṃ sītayā tadā
analyzed: dadarśa parṇa śālām ca rahitām sītayā tadā
translated: saw the leaf-hut devoid of Sita then.

original: śriyā virahitāṃ dhvastāṃ hemante padminīm iva
analyzed: śriyā virahitām dhvastām hemante padminīm iva
translated: Deprived of beauty, destroyed, like a lotus in winter,

original: rudantam iva vṛkṣaiś ca mlānapuṣpamṛgadvijam🔽śriyā vihīnaṃ vidhvastaṃ saṃtyaktavanadaivatam
analyzed: rudantam iva vṛkṣaiḥ ca mlāna puṣpa mṛga dvijam  śriyā vihīnam vidhvastam saṃtyakta vana daivatam
translated: as if the trees were weeping, with faded flowers, animals and birds,🔽deprived of beauty, destroyed, abandoned by the forest deities,

original: viprakīrṇājinakuśaṃ vipraviddhabṛsīkaṭam
analyzed: viprakīrṇa ajina kuśam vipraviddha bṛsī kaṭam
translated: with scattered deerskins and kusha grass, with torn cushions and mats,

original: dṛṣṭvā śūnyoṭajasthānaṃ vilalāpa punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā śūnya uṭaja sthānam vilalāpa punar punar
translated: Seeing the empty hut, he lamented again and again.

original: hṛtā mṛtā vā naṣṭā vā bhakṣitā vā bhaviṣyati
analyzed: hṛtā mṛtā vā naṣṭā vā bhakṣitā vā bhaviṣyati
translated: She may have been carried away, or died, or perished, or been devoured.

original: nilīnāpy atha vā bhīrur atha vā vanam āśritā
analyzed: nilīnā api atha vā bhīruḥ atha vā vanam āśritā
translated: Or perhaps the timid one has hidden herself, or gone to the forest.

original: gatā vicetuṃ puṣpāṇi phalāny api ca vā punaḥ
analyzed: gatāḥ vicetum puṣpāṇi phalāni api ca vā punar
translated: Or perhaps she has gone to gather flowers or fruits again.

original: atha vā padminīṃ yātā jalārthaṃ vā nadīṃ gatā
analyzed: atha vā padminīm yātā jala artham vā nadīm gatā
translated: Or perhaps she has gone to the lotus pond, or to the river for water.

original: yatnān mṛgayamāṇas tu nāsasāda vane priyām
analyzed: yatnāt mṛgayamāṇaḥ tu na āsasāda vane priyām
translated: But searching diligently, he could not find his beloved in the forest.

original: śokaraktekṣaṇaḥ śokād unmatta iva lakṣyate
analyzed: śoka rakta īkṣaṇaḥ śokāt unmattaḥ iva lakṣyate
translated: With eyes red like a shōka tree from grief, he seemed almost mad.

original: vṛkṣād vṛkṣaṃ pradhāvan sa girīṃś cāpi nadīn nadīm
analyzed: vṛkṣāt vṛkṣam pradhāvan sa girīn ca api nadīn nadīm
translated: Running from tree to tree, over mountains and rivers,

original: babhūva vilapan rāmaḥ śokapaṅkārṇavaplutaḥ
analyzed: babhūva vilapan rāmaḥ śoka paṅka arṇava plutaḥ
translated: Rama lamented, plunged into the mire of grief and an ocean of sorrow.

original: asti kaccit tvayā dṛṣṭā sā kadambapriyā priyā
analyzed: asti kaccit tvayā dṛṣṭā sā kadamba priyā priyā
translated: Have you by any chance seen my beloved, who loves the kadamba tree?

original: kadamba yadi jānīṣe śaṃsa sītāṃ śubhānanām
analyzed: kadamba yadi jānīṣe śaṃsa sītām śubha ānanām
translated: Kadamba, if you know, tell me about Sita, the one with a beautiful face.

original: snigdhapallavasaṃkāśāṃ pītakauśeyavāsinīm
analyzed: snigdha pallava saṃkāśām pīta kauśeya vāsinīm
translated: She is like a tender sprout, dressed in yellow silk.

original: śaṃsasva yadi vā dṛṣṭā bilva bilvopamastanī
analyzed: śaṃsasva yadi vā dṛṣṭā bilva bilva upama stanī
translated: Bilva, if you have seen her, tell me, her breasts are like bilva fruits.

original: atha vārjuna śaṃsa tvaṃ priyāṃ tām arjunapriyām
analyzed: atha vā arjuna śaṃsa tvam priyām tām arjuna priyām
translated: Or perhaps, Arjuna, you will tell me about my beloved, who loves Arjuna.

original: janakasya sutā bhīrur yadi jīvati vā na vā
analyzed: janakasya sutā bhīruḥ yadi jīvati vā na vā
translated: If Janaka's daughter, the timid one, is alive or not,

original: kakubhaḥ kakubhoruṃ tāṃ vyaktaṃ jānāti maithilīm
analyzed: kakubhaḥ kakubha ūrum tām vyaktam jānāti maithilīm
translated: Surely he knows Maithili, whose thighs are like the trunk of an elephant.

original: latāpallavapuṣpāḍhyo bhāti hy eṣa vanaspatiḥ🔽bhramarair upagītaś ca yathā drumavaro hy ayam
analyzed: latā pallava puṣpa āḍhyaḥ bhāti hi eṣa vanaspatiḥ  bhramaraiḥ upagītaḥ ca yathā druma varaḥ hi ayam
translated: This tree, laden with creepers, sprouts and flowers, clearly knows Maithilee, whose thighs are like the trunk of an elephant.🔽This excellent tree is indeed being sung by bees,

original: eṣa vyaktaṃ vijānāti tilakas tilakapriyām
analyzed: eṣa vyaktam vijānāti tilakaḥ tilaka priyām
translated: as if it knows the one with the tilaka mark, who is dear to the one with the tilaka mark.

original: aśokaśokāpanuda śokopahatacetasaṃ
analyzed: aśoka śoka apanuda śoka upahata cetasam
translated: O ashoka tree, which removes sorrow,

original: tvannāmānaṃ kuru kṣipraṃ priyāsaṃdarśanena mām
analyzed: tvad nāmānam kuru kṣipram priyā saṃdarśanena mām
translated: make me, whose mind is afflicted with sorrow, quickly bear your name by showing me my beloved.

original: yadi tāla tvayā dṛṣṭā pakvatālaphalastanī
analyzed: yadi tāla tvayā dṛṣṭā pakva tāla phala stanī
translated: O palm tree, if you have seen Sita, whose breasts are like ripe palm fruits,

original: kathayasva varārohāṃ kāruṣyaṃ yadi te mayi
analyzed: kathayasva varārohām kāruṣyam yadi te mayi
translated: if you have compassion for me, tell me about that beautiful one.

original: yadi dṛṣṭā tvayā sītā jambujāmbūnadaprabhā
analyzed: yadi dṛṣṭā tvayā sītā jambu jāmbūnada prabhā
translated: O rose-apple tree, if Sita, whose complexion is like a rose-apple or gold, has been seen by you,

original: priyāṃ yadi vijānīṣe niḥśaṅkaṃ kathayasva me🔽atha vā mṛgaśāvākṣīṃ mṛga jānāsi maithilīm
analyzed: priyām yadi vijānīṣe niḥśaṅkam kathayasva me  atha vā mṛgaśāvākṣīm mṛga jānāsi maithilīm
translated: if you know my beloved, tell me without hesitation.🔽O deer, if you know Maithilee, whose eyes are like those of a fawn,

original: mṛgaviprekṣaṇī kāntā mṛgībhiḥ sahitā bhavet
analyzed: mṛga viprekṣaṇī kāntā mṛgībhiḥ sahitā bhavet
translated: the beloved with eyes like a deer, may she be with the does.

original: gaja sā gajanāsorur yadi dṛṣṭā tvayā bhavet
analyzed: gaja sā gaja nāsā ūruḥ yadi dṛṣṭā tvayā bhavet
translated: O elephant, if that one with thighs like the trunk of an elephant has been seen by you,

original: tāṃ manye viditāṃ tubhyam ākhyāhi varavāraṇa
analyzed: tām manye viditām tubhyam ākhyāhi vara vāraṇa
translated: I think she is known to you. Tell me, O excellent elephant.

original: śārdūla yadi sā dṛṣṭā priyā candranibhānanā
analyzed: śārdūla yadi sā dṛṣṭā priyā candra nibha ānanā
translated: O tiger, if that beloved with a face like the moon has been seen by you,

original: maithilī mama visrabdhaḥ kathayasva na te bhayam
analyzed: maithilī mama visrabdhaḥ kathayasva na te bhayam
translated: Speak confidently, O Maithili, you have nothing to fear from me.

original: kiṃ dhāvasi priye nūnaṃ dṛṣṭāsi kamalekṣaṇe
analyzed: kim dhāvasi priye nūnam dṛṣṭā asi kamala īkṣaṇe
translated: Why do you run away, O beloved? Surely you have seen me, O lotus-eyed one.

original: vṛkṣeṇācchādya cātmānaṃ kiṃ māṃ na pratibhāṣase
analyzed: vṛkṣeṇa ācchādya ca ātmānam kim mām na pratibhāṣase
translated: Why do you not speak to me, having covered yourself with a tree?

original: tiṣṭha tiṣṭha varārohe na te 'sti karuṇā mayi
analyzed: tiṣṭha tiṣṭha varārohe na te sti karuṇā mayi
translated: Stop, stop, O beautiful one! You have no compassion for me.

original: nātyarthaṃ hāsyaśīlāsi kimarthaṃ mām upekṣase
analyzed: na atyartham hāsya śīlā asi kimartham mām upekṣase
translated: You are not excessively fond of laughter, why do you ignore me?

original: pītakauśeyakenāsi sūcitā varavarṇini
analyzed: pīta kauśeyakena asi sūcitā varavarṇini
translated: O beautiful one, you are indicated by your yellow silk garment.

original: dhāvanty api mayā dṛṣṭā tiṣṭha yady asti sauhṛdam
analyzed: dhāvantī api mayā dṛṣṭā tiṣṭha yadi asti sauhṛdam
translated: I have seen you running, stop if you have any affection.

original: naiva sā nūnam atha vā hiṃsitā cāruhāsinī
analyzed: nā eva sā nūnam atha vā hiṃsitā cāru hāsinī
translated: She is certainly not there, or the one with a beautiful smile has been harmed.

original: kṛcchraṃ prāptaṃ hi māṃ nūnaṃ yathopekṣitum arhati
analyzed: kṛcchram prāptam hi mām nūnam yathā upekṣitum arhati
translated: She must think I am in great difficulty, that is why she is ignoring me.

original: vyaktaṃ sā bhakṣitā bālā rākṣasaiḥ piśitāśanaiḥ
analyzed: vyaktam sā bhakṣitā bālā rākṣasaiḥ piśita aśanaiḥ
translated: It is clear that the young girl has been eaten by the flesh-eating rakshasas.

original: vibhajyāṅgāni sarvāṇi mayā virahitā priyā🔽nūnaṃ tac chubhadantauṣṭhaṃ mukhaṃ niṣprabhatāṃ gatam
analyzed: vibhajya aṅgāni sarvāṇi mayā virahitā priyā  nūnam tat śubha danta oṣṭham mukham niṣprabha tām gatam
translated: Having divided all her limbs, my beloved has been separated from me.🔽Surely her face with beautiful teeth and lips has lost its luster.

original: sā hi campakavarṇābhā grīvā graiveya śobhitā
analyzed: sā hi campaka varṇa ābhā grīvā graiveya śobhitā
translated: Her neck, shining with a necklace, had the color of a champak flower.

original: komalā vilapantyās tu kāntāyā bhakṣitā śubhā
analyzed: komalā vilapantyāḥ tu kāntāyāḥ bhakṣitā śubhā
translated: The tender and beautiful beloved must have been eaten while crying.

original: nūnaṃ vikṣipyamāṇau tau bāhū pallavakomalau
analyzed: nūnam vikṣipyamāṇau tau bāhū pallava komalau
translated: Surely her arms, tender like sprouts, have been scattered.

original: bhakṣitau vepamānāgrau sahastābharaṇāṅgadau
analyzed: bhakṣitau vepamāna agrau sa hasta ābharaṇa aṅgadau
translated: Their heads and feet were crushed, their arms and ornaments were trembling,

original: mayā virahitā bālā rakṣasāṃ bhakṣaṇāya vai
analyzed: mayā virahitā bālā rakṣasām bhakṣaṇāya vai
translated: The girl, separated from me, was about to be devoured by the demons.

original: sārtheneva parityaktā bhakṣitā bahubāndhavā
analyzed: sārthena iva parityaktā bhakṣitā bahu bāndhavā
translated: She was abandoned by the caravan, with many relatives, and devoured.

original: hā lakṣmaṇa mahābāho paśyasi tvaṃ priyāṃ kva cit
analyzed: hā lakṣmaṇa mahā bāho paśyasi tvam priyām kva cit
translated: Alas, O mighty-armed Lakṣmaṇa, do you see your beloved anywhere?

original: hā priye kva gatā bhadre hā sīteti punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: hā priye kva gatā bhadre hā sītā iti punar punar
translated: Alas, O beloved one! Where have you gone, O good one? Alas, Sītā!

original: ity evaṃ vilapan rāmaḥ paridhāvan vanād vanam
analyzed: iti evam vilapan rāmaḥ paridhāvan vanāt vanam
translated: Thus lamenting, Rāma runs from forest to forest,

original: kva cid udbhramate vegāt kva cid vibhramate balāt
analyzed: kva cit udbhramate vegāt kva cit vibhramate balāt
translated: Sometimes he runs wildly, sometimes he stumbles forcefully,

original: kva cin matta ivābhāti kāntān veṣaṇatatparaḥ
analyzed: kva cit mattaḥ iva ābhāti kāntān veṣaṇa tatparaḥ
translated: Sometimes he appears intoxicated, intent on searching for his beloved.

original: sa vanāni nadīḥ śailān giriprasravaṇāni ca
analyzed: sa vanāni nadīḥ śailān giri prasravaṇāni ca
translated: He roams through forests, rivers, mountains, mountain springs,

original: kānanāni ca vegena bhramaty aparisaṃsthitaḥ
analyzed: kānanāni ca vegena bhramati aparisaṃsthitaḥ
translated: And groves, running without rest.

original: tathā sa gatvā vipulaṃ mahad vanaṃ /
analyzed: tathā sa gatvā vipulam mahat vanam
translated: Having gone to that vast great forest,

original: parītya sarvaṃ tv atha maithilīṃ prati
analyzed: parītya sarvam tu atha maithilīm prati
translated: Wandering everywhere in search of Maithili,

original: aniṣṭhitāśaḥ sa cakāra mārgaṇe /
analyzed: a niṣṭhita āśaḥ sa cakāra mārgaṇe
translated: With his hopes unfulfilled, he continued his search,

original: punaḥ priyāyāḥ paramaṃ pariśramam
analyzed: punar priyāyāḥ paramam pariśramam
translated: Making the utmost effort to find his beloved again.

original: dṛṣṭāśramapadaṃ śūnyaṃ rāmo daśarathātmajaḥ
analyzed: dṛṣṭa āśrama padam śūnyam rāmaḥ daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: Seeing the empty hermitage, Rāma, the son of Daśaratha,

original: rahitāṃ parṇaśālāṃ ca vidhvastāny āsanāni ca
analyzed: rahitām parṇa śālām ca vidhvastāni āsanāni ca
translated: The leaf-hut devoid of Sītā, and the scattered seats,

original: adṛṣṭvā tatra vaidehīṃ saṃnirīkṣya ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: a dṛṣṭvā tatra vaidehīm saṃnirīkṣya ca sarvaśas
translated: Not seeing Vaidehi there, and looking everywhere,

original: uvāca rāmaḥ prākruśya pragṛhya rucirau bhujau
analyzed: uvāca rāmaḥ prākruśya pragṛhya rucirau bhujau
translated: Rāma spoke with anger, grasping his beautiful arms,

original: kva nu lakṣmaṇa vaidehī kaṃ vā deśam ito gatā
analyzed: kva nu lakṣmaṇa vaidehī kam vā deśam itas gatā
translated: Where is Vaidehi, O Lakṣmaṇa? To what country has she gone from here?

original: kenāhṛtā vā saumitre bhakṣitā kena vā priyā
analyzed: kena āhṛtā vā saumitre bhakṣitā kena vā priyā
translated: By whom has she been abducted, O Saumitra? Or has my beloved been eaten?

original: vṛṣkeṇāvārya yadi māṃ sīte hasitum icchasi
analyzed: vṛṣkeṇa āvārya yadi mām sīte hasitum icchasi
translated: If you wish to laugh at me, O Sītā, having concealed yourself with a blanket,

original: alaṃ te hasitenādya māṃ bhajasva suduḥkhitam
analyzed: alam te hasitena adya mām bhajasva su duḥkhitam
translated: Enough of your laughter now! Attend to me, who am greatly afflicted.

original: yaiḥ saha krīḍase sīte viśvastair mṛgapotakaiḥ
analyzed: yaiḥ saha krīḍase sīte viśvastaiḥ mṛga potakaiḥ
translated: O Sītā, with those young deer with whom you used to play, trusting them,

original: ete hīnās tvayā saumye dhyāyanty asrāvilekṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: ete hīnāḥ tvayā saumye dhyāyanti asra āvila īkṣaṇāḥ
translated: They, deprived of you, O gentle one, are thinking of you, their eyes filled with tears.

original: mṛtaṃ śokena mahatā sītāharaṇajena mām
analyzed: mṛtam śokena mahatā sītā āharaṇa jena mām
translated: Having been greatly afflicted by the grief arising from the abduction of Sītā,

original: paraloke mahārājo nūnaṃ drakṣyati me pitā
analyzed: para loke mahā rājaḥ nūnam drakṣyati me pitā
translated: My father, the great king, will surely see me in the next world.🔽Having heard my vow, why did you come into my presence,

original: kathaṃ pratijñāṃ saṃśrutya mayā tvam abhiyojitaḥ🔽apūrayitvā taṃ kālaṃ matsakāśam ihāgataḥ🔽kāmavṛttam anāryaṃ māṃ mṛṣāvādinam eva ca
analyzed: katham pratijñām saṃśrutya mayā tvam abhiyojitaḥ  a pūrayitvā tam kālam mad sakāśam iha āgataḥ  kāma vṛttam anāryam mām mṛṣāvādinam eva ca
translated: Without fulfilling it, having joined me here, at the appointed time?🔽In the next world, my father will surely say to me: 'Fie on you!'

original: dhik tvām iti pare loke vyaktaṃ vakṣyati me pitā
analyzed: tvām iti pare loke vyaktam vakṣyati me pitā
translated: Who, having seen you, will not be angry? Who will not be angry on seeing you?

original: vivaśaṃ śokasaṃtaptaṃ dīnaṃ bhagnamanoratham
analyzed: vivaśam śoka saṃtaptam dīnam bhagna manoratham
translated: Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you? Who will not be angry on seeing you

original: mām ihotsṛjya karuṇaṃ kīrtir naram ivānṛjum
analyzed: mām iha utsṛjya karuṇam kīrtiḥ naram iva anṛjum
translated: Leaving me here, like fame leaves a man who is not upright,

original: kva gacchasi varārohe mām utsṛjya sumadhyame
analyzed: kva gacchasi varārohe mām utsṛjya sumadhyame
translated: Where are you going, O beautiful one, leaving me, O slender-waisted one?

original: tvayā virahitaś cāhaṃ mokṣye jīvitam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: tvayā virahitaḥ ca aham mokṣye jīvitam ātmanaḥ
translated: Separated from you, I will give up my own life.

original: itīva vilapan rāmaḥ sītādarśanalālasaḥ
analyzed: iti iva vilapan rāmaḥ sītā darśana lālasaḥ
translated: Thus lamenting, Rama, eager to see Sita,

original: na dadarśa suduḥkhārto rāghavo janakātmajām
analyzed: na dadarśa su duḥkha ārtaḥ rāghavaḥ janakātmajām
translated: Did not see Janaka's daughter, afflicted with great sorrow,

original: anāsādayamānaṃ taṃ sītāṃ daśarathātmajam
analyzed: an āsādayamānam tam sītām daśaratha ātmajam
translated: Dasharatha's son, unable to find Sita,

original: paṅkam āsādya vipulaṃ sīdantam iva kuñjaram
analyzed: paṅkam āsādya vipulam sīdantam iva kuñjaram
translated: Was sinking down like an elephant stuck in a large swamp.

original: lakṣmaṇo rāmam atyartham uvāca hitakāmyayā
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ rāmam atyartham uvāca hita kāmyayā
translated: Lakshmana, with a desire for Rama's welfare, spoke to him:

original: mā viṣādaṃ mahābāho kuru yatnaṃ mayā saha
analyzed: mā viṣādam mahā bāho kuru yatnam mayā saha
translated: O mighty-armed one, do not despair. Make an effort with me.

original: idaṃ ca hi vanaṃ śūra bahukandaraśobhitam
analyzed: idam ca hi vanam śūra bahu kandara śobhitam
translated: And this forest, O hero, is adorned with many caves,

original: priyakānanasaṃcārā vanonmattā ca maithilī🔽sā vanaṃ vā praviṣṭā syān nalinīṃ vā supuṣpitām🔽saritaṃ vāpi saṃprāptā mīnavañjurasevitām
analyzed: priya kānana saṃcārā vana unmattā ca maithilī  sā vanam vā praviṣṭā syāt nalinīm vā su puṣpitām  saritam vā api saṃprāptāḥ mīna vañjura sevitām
translated: And Maithilee loves to wander in the forest, and is mad for the forest.🔽She may have entered the forest, or a well-flowered lotus pond,🔽Or she may have reached a river frequented by fish and porpoises.

original: vitrāsayitukāmā vā līnā syāt kānane kva cit
analyzed: vitrāsayitu kāmā vā līnā syāt kānane kva cit
translated: Or she may have hidden somewhere in the forest, desiring to frighten us.

original: jijñāsamānā vaidehī tvāṃ māṃ ca puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: jijñāsamānā vaidehī tvām mām ca puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among men, Vaidehi may be testing you and me.

original: tasyā hy anveṣaṇe śrīman kṣipram eva yatāvahe
analyzed: tasyāḥ hi anveṣaṇe śrīman kṣipram eva yatāvahe
translated: O prosperous one, let us quickly search for her.

original: vanaṃ sarvaṃ vicinuvo yatra sā janakātmajā
analyzed: vanam sarvam vicinuvaḥ yatra sā janakātmajā
translated: We will search the entire forest, where that daughter of Janaka may be.

original: manyase yadi kākutstha mā sma śoke manaḥ kṛthāḥ🔽evam uktas tu sauhārdāl lakṣmaṇena samāhitaḥ
analyzed: manyase yadi kākutstha mā sma śoke manaḥ kṛthāḥ  evam uktaḥ tu sauhārdāt lakṣmaṇena samāhitaḥ
translated: If you think so, Kakutstha, do not set your mind on sorrow.🔽Thus addressed out of friendship by Lakshmana, Rama,

original: saha saumitriṇā rāmo vicetum upacakrame
analyzed: saha saumitriṇā rāmaḥ vicetum upacakrame
translated: with Saumitri, began to search together.🔽Those two, Rama and Lakshmana, sons of Dasharatha,

original: tau vanāni girīṃś caiva saritaś ca sarāṃsi ca🔽nikhilena vicinvantau sītāṃ daśarathātmajau🔽tasya śailasya sānūni guhāś ca śikharāṇi ca
analyzed: tau vanāni girīn ca eva saritaḥ ca sarāṃsi ca  nikhilena vicinvantau sītām daśaratha ātmajau  tasya śailasya sānūni guhāḥ ca śikharāṇi ca
translated: thoroughly searched the forests, mountains, rivers and lakes,🔽looking for Sita, but did not find her anywhere.🔽They thoroughly searched the slopes, caves and peaks of that mountain,

original: nikhilena vicinvantau naiva tām abhijagmatuḥ
analyzed: nikhilena vicinvantau na eva tām abhijagmatuḥ
translated: but did not find her.

original: vicitya sarvataḥ śailaṃ rāmo lakṣmaṇam abravīt
analyzed: vicitya sarvatas śailam rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇam abravīt
translated: Having searched everywhere on the mountain, Rama said to Lakshmana:

original: neha paśyāmi saumitre vaidehīṃ parvate śubhe
analyzed: na iha paśyāmi saumitre vaidehīm parvate śubhe
translated: I do not see Vaidehi here, on this auspicious mountain, O Saumitri.

original: tato duḥkhābhisaṃtapto lakṣmaṇo vākyam abravīt🔽vicaran daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ bhrātaraṃ dīptatejasaṃ
analyzed: tatas duḥkha abhisaṃtaptaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ vākyam abravīt  vicaran daṇḍaka araṇyam bhrātaram dīpta tejasam
translated: Then Lakshmana, tormented by grief, spoke these words:🔽Wandering in the Dandaka forest, you will find the daughter of Janaka,

original: prāpsyasi tvaṃ mahāprājña maithilīṃ janakātmajām
analyzed: prāpsyasi tvam mahā prājña maithilīm janakātmajām
translated: the princess of Mithila, O you of great wisdom,

original: yathā viṣṇur mahābāhur baliṃ baddhvā mahīm imām
analyzed: yathā viṣṇuḥ mahā bāhuḥ balim baddhvā mahīm imām
translated: just as the mighty-armed Vishnu, having bound Bali, obtained this earth.

original: evam uktas tu vīreṇa lakṣmaṇena sa rāghavaḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu vīreṇa lakṣmaṇena sa rāghavaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the heroic Lakshmana, that descendant of Raghu,

original: uvāca dīnayā vācā duḥkhābhihatacetanaḥ
analyzed: uvāca dīnayā vācā duḥkha abhihata cetanaḥ
translated: He spoke with a distressed voice, his consciousness overwhelmed by grief:

original: vanaṃ sarvaṃ suvicitaṃ padminyaḥ phullapaṅkajāḥ
analyzed: vanam sarvam suvicitam padminyaḥ phulla paṅkajāḥ
translated: The entire forest has been thoroughly searched, the lotuses and blooming lotuses,

original: giriś cāyaṃ mahāprājña bahukandaranirjharaḥ
analyzed: giriḥ ca ayam mahā prājña bahu kandara nirjharaḥ
translated: And this mountain, O greatly wise one, with many caves and waterfalls,

original: na hi paśyāmi vaidehīṃ prāṇebhyo 'pi garīyasīm
analyzed: na hi paśyāmi vaidehīm prāṇebhyaḥ garīyasīm
translated: I do not see Vaidehi, who is dearer to me than my own life.

original: evaṃ sa vilapan rāmaḥ sītāharaṇakarśitaḥ
analyzed: evam sa vilapan rāmaḥ sītā āharaṇa karśitaḥ
translated: Thus did Rama lament, afflicted by the abduction of Sita.

original: dīnaḥ śokasamāviṣṭo muhūrtaṃ vihvalo 'bhavat🔽sa vihvalitasarvāṅgo gatabuddhir vicetanaḥ
analyzed: dīnaḥ śoka samāviṣṭaḥ muhūrtam vihvalaḥ bhavat  sa vihvalita sarva aṅgaḥ gata buddhiḥ vicetanaḥ
translated: Distressed and overcome with grief, he became senseless for a moment.🔽With all his limbs trembling, his mind gone, and bereft of consciousness,

original: viṣasādāturo dīno niḥśvasyāśītam āyatam
analyzed: viṣasāda āturaḥ dīnaḥ niḥśvasya aśītam āyatam
translated: He sank down, afflicted and distressed, sighing hot and long breaths.

original: bahuśaḥ sa tu niḥśvasya rāmo rājīvalocanaḥ
analyzed: bahuśas sa tu niḥśvasya rāmaḥ rājīva locanaḥ
translated: The lotus-eyed Rama sighed many times,

original: hā priyeti vicukrośa bahuśo bāṣpagadgadaḥ
analyzed: hā priyā iti vicukrośa bahuśas bāṣpa gadgadaḥ
translated: And cried out repeatedly, Alas, my beloved! with a voice choked with tears.

original: taṃ sāntvayām āsa tato lakṣmaṇaḥ priyabāndhavaḥ
analyzed: tam sāntvayām āsa tatas lakṣmaṇaḥ priya bāndhavaḥ
translated: Then Lakshmana, his beloved friend, comforted him,

original: bahuprakāraṃ dharmajñaḥ praśritaḥ praśritāñjaliḥ
analyzed: bahu prakāram dharma jñaḥ praśritaḥ praśrita añjaliḥ
translated: The humble one with folded hands, knowledgeable in dharma, in many ways.

original: anādṛtya tu tad vākyaṃ lakṣmaṇauṣṭhapuṭacyutam
analyzed: an ādṛtya tu tat vākyam lakṣmaṇa oṣṭha puṭa cyutam
translated: But disregarding the words that fell from Lakshmana's lips,

original: apaśyaṃs tāṃ priyāṃ sītāṃ prākrośat sa punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: a paśyan tām priyām sītām prākrośat sa punar punar
translated: Not seeing his beloved Sita, he cried out again and again.

original: sa dīno dīnayā vācā lakṣmaṇaṃ vākyam abravīt
analyzed: sa dīnaḥ dīnayā vācā lakṣmaṇam vākyam abravīt
translated: Distressed, he spoke these words to Lakshmana in a distressed voice:

original: śīghraṃ lakṣmaṇa jānīhi gatvā godāvarīṃ nadīm
analyzed: śīghram lakṣmaṇa jānīhi gatvā godāvarīm nadīm
translated: Go quickly, Lakshmana, and find out if Sita has gone to the Godavari river to gather lotuses.

original: api godāvarīṃ sītā padmāny ānayituṃ gatā
analyzed: api godāvarīm sītā padmāni ānayitum gatā
translated: Has Sita gone to the Godavari river to gather lotuses?

original: evam uktas tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ punar eva hi
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu rāmeṇa lakṣmaṇaḥ punar eva hi
translated: Thus addressed by Rama, Lakshmana, swift in his steps,

original: nadīṃ godāvarīṃ ramyāṃ jagāma laghuvikramaḥ
analyzed: nadīm godāvarīm ramyām jagāma laghu vikramaḥ
translated: again went to the beautiful Godavari river.

original: tāṃ lakṣmaṇas tīrthavatīṃ vicitvā rāmam abravīt
analyzed: tām lakṣmaṇaḥ tīrthavatīm vicitvā rāmam abravīt
translated: Having searched the river full of sacred places, Lakshmana said to Rama:

original: naināṃ paśyāmi tīrtheṣu krośato na śṛṇoti me
analyzed: na enām paśyāmi tīrtheṣu krośataḥ na śṛṇoti me
translated: I do not see her in the sacred places, nor do I hear her when I call out.

original: kaṃ nu sā deśam āpannā vaidehī kleśanāśinī
analyzed: kam nu sā deśam āpannā vaidehī kleśa nāśinī
translated: What place has Vaidehi, the destroyer of suffering, gone to?

original: na hi taṃ vedmi vai rāma yatra sā tanumadhyamā
analyzed: na hi tam vedmi vai rāma yatra sā tanu madhyamā
translated: I do not know, Rama, where that slender-waisted one is.

original: lakṣmaṇasya vacaḥ śrutvā dīnaḥ saṃtāpa mohitaḥ
analyzed: lakṣmaṇasya vacaḥ śrutvā dīnaḥ saṃtāpa mohitaḥ
translated: Hearing Lakshmana's words, Rama, dejected and confused by sorrow,

original: rāmaḥ samabhicakrāma svayaṃ godāvarīṃ nadīm
analyzed: rāmaḥ samabhicakrāma svayam godāvarīm nadīm
translated: himself approached the Godavari river.

original: sa tām upasthito rāmaḥ kva sītety evam abravīt
analyzed: sa tām upasthitaḥ rāmaḥ kva sītā iti evam abravīt
translated: Rama, having arrived there, said: Where is Sita?

original: bhūtāni rākṣasendreṇa vadhārheṇa hṛtām api
analyzed: bhūtāni rākṣasa indreṇa vadha arheṇa hṛtām api
translated: Even though she had been abducted by the lord of the rakshasas, who deserved to be killed,

original: na tāṃ śaśaṃsū rāmāya tathā godāvarī nadī
analyzed: na tām rāmāya tathā godāvarī nadī
translated: the beings did not inform Rama about her.

original: tataḥ pracoditā bhūtaiḥ śaṃsāsmai tāṃ priyām iti
analyzed: tatas pracoditā bhūtaiḥ śaṃsa asmai tām priyām iti
translated: Then, urged by the beings to tell him about his beloved,

original: na ca sābhyavadat sītāṃ pṛṣṭā rāmeṇa śocitā
analyzed: na ca sā abhyavadat sītām pṛṣṭā rāmeṇa śocitā
translated: though asked by the grieving Rama, the Godavari river did not acknowledge Sita.

original: rāvaṇasya ca tad rūpaṃ karmāṇi ca durātmanaḥ
analyzed: rāvaṇasya ca tat rūpam karmāṇi ca durātmanaḥ
translated: And remembering the form and deeds of the evil-minded Ravana,

original: dhyātvā bhayāt tu vaidehīṃ sā nadī na śaśaṃsa tām
analyzed: dhyātvā bhayāt tu vaidehīm sā nadī na śaśaṃsa tām
translated: that river, out of fear, did not tell him about Vaidehi.

original: nirāśas tu tayā nadyā sītāyā darśane kṛtaḥ
analyzed: nirāśaḥ tu tayā nadyā sītāyāḥ darśane kṛtaḥ
translated: But being disappointed at not seeing Sita in that river,

original: uvāca rāmaḥ saumitriṃ sītādarśanakarśitaḥ
analyzed: uvāca rāmaḥ saumitrim sītā adarśana karśitaḥ
translated: Rama, afflicted by the sight of Sita, said to the son of Sumitra:

original: kiṃ nu lakṣmaṇa vakṣyāmi sametya janakaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: kim nu lakṣmaṇa vakṣyāmi sametya janakam vacaḥ
translated: What shall I say, O Lakshmana, when I meet Janaka?

original: mātaraṃ caiva vaidehyā vinā tām aham apriyam🔽yā me rājyavihīnasya vane vanyena jīvataḥ
analyzed: mātaram ca eva vaidehyā vinā tām aham apriyam  yāḥ me rājya vihīnasya vane vanyena jīvataḥ
translated: How shall I, without Vaidehi, speak to her mother, that unpleasant news?🔽Vaidehi, who removed all my sorrow, when I was deprived of my kingdom and living in the forest on forest fare,

original: sarvaṃ vyapanayac chokaṃ vaidehī kva nu sā gatā
analyzed: sarvam vyapanayat śokam vaidehī kva nu sā gatā
translated: where has she gone?

original: jñātipakṣavihīnasya rājaputrīm apaśyataḥ
analyzed: jñāti pakṣa vihīnasya rāja putrīm apaśyataḥ
translated: Deprived of my kinsmen and not seeing the princess,

original: manye dīrghā bhaviṣyanti rātrayo mama jāgrataḥ
analyzed: manye dīrghāḥ bhaviṣyanti rātrayaḥ mama jāgrataḥ
translated: I think the nights will be long as I lie awake.

original: godāvarīṃ janasthānam imaṃ prasravaṇaṃ girim
analyzed: godāvarīm janasthānam imam prasravaṇam girim
translated: The Godavari river, Janasthana, and this Prasravana mountain,

original: sarvāṇy anucariṣyāmi yadi sītā hi dṛśyate
analyzed: sarvāṇi anucariṣyāmi yadi sītā hi dṛśyate
translated: I shall search everywhere, if only I can see Sita.

original: evaṃ saṃbhāṣamāṇau tāv anyonyaṃ bhrātarāv ubhau🔽vasuṃdharāyāṃ patitaṃ puṣpamārgam apaśyatām
analyzed: evam saṃbhāṣamāṇau tau anyonyam bhrātarau ubhau  vasuṃdharāyām patitam puṣpa mārgam a paśyatām
translated: While the two brothers were thus conversing with each other,🔽they saw a path of flowers fallen on the ground.

original: tāṃ puṣpavṛṣṭiṃ patitāṃ dṛṣṭvā rāmo mahītale
analyzed: tām puṣpa vṛṣṭim patitām dṛṣṭvā rāmaḥ mahī tale
translated: Seeing that shower of flowers fallen on the ground, Rama,

original: uvāca lakṣmaṇaṃ vīro duḥkhito duḥkhitaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: uvāca lakṣmaṇam vīraḥ duḥkhitaḥ duḥkhitam vacaḥ
translated: and spoke to the sorrowful Lākshmana in sorrowful words:

original: abhijānāmi puṣpāṇi tānīmāmīha lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: abhijānāmi puṣpāṇi tāni imāmi iha lakṣmaṇa
translated: I recognize these flowers, Lākshmana.

original: apinaddhāni vaidehyā mayā dattāni kānane
analyzed: apinaddhāni vaidehyāḥ mayā dattāni kānane
translated: They were given to me by Vaidéhi in the forest, when she was gathering them.

original: evam uktvā mahābāhur lakṣmaṇaṃ puruṣarṣabham
analyzed: evam uktvā mahā bāhuḥ lakṣmaṇam puruṣa ṛṣabham
translated: Having said this to Lākshmana, that mighty-armed bull among men,

original: kruddho 'bravīd giriṃ tatra siṃhaḥ kṣudramṛgaṃ yathā
analyzed: kruddhaḥ bravīt girim tatra siṃhaḥ kṣudra mṛgam yathā
translated: angered, spoke to the mountain there like a lion to a small animal:

original: tāṃ hemavarṇāṃ hemābhāṃ sītāṃ darśaya parvata
analyzed: tām hema varṇām hema ābhām sītām darśaya parvata
translated: Show me Sita, O mountain, she who is golden-hued and golden-complexioned,

original: yāvat sānūni sarvāṇi na te vidhvaṃsayāmy aham
analyzed: yāvat sānūni sarvāṇi na te vidhvaṃsayāmi aham
translated: before I destroy all your peaks.

original: mama bāṇāgninirdagdho bhasmībhūto bhaviṣyasi
analyzed: mama bāṇa agni nirdagdhaḥ bhasmībhūtaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: You will be consumed by the fire of my arrows and reduced to ashes.

original: asevyaḥ satataṃ caiva nistṛṇadrumapallavaḥ
analyzed: asevyaḥ satatam ca eva nistṛṇa druma pallavaḥ
translated: You will always be devoid of grass, trees and foliage.

original: imāṃ vā saritaṃ cādya śoṣayiṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: imām vā saritam ca adya śoṣayiṣyāmi lakṣmaṇa
translated: And today, O Lākshmana, I will dry up this river,

original: yadi nākhyāti me sītām adya candranibhānanām
analyzed: yadi nā ākhyāti me sītām adya candra nibha ānanām
translated: if it does not reveal to me Sita, whose face is like the moon.

original: evaṃ sa ruṣito rāmo didhakṣann iva cakṣuṣā🔽dadarśa bhūmau niṣkrāntaṃ rākṣasasya padaṃ mahat
analyzed: evam sa ruṣitaḥ rāmaḥ didhakṣan iva cakṣuṣā  dadarśa bhūmau niṣkrāntam rākṣasasya padam mahat
translated: Thus was Rama enraged, as if burning with his eyes,🔽and he saw on the ground the great footprint of the demon.

original: sa samīkṣya parikrāntaṃ sītāyā rākṣasasya ca
analyzed: sa samīkṣya parikrāntam sītāyāḥ rākṣasasya ca
translated: Having seen the footprint of Sita and the demon,🔽Rama, with a troubled heart, told his beloved brother:

original: saṃbhrāntahṛdayo rāmaḥ śaśaṃsa bhrātaraṃ priyam
analyzed: saṃbhrānta hṛdayaḥ rāmaḥ śaśaṃsa bhrātaram priyam
translated: Rama said:🔽Look, Lākshmana, at the great footprint of the demon.

original: paśya lakṣmaṇa vaidehyāḥ śīrṇāḥ kanakabindavaḥ🔽bhūṣaṇānāṃ hi saumitre mālyāni vividhāni ca
analyzed: paśya lakṣmaṇa vaidehyāḥ śīrṇāḥ kanaka bindavaḥ  bhūṣaṇānām hi saumitre mālyāni vividhāni ca
translated: Look, Lakshmana, the golden ornaments of Vaidehi are scattered🔽and various garlands, O son of Sumitra.

original: taptabindunikāśaiś ca citraiḥ kṣatajabindubhiḥ
analyzed: tapta bindu nikāśaiḥ ca citraiḥ kṣataja bindubhiḥ
translated: And all over the ground is strewn with the variegated drops of the juice of the Kshta trees, resembling drops of molten gold.

original: āvṛtaṃ paśya saumitre sarvato dharaṇītalam
analyzed: āvṛtam paśya saumitre sarvatas dharaṇī talam
translated: Look, O son of Sumitra, the whole ground is covered on all sides.

original: manye lakṣmaṇa vaidehī rākṣasaiḥ kāmarūpibhiḥ
analyzed: manye lakṣmaṇa vaidehī rākṣasaiḥ kāmarūpibhiḥ
translated: I think, O Lakshmana, Vaidehi must have been divided into two parts by the Rakshasas who can assume any form at will,

original: bhittvā bhittvā vibhaktā vā bhakṣitā vā bhaviṣyati🔽tasya nimittaṃ vaidehyā dvayor vivadamānayoḥ🔽babhūva yuddhaṃ saumitre ghoraṃ rākṣasayor iha
analyzed: bhittvā bhittvā vibhaktā vā bhakṣitā vā bhaviṣyati  tasya nimittam vaidehyāḥ dvayoḥ vivadamānayoḥ  babhūva yuddham saumitre ghoram rākṣasayoḥ iha
translated: or must have been devoured by them.🔽For her sake, O son of Sumitra, a terrible fight took place here between two Rakshasas who were disputing.

original: muktāmaṇicitaṃ cedaṃ tapanīyavibhūṣitam
analyzed: muktāmaṇi citam ca idam tapanīya vibhūṣitam
translated: This beautiful bow, O gentle one, adorned with pearls and gems and gold,

original: dharaṇyāṃ patitaṃ saumya kasya bhagnaṃ mahad dhanuḥ
analyzed: dharaṇyām patitam saumya kasya bhagnam mahat dhanuḥ
translated: has fallen on the ground, whose great bow has been broken?

original: taruṇādityasaṃkāśaṃ vaidūryagulikācitam
analyzed: taruṇa āditya saṃkāśam vaidūrya gulikā citam
translated: This golden armour, resembling the rising sun, studded with lapis lazuli beads,

original: viśīrṇaṃ patitaṃ bhūmau kavacaṃ kasya kāñcanam
analyzed: viśīrṇam patitam bhūmau kavacam kasya kāñcanam
translated: has been shattered and fallen on the ground, whose is it?

original: chatraṃ śataśalākaṃ ca divyamālyopaśobhitam
analyzed: chatram śata śalākam ca divya mālya upaśobhitam
translated: This umbrella with a hundred ribs, adorned with celestial garlands,

original: bhagnadaṇḍam idaṃ kasya bhūmau saumya nipātitam
analyzed: bhagna daṇḍam idam kasya bhūmau saumya nipātitam
translated: has its staff broken and fallen on the ground, whose is it, O gentle one?

original: kāñcanoraśchadāś ceme piśācavadanāḥ kharāḥ
analyzed: kāñcana uraśchadāḥ ca ime piśāca vadanāḥ kharāḥ
translated: These asses with faces like flesh-eaters, covered with golden trappings,

original: bhīmarūpā mahākāyāḥ kasya vā nihatā raṇe🔽dīptapāvakasaṃkāśo dyutimān samaradhvajaḥ
analyzed: bhīma rūpāḥ mahā kāyāḥ kasya vā nihatāḥ raṇe  dīpta pāvaka saṃkāśaḥ dyutimān samara dhvajaḥ
translated: Whose are these, killed in battle, having terrible forms and huge bodies?🔽Whose is this banner in the battle, radiant like a blazing fire,

original: apaviddhaś ca bhagnaś ca kasya sāṃgrāmiko rathaḥ
analyzed: apaviddhaḥ ca bhagnaḥ ca kasya sāṃgrāmikaḥ rathaḥ
translated: and whose is this chariot, with its flagstaff and wheels shattered?

original: rathākṣamātrā viśikhās tapanīyavibhūṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: ratha akṣa mātrāḥ viśikhāḥ tapanīya vibhūṣaṇāḥ
translated: These arrows, the size of chariot axles, adorned with gold,

original: kasyeme 'bhihatā bāṇāḥ prakīrṇā ghorakarmaṇaḥ
analyzed: kasya ime bhihatāḥ bāṇāḥ prakīrṇāḥ ghora karmaṇaḥ
translated: whose are these arrows, struck and scattered by the one of terrible deeds?

original: vairaṃ śataguṇaṃ paśya mamedaṃ jīvitāntakam
analyzed: vairam śataguṇam paśya mama idam jīvita antakam
translated: Behold, O Lakṣmaṇa, this hundredfold enmity of mine, which ends in life.

original: sughorahṛdayaiḥ saumya rākṣasaiḥ kāmarūpibhiḥ
analyzed: su ghora hṛdayaiḥ saumya rākṣasaiḥ kāmarūpibhiḥ
translated: By those gentle ones, whose hearts are extremely terrible, Rākṣasas who can assume any form at will,

original: hṛtā mṛtā vā sītā hi bhakṣitā vā tapasvinī
analyzed: hṛtā mṛtā vā sītā hi bhakṣitā vā tapasvinī
translated: Sītā has been either carried away, or killed, or devoured, that poor woman.

original: na dharmas trāyate sītāṃ hriyamāṇāṃ mahāvane
analyzed: na dharmaḥ trāyate sītām hriyamāṇām mahā vane
translated: For dharma does not protect Sītā, who is being carried away in the great forest.

original: bhakṣitāyāṃ hi vaidehyāṃ hṛtāyām api lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: bhakṣitāyām hi vaidehyām hṛtāyām api lakṣmaṇa
translated: When Vaidehī has been devoured or carried away, O Lakṣmaṇa,

original: ke hi loke priyaṃ kartuṃ śaktāḥ saumya mameśvarāḥ
analyzed: ke hi loke priyam kartum śaktāḥ saumya mama īśvarāḥ
translated: Who in the world, O gentle one, are able to do what is dear to me, who are lords?

original: kartāram api lokānāṃ śūraṃ karuṇavedinam
analyzed: kartāram api lokānām śūram karuṇa vedinam
translated: Even the creator of the worlds, the hero who knows compassion,

original: ajñānād avamanyeran sarvabhūtāni lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: ajñānāt avamanyeran sarva bhūtāni lakṣmaṇa
translated: Out of ignorance, all beings would despise me, O Lakṣmaṇa.

original: mṛduṃ lokahite yuktaṃ dāntaṃ karuṇavedinam
analyzed: mṛdum loka hite yuktam dāntam karuṇa vedinam
translated: One who is gentle, engaged in the welfare of the world, self-controlled, who knows compassion,

original: nirvīrya iti manyante nūnaṃ māṃ tridaśeśvarāḥ
analyzed: nirvīryaḥ iti manyante nūnam mām tridaśa īśvarāḥ
translated: The lords of the thirty gods surely think of me as powerless.

original: māṃ prāpya hi guṇo doṣaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ paśya lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: mām prāpya hi guṇaḥ doṣaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ paśya lakṣmaṇa
translated: Behold, O Lakshmana, that virtue has become vice for me, having obtained me.

original: adyaiva sarvabhūtānāṃ rakṣasām abhavāya ca
analyzed: adya eva sarva bhūtānām rakṣasām abhavāya ca
translated: Even today, for the destruction of all beings and demons,

original: saṃhṛtyaiva śaśijyotsnāṃ mahān sūrya ivoditaḥ
analyzed: saṃhṛtya eva śaśi jyotsnām mahān sūryaḥ iva uditaḥ
translated: having withdrawn the moonlight of the moon, I will rise like a great sun.

original: naiva yakṣā na gandharvā na piśācā na rākṣasāḥ
analyzed: na eva yakṣāḥ na gandharvāḥ na piśācāḥ na rākṣasāḥ
translated: Neither Yakshas, nor Gandharvas, nor Pishachas, nor Rakshasas,

original: kiṃnarā vā manuṣyā vā sukhaṃ prāpsyanti lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: kiṃnarāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā sukham prāpsyanti lakṣmaṇa
translated: nor Kinnaras, nor humans, O Lakshmana, will obtain happiness.

original: mamāstrabāṇasaṃpūrṇam ākāśaṃ paśya lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: mama astra bāṇa saṃpūrṇam ākāśam paśya lakṣmaṇa
translated: Behold the sky, O Lakshmana, filled with my weapons and arrows,

original: niḥsaṃpātaṃ kariṣyāmi hy adya trailokyacāriṇām🔽saṃniruddhagrahagaṇam āvāritaniśākaram
analyzed: niḥsaṃpātam kariṣyāmi hi adya trailokya cāriṇām  saṃniruddha graha gaṇam āvārita niśākaram
translated: I will make it free from obstacles for the wanderers of the three worlds today.🔽With the multitude of planets restrained, the moon obstructed,

original: vipranaṣṭānalamarudbhāskaradyutisaṃvṛtam🔽vinirmathitaśailāgraṃ śuṣyamāṇajalāśayam
analyzed: vipranaṣṭa anala marut bhāskara dyuti saṃvṛtam  vinirmathita śaila agram śuṣyamāṇa jalāśayam
translated: the fire, wind, and sun's radiance destroyed,🔽the peaks of mountains churned, the water reservoirs drying up,

original: dhvastadrumalatāgulmaṃ vipraṇāśitasāgaram
analyzed: dhvasta druma latā gulmam vipraṇāśita sāgaram
translated: the trees, creepers, and shrubs destroyed, the oceans destroyed,

original: na tāṃ kuśalinīṃ sītāṃ pradāsyanti mameśvarāḥ
analyzed: na tām kuśalinīm sītām pradāsyanti mama īśvarāḥ
translated: the lords will not give me that well-being Sita.

original: asmin muhūrte saumitre mama drakṣyanti vikramam
analyzed: asmin muhūrte saumitre mama drakṣyanti vikramam
translated: In this very moment, O son of Sumitra, they will see my valor.

original: nākāśam utpatiṣyanti sarvabhūtāni lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: na ākāśam utpatiṣyanti sarva bhūtāni lakṣmaṇa
translated: All beings will not fly up into the sky, O Lakshmana,

original: mama cāpaguṇān muktair bāṇajālair nirantaram
