analyzed: mama cāpa guṇān muktaiḥ bāṇa jālaiḥ nirantaram
translated: with nets of arrows released from the strings of my bow, continuously.

original: arditaṃ mama nārācair dhvastabhrāntamṛgadvijam
analyzed: arditam mama nārācaiḥ dhvasta bhrānta mṛga dvijam
translated: The animals and birds are scattered and confused by my iron arrows.

original: samākulam amaryādaṃ jagat paśyādya lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: samākulam amaryādam jagat paśya adya lakṣmaṇa
translated: Look, Lakshmana, at the world today, agitated and without boundaries.

original: ākarṇapūrṇair iṣubhir jīvalokaṃ durāvaraiḥ🔽kariṣye maithilīhetor apiśācam arākṣasaṃ🔽mama roṣaprayuktānāṃ sāyakānāṃ balaṃ surāḥ
analyzed: ākarṇapūrṇaiḥ iṣubhiḥ jīva lokam durāvaraiḥ  kariṣye maithilī hetoḥ apiśācam arākṣasam  mama roṣa prayuktānām sāyakānām balam surāḥ
translated: With arrows filled to the ear, difficult to resist,🔽I will make the world of the living devoid of demons and spirits for the sake of Maithilee.

original: drakṣyanty adya vimuktānām amarṣād dūragāminām🔽naiva devā na daiteyā na piśācā na rākṣasāḥ
analyzed: drakṣyanti adya vimuktānām amarṣāt dūra gāminām  na eva devāḥ na daiteyāḥ na piśācāḥ na rākṣasāḥ
translated: The gods will see today the power of my arrows released out of anger, traveling far.

original: bhaviṣyanti mama krodhāt trailokye vipraṇāśite
analyzed: bhaviṣyanti mama krodhāt trailokye vipraṇāśite
translated: Through my anger, the three worlds will be destroyed, and there will be no gods, demons, pishachas, or rakshasas.

original: devadānavayakṣāṇāṃ lokā ye rakṣasām api
analyzed: deva dānava yakṣāṇām lokāḥ ye rakṣasām api
translated: The worlds of gods, demons, and yakshas, as well as the rakshasas,

original: bahudhā nipatiṣyanti bāṇaughaiḥ śakulīkṛtāḥ
analyzed: bahudhā nipatiṣyanti bāṇa oghaiḥ śakulīkṛtāḥ
translated: will be shattered in many ways by the mass of my arrows.

original: nirmaryādān imāṃl lokān kariṣyāmy adya sāyakaiḥ
analyzed: nirmaryādān imān lokān kariṣyāmi adya sāyakaiḥ
translated: With my arrows, I will make these worlds devoid of boundaries today.

original: yathā jarā yathā mṛtyur yathākālo yathāvidhiḥ
analyzed: yathā jarā yathā mṛtyuḥ yathā kālaḥ yathā vidhiḥ
translated: Just as old age, death, time, and rules

original: nityaṃ na pratihanyante sarvabhūteṣu lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: nityam na pratihanyante sarva bhūteṣu lakṣmaṇa
translated: are always irresistible to all beings, O Lakshmana,

original: tathāhaṃ krodhasaṃyukto na nivāryo 'smy asaṃśayam🔽pureva me cārudatīm aninditāṃ /
analyzed: tathā aham krodha saṃyuktaḥ na nivāryaḥ smi asaṃśayam  purā iva me cārudatīm aninditām
translated: in the same way, I am undoubtedly irresistible when filled with anger.

original: diśanti sītāṃ yadi nādya maithilīm
analyzed: diśanti sītām yadi na adya maithilīm
translated: If they do not give me Sita, the unblemished Maithilee with beautiful teeth, today,🔽I will destroy the entire world of the rakshasas with my sharp arrows.

original: sadevagandharvamanuṣya pannagaṃ /
analyzed: sa deva gandharva manuṣya pannagam
translated: The world with its gods, gandharvas, humans, and serpents,

original: jagat saśailaṃ parivartayāmy aham
analyzed: jagat sa śailam parivartayāmi aham
translated: And this mountain along with its trees and forests.

original: tapyamānaṃ tathā rāmaṃ sītāharaṇakarśitam
analyzed: tapyamānam tathā rāmam sītā āharaṇa karśitam
translated: Rama, who was tormented by the abduction of Sita,

original: lokānām abhave yuktaṃ sāmvartakam ivānalam
analyzed: lokānām abhave yuktam sāmvartakam iva analam
translated: Was engaged in the destruction of the worlds, like the fire of destruction.

original: vīkṣamāṇaṃ dhanuḥ sajyaṃ niḥśvasantaṃ muhur muhuḥ
analyzed: vīkṣamāṇam dhanuḥ sajyam niḥśvasantam muhur muhur
translated: He was looking at the strung bow and sighing again and again,

original: hantukāmaṃ paśuṃ rudraṃ kruddhaṃ dakṣakratau yathā
analyzed: hantu kāmam paśum rudram kruddham dakṣa kratau yathā
translated: Desiring to kill, like Rudra, the angry one at the sacrifice of Daksha.

original: adṛṣṭapūrvaṃ saṃkruddhaṃ dṛṣṭvā rāmaṃ sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: a dṛṣṭa pūrvam saṃkruddham dṛṣṭvā rāmam sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Lakshmana, seeing Rama angry in a way never seen before,

original: abravīt prāñjalir vākyaṃ mukhena pariśuṣyatā
analyzed: abravīt prāñjaliḥ vākyam mukhena pariśuṣyatā
translated: Spoke with folded hands, his face dried up:

original: purā bhūtvā mṛdur dāntaḥ sarvabhūtahite rataḥ
analyzed: purā bhūtvā mṛduḥ dāntaḥ sarva bhūta hite rataḥ
translated: Formerly, being gentle, self-controlled, and engaged in the welfare of all beings,

original: na krodhavaśam āpannaḥ prakṛtiṃ hātum arhasi
analyzed: na krodha vaśam āpannaḥ prakṛtim hātum arhasi
translated: You should not fall under the sway of anger and abandon your natural state.

original: candre lakṣṇīḥ prabhā sūrye gatir vāyau bhuvi kṣamā
analyzed: candre lakṣṇīḥ prabhā sūrye gatiḥ vāyau bhuvi kṣamā
translated: The moon has its beauty, the sun its radiance, the wind its motion, and the earth its forgiveness.

original: etac ca niyataṃ sarvaṃ tvayi cānuttamaṃ yaśaḥ
analyzed: etat ca niyatam sarvam tvayi ca anuttamam yaśaḥ
translated: And all this is certainly supreme in you, along with unsurpassed fame.

original: na tu jānāmi kasyāyaṃ bhagnaḥ sāṃgrāmiko rathaḥ
analyzed: na tu jānāmi kasya ayam bhagnaḥ sāṃgrāmikaḥ rathaḥ
translated: But I do not know whose this chariot, ready for battle, has been broken,

original: kena vā kasya vā hetoḥ sāyudhaḥ saparicchadaḥ
analyzed: kena vā kasya vā hetoḥ sa āyudhaḥ sa paricchadaḥ
translated: Or by whom or for whose sake, with weapons and equipment.

original: khuranemikṣataś cāyaṃ sikto rudhirabindubhiḥ
analyzed: khura nemi kṣataḥ ca ayam siktaḥ rudhira bindubhiḥ
translated: This ground is torn up by the hooves and wheels, sprinkled with drops of blood,🔽And strewn with the bodies of men, horses, and elephants, as if dancing.

original: deśo nivṛttasaṃgrāmaḥ sughoraḥ pārthivātmaja
analyzed: deśaḥ nivṛtta saṃgrāmaḥ su ghoraḥ pārthiva ātmaja
translated: O son of a king, this country is the site of a terrible battle.

original: ekasya tu vimardo 'yaṃ na dvayor vadatāṃ vara
analyzed: ekasya tu vimardaḥ yam na dvayoḥ vadatām vara
translated: But this is a dispute between one person, not two, O best of speakers.

original: na hi vṛttaṃ hi paśyāmi balasya mahataḥ padam
analyzed: na hi vṛttam hi paśyāmi balasya mahataḥ padam
translated: I do not see the presence of a large army here.

original: naikasya tu kṛte lokān vināśayitum arhasi
analyzed: na ekasya tu kṛte lokān vināśayitum arhasi
translated: It is not proper for you to destroy the worlds for the sake of one person.

original: yuktadaṇḍā hi mṛdavaḥ praśāntā vasudhādhipāḥ
analyzed: yukta daṇḍāḥ hi mṛdavaḥ praśāntāḥ vasudhā adhipāḥ
translated: Kings who are mild and wield the rod of punishment properly are peaceful.

original: sadā tvaṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ śaraṇyaḥ paramā gatiḥ
analyzed: sadā tvam sarva bhūtānām śaraṇyaḥ paramā gatiḥ
translated: You are always the refuge and the supreme goal of all beings.

original: ko nu dārapraṇāśaṃ te sādhu manyeta rāghava
analyzed: kaḥ nu dāra praṇāśam te sādhu manyeta rāghava
translated: O Rāghava, who would consider the loss of your wife to be good?

original: saritaḥ sāgarāḥ śailā devagandharvadānavāḥ
analyzed: saritaḥ sāgarāḥ śailāḥ deva gandharva dānavāḥ
translated: Rivers, oceans, mountains, gods, gandharvas, and demons

original: nālaṃ te vipriyaṃ kartuṃ dīkṣitasyeva sādhavaḥ
analyzed: na alam te vipriyam kartum dīkṣitasya iva sādhavaḥ
translated: are not able to do anything unpleasant to you, like virtuous people to an initiated person.

original: yena rājan hṛtā sītā tam anveṣitum arhasi
analyzed: yena rājan hṛtā sītā tam anveṣitum arhasi
translated: O king, you should search for the one who has abducted Sita.

original: maddvitīyo dhanuṣpāṇiḥ sahāyaiḥ paramarṣibhiḥ
analyzed: mad dvitīyaḥ dhanuṣpāṇiḥ sahāyaiḥ parama ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: With me as your second, with bow in hand, and with the great sages as your companions,

original: samudraṃ ca viceṣyāmaḥ parvatāṃś ca vanāni ca
analyzed: samudram ca viceṣyāmaḥ parvatān ca vanāni ca
translated: we will search the ocean, mountains, and forests,

original: guhāś ca vividhā ghorā nalinīḥ pārvatīś ca ha
analyzed: guhāḥ ca vividhāḥ ghorāḥ nalinīḥ pārvatīḥ ca ha
translated: and various terrible caves, lotus ponds, and mountain streams.

original: devagandharvalokāṃś ca viceṣyāmaḥ samāhitāḥ
analyzed: deva gandharva lokān ca viceṣyāmaḥ samāhitāḥ
translated: We will search the worlds of gods and gandharvas with concentration,

original: yāvan nādhigamiṣyāmas tava bhāryāpahāriṇam
analyzed: yāvat na adhigamiṣyāmaḥ tava bhāryā apahāriṇam
translated: until we find the one who has abducted your wife.

original: na cet sāmnā pradāsyanti patnīṃ te tridaśeśvarāḥ
analyzed: na ced sāmnā pradāsyanti patnīm te tridaśa īśvarāḥ
translated: If the lords of the thirty gods do not return your wife through conciliation,

original: kosalendra tataḥ paścāt prāptakālaṃ kariṣyasi🔽śīlena sāmnā vinayena sītāṃ /
analyzed: kosala indra tatas paścāt prāpta kālam kariṣyasi  śīlena sāmnā vinayena sītām
translated: then, O lord of Kosala, you should do what is proper afterwards.

original: nayena na prāpsyasi cen narendra
analyzed: nayena na prāpsyasi ced narendra
translated: If you do not obtain Sita through good conduct, conciliation and humility,

original: tataḥ samutsādaya hemapuṅkhair /
analyzed: tatas samutsādaya hema puṅkhaiḥ
translated: then, O lord of men, destroy them with a flood of arrows

original: mahendravajrapratimaiḥ śaraughaiḥ
analyzed: mahā indra vajra pratimaiḥ śara oghaiḥ
translated: having golden shafts, resembling the great Indra's thunderbolt.

original: taṃ tathā śokasaṃtaptaṃ vilapantam anāthavat
analyzed: tam tathā śoka saṃtaptam vilapantam anātha vat
translated: Thus lamenting like one helpless, burning with grief,

original: mohena mahatāviṣṭaṃ paridyūnam acetanam🔽tataḥ saumitrir āśvāsya muhūrtād iva lakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: mohena mahatā āviṣṭam paridyūnam acetanam  tatas saumitriḥ āśvāsya muhūrtāt iva lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: overcome by great delusion, miserable and senseless,🔽then Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra, consoled him

original: rāmaṃ saṃbodhayām āsa caraṇau cābhipīḍayan
analyzed: rāmam saṃbodhayām āsa caraṇau ca abhipīḍayan
translated: and after a while addressed Rama, pressing his feet.

original: mahatā tapasā rāma mahatā cāpi karmaṇā
analyzed: mahatā tapasā rāma mahatā ca api karmaṇā
translated: O Rama, by great austerities and also by great deeds,

original: rājñā daśarathenāsīl labdho 'mṛtam ivāmaraiḥ
analyzed: rājñā daśarathena āsīt labdhaḥ mṛtam iva amaraiḥ
translated: King Dasharatha obtained you, as the immortals obtain nectar.

original: tava caiva guṇair baddhas tvadviyogān mahīpatiḥ
analyzed: tava ca eva guṇaiḥ baddhaḥ tvad viyogāt mahīpatiḥ
translated: And the king, bound by your qualities, due to separation from you,

original: rājā devatvam āpanno bharatasya yathā śrutam
analyzed: rājā deva tvam āpannaḥ bharatasya yathā śrutam
translated: the king attained divinity, as I have heard from Bharata.

original: yadi duḥkham idaṃ prāptaṃ kākutstha na sahiṣyase
analyzed: yadi duḥkham idam prāptam kākutstha na sahiṣyase
translated: If you, Kakutstha, cannot bear this grief that has befallen you,

original: prākṛtaś cālpasattvaś ca itaraḥ kaḥ sahiṣyati
analyzed: prākṛtaḥ ca alpa sattvaḥ ca itaraḥ kaḥ sahiṣyati
translated: then who else, ordinary and of little fortitude, will be able to bear it?

original: duḥkhito hi bhavāṃl lokāṃs tejasā yadi dhakṣyate
analyzed: duḥkhitaḥ hi bhavān lokān tejasā yadi dhakṣyate
translated: If you, being miserable, were to consume the worlds with your energy,

original: ārtāḥ prajā naravyāghra kva nu yāsyanti nirvṛtim
analyzed: ārtāḥ prajāḥ nara vyāghra kva nu yāsyanti nirvṛtim
translated: where will the afflicted people find peace, O tiger among men?

original: lokasvabhāva evaiṣa yayātir nahuṣātmajaḥ
analyzed: loka svabhāvaḥ eva eṣa yayātiḥ nahuṣātmajaḥ
translated: This is the nature of the world - Yayati, the son of Nahusha,

original: gataḥ śakreṇa sālokyam anayas taṃ samaspṛśat
analyzed: gataḥ śakreṇa sālokyam anayaḥ tam samaspṛśat
translated: attained heaven with Shakra, but misfortune touched him.

original: maharṣayo vasiṣṭhas tu yaḥ pitur naḥ purohitaḥ
analyzed: mahā ṛṣayaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ tu yaḥ pituḥ naḥ purohitaḥ
translated: The great sage Vasishtha, who was our father's priest,

original: ahnā putraśataṃ jajñe tathaivāsya punar hatam
analyzed: ahnā putra śatam jajñe tathā eva asya punar hatam
translated: had a hundred sons born in a day, and then they were killed again.

original: yā ceyaṃ jagato mātā devī lokanamaskṛtā
analyzed: yā ca iyam jagataḥ mātā devī loka namaskṛtā
translated: And this goddess, the mother of the world, who is worshipped by the people,

original: asyāś ca calanaṃ bhūmer dṛśyate satyasaṃśrava
analyzed: asyāḥ ca calanam bhūmeḥ dṛśyate satya saṃśrava
translated: and the trembling of this earth, O you who are devoted to truth, is seen.

original: yau cemau jagatāṃ netre yatra sarvaṃ pratiṣṭhitam
analyzed: yau ca imau jagatām netre yatra sarvam pratiṣṭhitam
translated: And these two eyes of the world, in which everything is established,

original: ādityacandrau grahaṇam abhyupetau mahābalau
analyzed: āditya candrau grahaṇam abhyupetau mahā balau
translated: the two mighty luminaries, the sun and the moon, have undergone eclipses.

original: sumahānty api bhūtāni devāś ca puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: su mahānti api bhūtāni devāḥ ca puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: Even the very great beings and the gods, O best of men,

original: na daivasya pramuñcanti sarvabhūtāni dehinaḥ
analyzed: na daivasya pramuñcanti sarva bhūtāni dehinaḥ
translated: do not escape the power of fate, all embodied beings.

original: śakrādiṣv api deveṣu vartamānau nayānayau
analyzed: śakra ādiṣu api deveṣu vartamānau naya anayau
translated: Even among the gods, including Shakra, good policy and bad policy

original: śrūyete naraśārdūla na tvaṃ vyathitum arhasi
analyzed: śrūyete nara śārdūla na tvam vyathitum arhasi
translated: are heard, O tiger among men, you should not be distressed.

original: naṣṭāyām api vaidehyāṃ hṛtāyām api cānagha
analyzed: naṣṭāyām api vaidehyām hṛtāyām api ca anagha
translated: Even if Vaidehi is lost, or even if she is abducted, O sinless one,

original: śocituṃ nārhase vīra yathānyaḥ prākṛtas tathā
analyzed: śocitum nā arhase vīra yathā anyaḥ prākṛtaḥ tathā
translated: O hero, you should not grieve like an ordinary person.

original: tvadvidhā hi na śocanti satataṃ satyadarśinaḥ
analyzed: tvadvidhāḥ hi na śocanti satatam satya darśinaḥ
translated: For people like you, who always see the truth, do not grieve.

original: sumahatsv api kṛcchreṣu rāmānirviṇṇadarśaṇāḥ
analyzed: su mahatsu api kṛcchreṣu rāma anirviṇṇa darśaṇāḥ
translated: Even in very difficult situations, Rama, your vision is not clouded.

original: tattvato hi naraśreṣṭha buddhyā samanucintaya
analyzed: tattvataḥ hi nara śreṣṭha buddhyā samanucintaya
translated: Therefore, O best of men, reflect with your intellect.

original: buddhyā yuktā mahāprājñā vijānanti śubhāśubhe🔽adṛṣṭaguṇadoṣāṇām adhṛtānāṃ ca karmaṇām
analyzed: buddhyā yuktāḥ mahā prājñāḥ vijānanti śubha aśubhe  adṛṣṭa guṇa doṣāṇām adhṛtānām ca karmaṇām
translated: The greatly wise, endowed with intellect, know the good and the bad.🔽The results of actions whose qualities and faults have not been seen, and which have not been undertaken,

original: nāntareṇa kriyāṃ teṣāṃ phalam iṣṭaṃ pravartate
analyzed: na antareṇa kriyām teṣām phalam iṣṭam pravartate
translated: do not occur without the performance of those actions.

original: mām eva hi purā vīra tvam eva bahuṣo 'nvaśāḥ
analyzed: mām eva hi purā vīra tvam eva bahuṣaḥ nvaśāḥ
translated: O hero, in the past you have often instructed me.

original: anuśiṣyād dhi ko nu tvām api sākṣād bṛhaspatiḥ
analyzed: anuśiṣyāt hi kaḥ nu tvām api sākṣāt bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: For who could instruct you, even Brihaspati himself?

original: buddhiś ca te mahāprājña devair api duranvayā
analyzed: buddhiḥ ca te mahā prājña devaiḥ api duranvayā
translated: And your intellect, O greatly wise one, is difficult for even the gods to follow.

original: śokenābhiprasuptaṃ te jñānaṃ saṃbodhayāmy aham🔽divyaṃ ca mānuṣaṃ caivam ātmanaś ca parākramam
analyzed: śokena abhiprasuptam te jñānam saṃbodhayāmi aham  divyam ca mānuṣam ca evam ātmanaḥ ca parākramam
translated: I am arousing the knowledge that has fallen asleep in you due to grief.🔽Considering your own prowess, both divine and human, and the prowess of the bulls of the Ikshvaku lineage,

original: ikṣvākuvṛṣabhāvekṣya yatasva dviṣatāṃ badhe
analyzed: ikṣvāku vṛṣabha avekṣya yatasva dviṣatām badhe
translated: strive to kill the enemies.

original: kiṃ te sarvavināśena kṛtena puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: kim te sarva vināśena kṛtena puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: O best of men, what is the use of destroying everything?

original: tam eva tu ripuṃ pāpaṃ vijñāyoddhartum arhasi
analyzed: tam eva tu ripum pāpam vijñāya uddhartum arhasi
translated: But having recognized that very sinful enemy, you should destroy him.

original: pūrvajo 'py uktamātras tu lakṣmaṇena subhāṣitam
analyzed: pūrvajaḥ pi ukta mātraḥ tu lakṣmaṇena subhāṣitam
translated: But the elder one, as soon as it was spoken by Lakṣmaṇa,

original: sāragrāhī mahāsāraṃ pratijagrāha rāghavaḥ
analyzed: sāra grāhī mahā sāram pratijagrāha rāghavaḥ
translated: Rāghava, the gatherer of the essence, accepted the great essence of the well-spoken words.

original: saṃnigṛhya mahābāhuḥ pravṛddhaṃ kopam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: saṃnigṛhya mahā bāhuḥ pravṛddham kopam ātmanaḥ
translated: The mighty-armed one, having restrained his great and growing anger,

original: avaṣṭabhya dhanuś citraṃ rāmo lakṣmaṇam abravīt
analyzed: avaṣṭabhya dhanuḥ citram rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇam abravīt
translated: and having grasped his wonderful bow, Rāma said to Lakṣmaṇa:

original: kiṃ kariṣyāvahe vatsa kva vā gacchāva lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: kim kariṣyāvahe vatsa kva vā gacchāva lakṣmaṇa
translated: What shall we do, my child? Where shall we go, Lakṣmaṇa?

original: kenopāyena paśyeyaṃ sītām iti vicintaya
analyzed: kena upāyena paśyeyam sītām iti vicintaya
translated: By what means shall I see Sītā? Thus he thought.

original: taṃ tathā paritāpārtaṃ lakṣmaṇo rāmam abravīt
analyzed: tam tathā paritāpa ārtam lakṣmaṇaḥ rāmam abravīt
translated: Lakṣmaṇa said to Rāma, who was thus afflicted with grief:

original: idam eva janasthānaṃ tvam anveṣitum arhasi
analyzed: idam eva janasthānam tvam anveṣitum arhasi
translated: You should search this very Janasthāna,

original: rākṣasair bahubhiḥ kīrṇaṃ nānādrumalatāyutam
analyzed: rākṣasaiḥ bahubhiḥ kīrṇam nānā druma latā yutam
translated: which is crowded with many demons and endowed with various trees and creepers.

original: santīha giridurgāṇi nirdarāḥ kandarāṇi ca
analyzed: santi iha giri durgāṇi nirdarāḥ kandarāṇi ca
translated: Here there are mountain fortresses, caves and caverns,

original: guhāś ca vividhā ghorā nānāmṛgagaṇākulāḥ
analyzed: guhāḥ ca vividhāḥ ghorāḥ nānā mṛga gaṇa ākulāḥ
translated: and various terrible caves inhabited by various herds of animals.

original: āvāsāḥ kiṃnarāṇāṃ ca gandharvabhavanāni ca
analyzed: āvāsāḥ kiṃnarāṇām ca gandharva bhavanāni ca
translated: There are also the abodes of kinnaras and the palaces of gandharvas.

original: tāni yukto mayā sārdhaṃ tvam anveṣitum arhasi
analyzed: tāni yuktaḥ mayā sārdham tvam anveṣitum arhasi
translated: You should search for them together with me.

original: tvadvidho buddhisaṃpannā māhātmāno nararṣabha
analyzed: tvadvidhaḥ buddhi saṃpannāḥ māhātmānaḥ nara ṛṣabha
translated: One like you, endowed with intelligence, a great-souled bull among men,

original: āpatsu na prakampante vāyuvegair ivācalāḥ
analyzed: āpatsu na prakampante vāyu vegaiḥ iva acalāḥ
translated: does not tremble in calamities, like mountains by the force of the wind.

original: ity uktas tad vanaṃ sarvaṃ vicacāra salakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: iti uktaḥ tat vanam sarvam vicacāra sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, he roamed the entire forest with Lakshmana.

original: kruddho rāmaḥ śaraṃ ghoraṃ saṃdhāya dhanuṣi kṣuram
analyzed: kruddhaḥ rāmaḥ śaram ghoram saṃdhāya dhanuṣi kṣuram
translated: Angry, Rama fixed a terrible arrow with a razor-sharp edge to his bow.

original: tataḥ parvatakūṭābhaṃ mahābhāgaṃ dvijottamam
analyzed: tatas parvata kūṭa ābham mahābhāgam dvijottamam
translated: Then he saw the great and fortunate best of birds, resembling the peak of a mountain,

original: dadarśa patitaṃ bhūmau kṣatajārdraṃ jaṭāyuṣam
analyzed: dadarśa patitam bhūmau kṣataja ārdram jaṭāyuṣam
translated: lying on the ground, wet with blood, the vulture Jatayu.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā giriśṛṅgābhaṃ rāmo lakṣmaṇam abravīt
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā giri śṛṅga ābham rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇam abravīt
translated: Seeing him, resembling the peak of a mountain, Rama said to Lakshmana:

original: anena sītā vaidehī bhakṣitā nātra saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: anena sītā vaidehī bhakṣitā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: By him, Sita Vaidehi has been devoured, there is no doubt about it.

original: gṛdhrarūpam idaṃ vyaktaṃ rakṣo bhramati kānanam
analyzed: gṛdhra rūpam idam vyaktam rakṣaḥ bhramati kānanam
translated: This is clearly a demon in the form of a vulture roaming the forest.

original: bhakṣayitvā viśālākṣīm āste sītāṃ yathāsukham🔽enaṃ vadhiṣye dīptāgrair ghorair bāṇair ajihmagaiḥ
analyzed: bhakṣayitvā viśāla akṣīm āste sītām yathāsukham  enam vadhiṣye dīpta agraiḥ ghoraiḥ bāṇaiḥ a jihma gaiḥ
translated: Having devoured the large-eyed Sita, it is staying as it pleases.🔽I will kill it with my sharp, terrible, straight-flying arrows.

original: ity uktvābhyapatad gṛdhraṃ saṃdhāya dhanuṣi kṣuram
analyzed: iti uktvā abhyapatat gṛdhram saṃdhāya dhanuṣi kṣuram
translated: Saying this, he rushed at the vulture, fixing a razor-sharp arrow to his bow,

original: kruddho rāmaḥ samudrāntāṃ cālayann iva medinīm
analyzed: kruddhaḥ rāmaḥ samudra antām cālayan iva medinīm
translated: angry Rama, as if shaking the earth with its oceans.

original: taṃ dīnadīnayā vācā saphenaṃ rudhiraṃ vaman
analyzed: tam dīna dīnayā vācā sa phenam rudhiram vaman
translated: Vomiting froth and blood with a piteous voice,

original: abhyabhāṣata pakṣī tu rāmaṃ daśarathātmajam
analyzed: abhyabhāṣata pakṣī tu rāmam daśaratha ātmajam
translated: the bird spoke to Rama, the son of Dasharatha:

original: yām oṣadhim ivāyuṣmann anveṣasi mahāvane
analyzed: yām oṣadhim iva āyuṣman mahā vane
translated: O long-lived one, the herb you are searching for in the great forest,

original: sā devī mama ca prāṇā rāvaṇenobhayaṃ hṛtam
analyzed: sā devī mama ca prāṇāḥ rāvaṇena ubhayam hṛtam
translated: that goddess and my life have both been taken away by Ravana.

original: tvayā virahitā devī lakṣmaṇena ca rāghava🔽hriyamāṇā mayā dṛṣṭā rāvaṇena balīyasā
analyzed: tvayā virahitā devī lakṣmaṇena ca rāghava  hriyamāṇā mayā dṛṣṭā rāvaṇena balīyasā
translated: O Raghava, I saw the goddess Sita, separated from you and Lakshmana,🔽being carried away by the powerful Ravana.

original: sītām abhyavapan no 'haṃ rāvaṇaś ca raṇe mayā
analyzed: sītām abhyavapat naḥ ham rāvaṇaḥ ca raṇe mayā
translated: I attacked Sita and Ravana in the battle,

original: vidhvaṃsitarathacchatraḥ pātito dharaṇītale
analyzed: vidhvaṃsita ratha chatraḥ pātitaḥ dharaṇī tale
translated: and his chariot and umbrella were destroyed, and he was brought down to the ground.

original: etad asya dhanur bhagnam etad asya śarāvaram
analyzed: etat asya dhanuḥ bhagnam etat asya śarāvaram
translated: This is his broken bow, this is his quiver,

original: ayam asya raṇe rāma bhagnaḥ sāṃgrāmiko rathaḥ
analyzed: ayam asya raṇe rāma bhagnaḥ sāṃgrāmikaḥ rathaḥ
translated: and this is his battle chariot destroyed by me in the war, O Rama.

original: pariśrāntasya me pakṣau chittvā khaḍgena rāvaṇaḥ
analyzed: pariśrāntasya me pakṣau chittvā khaḍgena rāvaṇaḥ
translated: When I was exhausted, Ravana cut off my wings with his sword,

original: sītām ādāya vaidehīm utpapāta vihāyasaṃ
analyzed: sītām ādāya vaidehīm utpapāta vihāyasam
translated: and taking Vaidehi Sita, he flew up into the sky.

original: rakṣasā nihataṃ pūrvma na māṃ hantuṃ tvam arhasi
analyzed: rakṣasā nihatam pūrvma na mām hantum tvam arhasi
translated: I was previously killed by a rakshasa, you should not kill me again.

original: rāmas tasya tu vijñāya sītāsaktāṃ priyāṃ kathām
analyzed: rāmaḥ tasya tu vijñāya sītā āsaktām priyām kathām
translated: Rama, having understood the story of his beloved Sita,

original: gṛdhrarājaṃ pariṣvajya ruroda sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: gṛdhra rājam pariṣvajya ruroda sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: embraced the king of vultures and wept with Lakshmana.

original: ekam ekāyane durge niḥśvasantaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: ekam ekāyane durge niḥśvasantam katham cana
translated: Seeing him breathing with difficulty, alone in the impassable forest,

original: samīkṣya duḥkhito rāmaḥ saumitrim idam abravīt
analyzed: samīkṣya duḥkhitaḥ rāmaḥ saumitrim idam abravīt
translated: the sorrowful Rama said this to Lakshmana:

original: rājyād bhraṃśo vane vāsaḥ sītā naṣṭā hato dvijaḥ
analyzed: rājyāt bhraṃśaḥ vane vāsaḥ sītā naṣṭā hataḥ dvijaḥ
translated: Loss of kingdom, dwelling in the forest, Sita lost, the bird killed -

original: īdṛśīyaṃ mamālakṣmīr nirdahed api pāvakam
analyzed: īdṛśī iyam mama alakṣmīḥ nirdahet api pāvakam
translated: this misfortune of mine would burn even fire.

original: saṃpūrṇam api ced adya pratareyaṃ mahodadhim
analyzed: saṃpūrṇam api ced adya pratareyam mahā udadhim
translated: Even if I were to cross the great ocean today,

original: so 'pi nūnaṃ mamālakṣmyā viśuṣyet saritāṃ patiḥ
analyzed: saḥ nūnam mama alakṣmyāḥ viśuṣyet saritām patiḥ
translated: that lord of rivers would surely dry up due to my misfortune.

original: nāsty abhāgyataro loke matto 'smin sacarācare
analyzed: na asti abhāgyataraḥ loke mattaḥ smin sacarācare
translated: There is no one more unfortunate in this world, with its moving and unmoving beings, than me,

original: yeneyaṃ mahatī prāptā mayā vyasanavāgurā
analyzed: yena iyam mahatī prāptā mayā vyasana vāgurā
translated: by whom this great snare of calamity has been brought upon me.

original: ayaṃ pitṛvayasyo me gṛdhrarājo jarānvitaḥ
analyzed: ayam pitṛ vayasyaḥ me gṛdhra rājaḥ jarā anvitaḥ
translated: This king of vultures, an old friend of my father,

original: śete vinihato bhūmau mama bhāgyaviparyayāt
analyzed: śete vinihataḥ bhūmau mama bhāgya viparyayāt
translated: lies slain on the ground, due to the reversal of my fortune.

original: ity evam uktvā bahuśo rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: iti evam uktvā bahuśas rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Having spoken thus many times, Raghava, along with Lakshmana,

original: jaṭāyuṣaṃ ca pasparśa pitṛsnehaṃ nidarśayan🔽nikṛttapakṣaṃ rudhirāvasiktaṃ /
analyzed: jaṭāyuṣam ca pasparśa pitṛ sneham nidarśayan  nikṛtta pakṣam rudhira avasiktam
translated: touched Jatayu, displaying paternal affection.🔽The king of vultures, his wings cut off, drenched in blood,

original: taṃ gṛdhrarājaṃ parirabhya rāmaḥ
analyzed: tam gṛdhra rājam parirabhya rāmaḥ
translated: Rama embraced that king of vultures

original: kva maithili prāṇasamā mameti /
analyzed: kva maithili prāṇa samā mama iti
translated: and cried out, Where is Maithili, dear to me as my life?

original: vimucya vācaṃ nipapāta bhūmau
analyzed: vimucya vācam nipapāta bhūmau
translated: and fell down on the ground.

original: rāmaḥ prekṣya tu taṃ gṛdhraṃ bhuvi raudreṇa pātitam
analyzed: rāmaḥ prekṣya tu tam gṛdhram bhuvi raudreṇa pātitam
translated: Rama, seeing that vulture fallen on the ground by the terrible blow,

original: saumitriṃ mitrasaṃpannam idaṃ vacanam abravīt
analyzed: saumitrim mitra saṃpannam idam vacanam abravīt
translated: spoke these words to Lakshmana, endowed with friends:

original: mamāyaṃ nūnam artheṣu yatamāno vihaṃgamaḥ
analyzed: mama ayam nūnam artheṣu yatamānaḥ vihaṃgamaḥ
translated: This bird, no doubt, was striving for my sake

original: rākṣasena hataḥ saṃkhye prāṇāṃs tyajati dustyajān
analyzed: rākṣasena hataḥ saṃkhye prāṇān tyajati dustyajān
translated: and is being killed by the demon in the battle, giving up his life, so difficult to give up.

original: ayam asya śarīre 'smin prāṇo lakṣmaṇa vidyate
analyzed: ayam asya śarīre smin prāṇaḥ lakṣmaṇa vidyate
translated: O Lakshmana, this is the life in his body.

original: tathā svaravihīno 'yaṃ viklavaṃ samudīkṣate
analyzed: tathā svara vihīnaḥ yam viklavam samudīkṣate
translated: And he looks distressed, his voice is gone.

original: jaṭāyo yadi śaknoṣi vākyaṃ vyāharituṃ punaḥ
analyzed: jaṭāyo yadi śaknoṣi vākyam vyāharitum punar
translated: O Jatayu, if you can speak again,

original: sītām ākhyāhi bhadraṃ te vadham ākhyāhi cātmanaḥ
analyzed: sītām ākhyāhi bhadram te vadham ākhyāhi ca ātmanaḥ
translated: tell me about Sita, and about your own death, good betide you.

original: kiṃnimitto 'harat sītāṃ rāvaṇas tasya kiṃ mayā
analyzed: kiṃnimittaḥ harat sītām rāvaṇaḥ tasya kim mayā
translated: Why did Ravana abduct Sita? What wrong did I do to him,

original: aparāddhaṃ tu yaṃ dṛṣṭvā rāvaṇena hṛtā priyā
analyzed: aparāddham tu yam dṛṣṭvā rāvaṇena hṛtā priyā
translated: seeing which Ravana abducted my beloved?

original: kathaṃ tac candrasaṃkāśaṃ mukham āsīn manoharam
analyzed: katham tat candra saṃkāśam mukham āsīt manoharam
translated: How was that moon-like face, captivating?

original: sītayā kāni coktāni tasmin kāle dvijottama
analyzed: sītayā kāni ca uktāni tasmin kāle dvijottama
translated: What did Sita say at that time, O best of Brahmins?

original: kathaṃvīryaḥ kathaṃrūpaḥ kiṃkarmā sa ca rākṣasaḥ
analyzed: kathaṃvīryaḥ kathaṃrūpaḥ kiṃkarmā sa ca rākṣasaḥ
translated: What was the strength of that Rakshasa, what was his form, what was his deed?

original: kva cāsya bhavanaṃ tāta brūhi me paripṛcchataḥ
analyzed: kva ca asya bhavanam tāta brūhi me paripṛcchataḥ
translated: Where is his abode, O father? Tell me, as I ask.

original: tam udvīkṣyātha dīnātmā vilapantam anantaram
analyzed: tam udvīkṣya atha dīna ātmā vilapantam anantaram
translated: Then, seeing him lamenting piteously afterwards,

original: vācātisannayā rāmaṃ jaṭāyur idam abravīt
analyzed: vācā atisannayā rāmam jaṭāyuḥ idam abravīt
translated: Jatayu said this to Rama in a very distressed voice:

original: sā hṛtā rākṣasendreṇa rāvaṇena vihāyasā
analyzed: sā hṛtā rākṣasa indreṇa rāvaṇena vihāyasā
translated: She was carried away by Ravana, the lord of the Rakshasas, through the sky,

original: māyām āsthāya vipulāṃ vātadurdinasaṃkulām
analyzed: māyām āsthāya vipulām vāta durdina saṃkulām
translated: resorting to a great illusion, with a windstorm and bad weather.🔽O father, while I was exhausted, the night-wanderer,

original: pariśrāntasya me tāta pakṣau chittvā niśācaraḥ
analyzed: pariśrāntasya me tāta pakṣau chittvā niśācaraḥ
translated: having cut off my wings,

original: sītām ādāya vaidehīṃ prayāto dakṣiṇā mukhaḥ
analyzed: sītām ādāya vaidehīm prayātaḥ dakṣiṇā mukhaḥ
translated: Taking Sita of Videha, he went towards the south.

original: uparudhyanti me prāṇā dṛṣṭir bhramati rāghava
analyzed: uparudhyanti me prāṇāḥ dṛṣṭiḥ bhramati rāghava
translated: My life-breaths are obstructed, and my vision is whirling, O Raghava.

original: paśyāmi vṛkṣān sauvarṇān uśīrakṛtamūrdhajān
analyzed: paśyāmi vṛkṣān sauvarṇān uśīra kṛta mūrdhajān
translated: I see golden trees with their tops made of ushira.

original: yena yāti muhūrtena sītām ādāya rāvaṇaḥ
analyzed: yena yāti muhūrtena sītām ādāya rāvaṇaḥ
translated: In the time it takes to go there, Ravana will take Sita away.

original: vipranaṣṭaṃ dhanaṃ kṣipraṃ tat svāmipratipadyate
analyzed: vipranaṣṭam dhanam kṣipram tat svāmī pratipadyate
translated: Wealth that is lost is quickly recovered by its owner.

original: vindo nāma muhūrto 'sau sa ca kākutstha nābudhat
analyzed: vindaḥ nāma muhūrtaḥ sau sa ca kākutstha na abudhat
translated: That is the Muhurta named Vinda, but Kakutstha did not know it.

original: jhaṣavad baḍiśaṃ gṛhya kṣipram eva vinaśyati
analyzed: jhaṣa vat baḍiśam gṛhya kṣipram eva vinaśyati
translated: Like a fish that swallows a hook, he will soon be destroyed.

original: na ca tvayā vyathā kāryā janakasya sutāṃ prati
analyzed: na ca tvayā vyathā kāryā janakasya sutām prati
translated: And you should not be distressed about Janaka's daughter.

original: vaidehyā raṃsyase kṣipraṃ hatvā taṃ rākṣasaṃ raṇe
analyzed: vaidehyā raṃsyase kṣipram hatvā tam rākṣasam raṇe
translated: You will soon enjoy Vaidehi after killing that demon in battle.

original: asaṃmūḍhasya gṛdhrasya rāmaṃ pratyanubhāṣataḥ
analyzed: asaṃmūḍhasya gṛdhrasya rāmam pratyanubhāṣataḥ
translated: As the unconfused vulture spoke to Rama,

original: āsyāt susrāva rudhiraṃ mriyamāṇasya sāmiṣam
analyzed: āsyāt susrāva rudhiram mriyamāṇasya sa āmiṣam
translated: blood mixed with flesh oozed from his mouth as he was dying.

original: putro viśravasaḥ sākṣād bhrātā vaiśravaṇasya ca
analyzed: putraḥ viśravasaḥ sākṣāt bhrātā vaiśravaṇasya ca
translated: He was the son of Vishrava himself, and the brother of Vaishravana.

original: ity uktvā durlabhān prāṇān mumoca patageśvaraḥ
analyzed: iti uktvā durlabhān prāṇān mumoca pataga īśvaraḥ
translated: Having said this, the lord of birds gave up his difficult-to-obtain life.

original: brūhi brūhīti rāmasya bruvāṇasya kṛtāñjaleḥ
analyzed: brūhi brūhi iti rāmasya bruvāṇasya kṛta añjaleḥ
translated: As Rama, with folded hands, kept saying Speak, speak,

original: tyaktvā śarīraṃ gṛdhrasya jagmuḥ prāṇā vihāyasaṃ
analyzed: tyaktvā śarīram gṛdhrasya jagmuḥ prāṇāḥ vihāyasam
translated: the life-breaths of the vulture, having left his body, went up into the sky.

original: sa nikṣipya śiro bhūmau prasārya caraṇau tadā
analyzed: sa nikṣipya śiraḥ bhūmau prasārya caraṇau tadā
translated: Having placed his head on the ground and stretched out his feet,

original: vikṣipya ca śarīraṃ svaṃ papāta dharaṇītale
analyzed: vikṣipya ca śarīram svam papāta dharaṇī tale
translated: and having thrown his body down, he fell on the ground.

original: taṃ gṛdhraṃ prekṣya tāmrākṣaṃ gatāsum acalopamam
analyzed: tam gṛdhram prekṣya tāmra akṣam gatāsum acala upamam
translated: Seeing that vulture with copper-colored eyes, lifeless and immovable,

original: rāmaḥ subahubhir duḥkhair dīnaḥ saumitrim abravīt
analyzed: rāmaḥ su bahubhiḥ duḥkhaiḥ dīnaḥ saumitrim abravīt
translated: Rama, distressed with great sorrow, spoke to Sumitra's son:

original: bahūni rakṣasāṃ vāse varṣāṇi vasatā sukham
analyzed: bahūni rakṣasām vāse varṣāṇi vasata sukham
translated: For many years, while living happily in Dandakaranya, the abode of many demons,

original: anena daṇḍakāraṇye vicīrṇam iha pakṣiṇā
analyzed: anena daṇḍaka araṇye vicīrṇam iha pakṣiṇā
translated: this bird roamed here.

original: anekavārṣiko yas tu cirakālaṃ samutthitaḥ
analyzed: aneka vārṣikaḥ yaḥ tu cira kālam samutthitaḥ
translated: He who lived for many years, for a long time,

original: so 'yam adya hataḥ śete kālo hi duratikramaḥ
analyzed: saḥ yam adya hataḥ śete kālaḥ hi duratikramaḥ
translated: he is lying dead today. Time is indeed irresistible.

original: paśya lakṣmaṇa gṛdhro 'yam upakārī hataś ca me
analyzed: paśya lakṣmaṇa gṛdhraḥ yam upakārī hataḥ ca me
translated: Look, Lakshmana, this vulture, though helpful to me, is killed,

original: sītām abhyavapan no vai rāvaṇena balīyasā
analyzed: sītām abhyavapat na u vai rāvaṇena balīyasā
translated: while trying to rescue Sita from the powerful Ravana.

original: gṛdhrarājyaṃ parityajya pitṛpaitāmahaṃ mahat
analyzed: gṛdhra rājyam parityajya pitṛpaitāmaham mahat
translated: Giving up the great kingdom of vultures inherited from his father and grandfather,

original: mama hetor ayaṃ prāṇān mumoca patageśvaraḥ
analyzed: mama hetoḥ ayam prāṇān mumoca pataga īśvaraḥ
translated: this lord of birds gave up his life for my sake.

original: sarvatra khalu dṛśyante sādhavo dharmacāriṇaḥ
analyzed: sarvatra khalu dṛśyante sādhavaḥ dharma cāriṇaḥ
translated: Everywhere, indeed, are seen the virtuous, the followers of dharma,

original: śūrāḥ śaraṇyāḥ saumitre tiryagyonigateṣv api
analyzed: śūrāḥ śaraṇyāḥ saumitre tiryagyoni gateṣu api
translated: the brave, the protectors, O Saumitri, even among those born as animals.

original: sītāharaṇajaṃ duḥkhaṃ na me saumya tathāgatam
analyzed: sītā āharaṇa jam duḥkham na me saumya tathāgatam
translated: O gentle one, the sorrow caused by the abduction of Sita does not affect me so much,🔽as the death of this great lord of birds who was my friend.

original: yathā vināśo gṛdhrasya matkṛte ca paraṃtapa
analyzed: yathā vināśaḥ gṛdhrasya mad kṛte ca paraṃtapa
translated: O scorcher of enemies, just as the destruction of the vulture is due to me,

original: rājā daśarathaḥ śrīmān yathā mama mayā yaśāḥ
analyzed: rājā daśarathaḥ śrīmān yathā mama mayā yaśāḥ
translated: just as the glorious king Dasharatha, who is my father and has fame,

original: pūjanīyaś ca mānyaś ca tathāyaṃ patageśvaraḥ
analyzed: pūjanīyaḥ ca mānyaḥ ca tathā ayam pataga īśvaraḥ
translated: is to be worshipped and honored, in the same way this lord of birds,

original: saumitre hara kāṣṭhāni nirmathiṣyāmi pāvakam🔽gṛdhrarājaṃ didhakṣāmi matkṛte nidhanaṃ gatam
analyzed: saumitre hara kāṣṭhāni nirmathiṣyāmi pāvakam  gṛdhra rājam didhakṣāmi mad kṛte nidhanam gatam
translated: O Saumitri, bring wood, I will kindle a fire🔽and cremate the king of vultures who has died for my sake.

original: nāthaṃ patagalokasya citām āropayāmy aham
analyzed: nātham pataga lokasya citām āropayāmi aham
translated: I will place on the pyre the lord of the world of birds.

original: imaṃ dhakṣyāmi saumitre hataṃ raudreṇa rakṣasā
analyzed: imam dhakṣyāmi saumitre hatam raudreṇa rakṣasā
translated: I will cremate him, O Saumitri, who was killed by the terrible demon.

original: yā gatir yajñaśīlānām āhitāgneś ca yā gatiḥ
analyzed: yā gatiḥ yajña śīlānām āhitāgneḥ ca yā gatiḥ
translated: The destination of those who are devoted to sacrifices, who maintain the sacred fire,

original: aparāvartināṃ yā ca yā ca bhūmipradāyinām
analyzed: apara āvartinām yā ca yā ca bhūmi pradāyinām
translated: and of those who do not retreat, and of those who give land,

original: mayā tvaṃ samanujñāto gaccha lokān anuttamān
analyzed: mayā tvam samanujñātaḥ gaccha lokān anuttamān
translated: with my permission, go to the highest worlds.

original: gṛdhrarāja mahāsattva saṃskṛtaś ca mayā vraja🔽evam uktvā citāṃ dīptām āropya patageśvaram
analyzed: gṛdhra rāja mahā sattva saṃskṛtaḥ ca mayā vraja  evam uktvā citām dīptām āropya pataga īśvaram
translated: O king of vultures, O great being, being cremated by me, go (to heaven).🔽Having said this, Rama, the righteous one, placed the lord of birds on the blazing pyre

original: dadāha rāmo dharmātmā svabandhum iva duḥkhitaḥ
analyzed: dadāha rāmaḥ dharma ātmā sva bandhum iva duḥkhitaḥ
translated: and cremated him, like a grieving relative.

original: rāmo 'tha sahasaumitrir vanaṃ yātvā sa vīryavān
analyzed: sahasaumitriḥ vanam yātvā sa vīryavān
translated: Then Rama, together with Saumitri, the valiant one, having gone to the forest,

original: sthūlān hatvā mahārohīn anu tastāra taṃ dvijam
analyzed: sthūlān hatvā mahārohīn anu tastāra tam dvijam
translated: having killed large wild animals, he crossed the river with the bird.

original: rohimāṃsāni coddhṛtya peśīkṛtvā mahāyaśāḥ
analyzed: rohi māṃsāni ca uddhṛtya peśīkṛtvā mahā yaśāḥ
translated: The greatly illustrious Rama then took some flesh from Rohita, made it into a ball,

original: śakunāya dadau rāmo ramye haritaśādvale🔽yat tat pretasya martyasya kathayanti dvijātayaḥ
analyzed: śakunāya dadau rāmaḥ ramye harita śādvale  yat tat pretasya martyasya kathayanti dvijātayaḥ
translated: and gave it to the bird on a beautiful green meadow.🔽Rama then quickly chanted the mantras that twice-born ones recite for a deceased mortal,

original: tat svargagamanaṃ tasya kṣipraṃ rāmo jajāpa ha🔽tato godāvarīṃ gatvā nadīṃ naravarātmajau
analyzed: tat svarga gamanam tasya kṣipram rāmaḥ jajāpa ha  tatas godāvarīm gatvā nadīm nara vara ātmajau
translated: so that he might quickly go to heaven.🔽Then the two best of men went to the river Godavari,

original: udakaṃ cakratus tasmai gṛdhrarājāya tāv ubhau🔽sa gṛdhrarājaḥ kṛtavān yaśaskaraṃ /
analyzed: udakam cakratuḥ tasmai gṛdhra rājāya tau ubhau  sa gṛdhra rājaḥ kṛtavān yaśaskaram
translated: and both of them offered water to that king of vultures.🔽That king of vultures, who had performed deeds that brought fame,

original: suduṣkaraṃ karma raṇe nipātitaḥ
analyzed: su duṣkaram karma raṇe nipātitaḥ
translated: was brought down in battle, having done the most difficult of tasks.

original: maharṣikalpena ca saṃskṛtas tadā /
analyzed: mahā ṛṣi kalpena ca saṃskṛtaḥ tadā
translated: Then, purified by one who was like a great sage,

original: jagāma puṇyāṃ gatim ātmanaḥ śubhām
analyzed: jagāma puṇyām gatim ātmanaḥ śubhām
translated: he went to his own auspicious and sacred end.

original: kṛtvaivam udakaṃ tasmai prasthitau rāghavau tadā🔽avekṣantau vane sītāṃ paścimāṃ jagmatur diśam
analyzed: kṛtvā evam udakam tasmai prasthitau rāghavau tadā  avekṣantau vane sītām paścimām jagmatuḥ diśam
translated: Having thus offered water to him, the two Raghavas then set out,🔽looking for Sita in the forest, and went to the western direction.

original: tāṃ diśaṃ dakṣiṇāṃ gatvā śaracāpāsidhāriṇau
analyzed: tām diśam dakṣiṇām gatvā śara cāpa asi dhāriṇau
translated: Carrying their bow, arrows and sword, they went to that southern direction,

original: aviprahatam aikṣvākau panthānaṃ pratipedatuḥ
analyzed: a viprahatam aikṣvākau panthānam pratipedatuḥ
translated: and saw a path that had not been trampled by anyone, O descendant of Ikshvaku.

original: gulmair vṛkṣaiś ca bahubhir latābhiś ca praveṣṭitam
analyzed: gulmaiḥ vṛkṣaiḥ ca bahubhiḥ latābhiḥ ca praveṣṭitam
translated: It was overgrown with many bushes, trees and vines,

original: āvṛtaṃ sarvato durgaṃ gahanaṃ ghoradarśanam
analyzed: āvṛtam sarvatas durgam gahanam ghora darśanam
translated: covered all around, impassable, dense and frightful to behold.

original: vyatikramya tu vegena gṛhītvā dakṣiṇāṃ diśam
analyzed: vyatikramya tu vegena gṛhītvā dakṣiṇām diśam
translated: But going beyond with speed, they seized the southern direction.

original: subhīmaṃ tan mahāraṇyaṃ vyatiyātau mahābalau
analyzed: su bhīmam tat mahā araṇyam vyatiyātau mahā balau
translated: Those two immensely strong ones passed through that extremely terrible great forest.

original: tataḥ paraṃ janasthānāt trikrośaṃ gamya rāghavau
analyzed: tatas param janasthānāt tri krośam gamya rāghavau
translated: Then, having gone three kroshas beyond Janasthana, the two Raghavas

original: krauñcāraṇyaṃ viviśatur gahanaṃ tau mahaujasau
analyzed: krauñcāraṇyam viviśatuḥ gahanam tau mahā ojasau
translated: entered the dense forest of Krouncha, those two of great prowess.

original: nānāmeghaghanaprakhyaṃ prahṛṣṭam iva sarvataḥ
analyzed: nānā megha ghana prakhyam prahṛṣṭam iva sarvatas
translated: It was like a mass of various clouds, delighted everywhere,

original: nānāvarṇaiḥ śubhaiḥ puṣpair mṛgapakṣigaṇair yutam
analyzed: nānā varṇaiḥ śubhaiḥ puṣpaiḥ mṛga pakṣi gaṇaiḥ yutam
translated: endowed with various beautiful flowers and flocks of birds.

original: didṛkṣamāṇau vaidehīṃ tad vanaṃ tau vicikyatuḥ
analyzed: didṛkṣamāṇau vaidehīm tat vanam tau vicikyatuḥ
translated: Desiring to see Vaidehi, they searched that forest.

original: tatra tatrāvatiṣṭhantau sītāharaṇakarśitau
analyzed: tatra tatra avatiṣṭhantau sītā āharaṇa karśitau
translated: Standing here and there, afflicted by Sita's abduction,

original: lakṣmaṇas tu mahātejāḥ sattvavāñ śīlavāñ śuciḥ
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ tu mahā tejāḥ sattvavān śīlavān śuciḥ
translated: Lakshmana, the immensely energetic, spirited, virtuous and pure one,

original: abravīt prāñjalir vākyaṃ bhrātaraṃ dīptatejasaṃ
analyzed: abravīt prāñjaliḥ vākyam bhrātaram dīpta tejasam
translated: spoke with folded hands, his words to his brother of blazing splendor:

original: spandate me dṛḍhaṃ bāhur udvignam iva me manaḥ
analyzed: spandate me dṛḍham bāhuḥ udvignam iva me manaḥ
translated: My arm trembles strongly, my mind is anxious, as if.

original: prāyaśaś cāpy aniṣṭāni nimittāny upalakṣaye
analyzed: prāyaśas ca api aniṣṭāni nimittāni upalakṣaye
translated: And I mostly observe inauspicious omens.

original: tasmāt sajjībhavārya tvaṃ kuruṣva vacanaṃ hitam
analyzed: tasmāt sajjībhava ārya tvam kuruṣva vacanam hitam
translated: Therefore, O noble one, be ready and do what is beneficial.

original: mamaiva hi nimittāni sadyaḥ śaṃsanti saṃbhramam
analyzed: mama eva hi nimittāni sadyas śaṃsanti saṃbhramam
translated: For the omens themselves immediately announce alarm.

original: eṣa vañculako nāma pakṣī paramadāruṇaḥ
analyzed: eṣa vañculakaḥ nāma pakṣī parama dāruṇaḥ
translated: This bird named Vanchula is extremely terrible.

original: āvayor vijayaṃ yuddhe śaṃsann iva vinardati
analyzed: āvayoḥ vijayam yuddhe śaṃsan iva vinardati
translated: As if announcing our victory in battle, it is roaring.

original: tayor anveṣator evaṃ sarvaṃ tad vanam ojasā
analyzed: tayoḥ anveṣatoḥ evam sarvam tat vanam ojasā
translated: As they searched the entire forest with their might,

original: saṃjajñe vipulaḥ śabdaḥ prabhañjann iva tad vanam🔽saṃveṣṭitam ivātyarthaṃ gahanaṃ mātariśvanā
analyzed: saṃjajñe vipulaḥ śabdaḥ prabhañjan iva tat vanam  saṃveṣṭitam iva atyartham gahanam mātariśvanā
translated: a loud sound arose, as if shattering that forest.🔽As if tightly enveloped by a strong wind,

original: vanasya tasya śabdo 'bhūd divam āpūrayann iva
analyzed: vanasya tasya śabdaḥ bhūt divam āpūrayan iva
translated: the sound of that forest seemed to fill the sky.

original: taṃ śabdaṃ kāṅkṣamāṇas tu rāmaḥ kakṣe sahānujaḥ
analyzed: tam śabdam kāṅkṣamāṇaḥ tu rāmaḥ kakṣe sahānujaḥ
translated: Desiring to find the source of that sound, Rama, along with his younger brother,

original: dadarśa sumahākāyaṃ rākṣasaṃ vipulorasaṃ
analyzed: dadarśa su mahā kāyam rākṣasam vipula urasam
translated: saw a very large-bodied demon with a huge mouth.

original: āsedatus tatas tatra tāv ubhau pramukhe sthitam🔽vivṛddham aśirogrīvaṃ kabandham udare mukham
analyzed: āsedatuḥ tatas tatra tau ubhau pramukhe sthitam  vivṛddham aśiraḥ grīvam kabandham udare mukham
translated: Then the two of them approached and stood in front of him,🔽who was tall without a head or neck, with a mouth on his belly,

original: romabhir nicitais tīkṣṇair mahāgirim ivocchritam
analyzed: romabhiḥ nicitaiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ mahā girim iva ucchritam
translated: covered with sharp bristly hairs, as lofty as a great mountain,

original: nīlameghanibhaṃ raudraṃ meghastanitaniḥsvanam
analyzed: nīla megha nibham raudram megha stanita niḥsvanam
translated: terrible like a blue cloud, with the sound of thunder,

original: mahāpakṣmeṇa piṅgena vipulenāyatena ca
analyzed: mahā pakṣmeṇa piṅgena vipulena āyatena ca
translated: with a single huge, tawny, wide and long eye

original: ekenorasi ghoreṇa nayanenāśudarśinā🔽mahādaṃṣṭropapannaṃ taṃ lelihānaṃ mahāmukham
analyzed: ekena urasi ghoreṇa nayanena āśu darśinā  mahā daṃṣṭra upapannam tam lelihānam mahā mukham
translated: on his chest, with an eye that sees swiftly,🔽endowed with large fangs, with a huge tongue darting out,

original: bhakṣayantaṃ mahāghorān ṛkṣasiṃhamṛgadvipān
analyzed: bhakṣayantam mahā ghorān ṛkṣa siṃha mṛga dvipān
translated: devouring extremely terrible bears, lions, deer and elephants.

original: ghorau bhujau vikurvāṇam ubhau yojanam āyatau🔽karābhyāṃ vividhān gṛhya ṛṣkān pakṣigaṇān mṛgān
analyzed: ghorau bhujau vikurvāṇam ubhau yojanam āyatau  karābhyām vividhān gṛhya ṛṣkān pakṣi gaṇān mṛgān
translated: Stretching out his two terrible arms, each a yojana long,🔽With his hands he seized various bears, birds and deer,

original: ākarṣantaṃ vikarṣantam anekān mṛgayūthapān
analyzed: ākarṣantam vikarṣantam anekān mṛga yūthapān
translated: Pulling and dragging many leaders of deer herds,

original: sthitam āvṛtya panthānaṃ tayor bhrātroḥ prapannayoḥ
analyzed: sthitam āvṛtya panthānam tayoḥ bhrātroḥ prapannayoḥ
translated: Standing blocking the path of the two brothers who had come there.

original: atha tau samatikramya krośamātre dadarśatuḥ
analyzed: atha tau samatikramya krośa mātre dadarśatuḥ
translated: Then, having gone beyond them, at a distance of a krosa, they saw

original: mahāntaṃ dāruṇaṃ bhīmaṃ kabandhaṃ bhujasaṃvṛtam
analyzed: mahāntam dāruṇam bhīmam kabandham bhuja saṃvṛtam
translated: A huge, terrible, fearful headless torso covered with arms.

original: sa mahābāhur atyarthaṃ prasārya vipulau bhujau
analyzed: sa mahā bāhuḥ atyartham prasārya vipulau bhujau
translated: That mighty-armed one, stretching out his two very large arms,

original: jagrāha sahitāv eva rāghavau pīḍayan balāt🔽khaḍginau dṛḍhadhanvānau tigmatejau mahābhujau
analyzed: jagrāha sahitau eva rāghavau pīḍayan balāt  khaḍginau dṛḍha dhanvānau tigma tejau mahā bhujau
translated: Seized the two Raghavas together, oppressing them with force.🔽The two brothers, armed with swords, firm in wielding the bow, of sharp splendor, with mighty arms,

original: bhrātarau vivaśaṃ prāptau kṛṣyamāṇau mahābalau
analyzed: bhrātarau vivaśam prāptau kṛṣyamāṇau mahā balau
translated: Had come under the control of the powerful one, being dragged.

original: tāv uvāca mahābāhuḥ kabandho dānavottamaḥ
analyzed: tau uvāca mahā bāhuḥ kabandhaḥ dānava uttamaḥ
translated: To them, the mighty-armed Kabandha, the best of the demons, said:

original: kau yuvāṃ vṛṣabhaskandhau mahākhaḍgadhanurdharau
analyzed: kau yuvām vṛṣabha skandhau mahā khaḍga dhanuḥ dharau
translated: Who are you, with shoulders like a bull, wielding a great sword and bow?

original: ghoraṃ deśam imaṃ prāptau mama bhakṣāv upasthitau
analyzed: ghoram deśam imam prāptau mama bhakṣau upasthitau
translated: Having come to this terrible place, you have come to be my food.

original: vadataṃ kāryam iha vāṃ kimarthaṃ cāgatau yuvām
analyzed: vadatam kāryam iha vām kimartham ca āgatau yuvām
translated: Tell me your purpose here, and why you have come.

original: imaṃ deśam anuprāptau kṣudhārtasyeha tiṣṭhataḥ
analyzed: imam deśam anuprāptau kṣudhā ārtasya iha tiṣṭhataḥ
translated: Having come to this place, you have come to me who is staying here, afflicted by hunger.

original: sabāṇacāpakhaḍgau ca tīkṣṇaśṛṅgāv ivarṣabhau
analyzed: sa bāṇa cāpa khaḍgau ca tīkṣṇa śṛṅgau iva ṛṣabhau
translated: With arrows, bow and sword, like two sharp-horned bulls,

original: mamāsyam anusaṃprāptau durlabhaṃ jīvitaṃ punaḥ
analyzed: mama āsyam anusaṃprāptau durlabham jīvitam punar
translated: Have come into my mouth. It is difficult to survive again.

original: tasya tadvacanaṃ śrutvā kabandhasya durātmanaḥ
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā kabandhasya durātmanaḥ
translated: Hearing those words of the evil-minded Kabandha,

original: uvāca lakṣmaṇaṃ rāmo mukhena pariśuṣyatā
analyzed: uvāca lakṣmaṇam rāmaḥ mukhena pariśuṣyatā
translated: Rama, with his mouth parched, spoke to Lakshmana,

original: kṛcchrāt kṛcchrataraṃ prāpya dāruṇaṃ satyavikrama
analyzed: kṛcchrāt kṛcchrataram prāpya dāruṇam satya vikrama
translated: Having reached a difficulty from a greater difficulty, O you of true prowess,

original: vyasanaṃ jīvitāntāya prāptam aprāpya tāṃ priyām
analyzed: vyasanam jīvita antāya prāptam a prāpya tām priyām
translated: This calamity has befallen me, even before I have attained that beloved one.

original: kālasya sumahad vīryaṃ sarvabhūteṣu lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: kālasya su mahat vīryam sarva bhūteṣu lakṣmaṇa
translated: O Lakshmana, the power of Time is very great in all beings.

original: tvāṃ ca māṃ ca naravyāghra vyasanaiḥ paśya mohitau
analyzed: tvām ca mām ca nara vyāghra vyasanaiḥ paśya mohitau
translated: See, O best of men, how you and I are deluded by calamities.

original: nātibhāro 'sti daivasya sarvabhuteṣu lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: na atibhāraḥ sti daivasya sarva bhuteṣu lakṣmaṇa
translated: There is no burden too heavy for Destiny in all beings, O Lakshmana.

original: śūrāś ca balavantaś ca kṛtāstrāś ca raṇājire
analyzed: śūrāḥ ca balavantaḥ ca kṛtāstrāḥ ca raṇa ajire
translated: Even heroes and the strong, skilled in the art of war,

original: kālābhipannāḥ sīdanti yathā vālukasetavaḥ🔽iti bruvāṇo dṛḍhasatyavikramo /
analyzed: kāla abhipannāḥ sīdanti yathā vāluka setavaḥ  iti bruvāṇaḥ dṛḍha satya vikramaḥ
translated: Sink down when overtaken by Time, like sand-banks.

original: mahāyaśā dāśarathiḥ pratāpavān
analyzed: mahā yaśāḥ dāśarathiḥ pratāpavān
translated: Thus speaking, the greatly illustrious and powerful son of Dasharatha, firm in his vow,

original: avekṣya saumitrim udagravikramaṃ /
analyzed: avekṣya saumitrim udagra vikramam
translated: Beholding Sumitra's son of mighty prowess,

original: sthirāṃ tadā svāṃ matim ātmanākarot🔽tau tu tatra sthitau dṛṣṭvā bhrātarau rāmalakṣmaṇau
analyzed: sthirām tadā svām matim ātmanā akarot 🔽tau tu tatra sthitau dṛṣṭvā bhrātarau rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: Confirmed his own resolution.

original: bāhupāśaparikṣiptau kabandho vākyam abravīt
analyzed: bāhu pāśa parikṣiptau kabandhaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: The headless torso said these words to them:

original: tiṣṭhataḥ kiṃ nu māṃ dṛṣṭvā kṣudhārtaṃ kṣatriyarṣabhau
analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ kim nu mām dṛṣṭvā kṣudhā ārtam kṣatriya ṛṣabhau
translated: The headless torso said to them, Why do you stand there, seeing me, afflicted with hunger, you two bulls among Kshatriyas?

original: āhārārthaṃ tu saṃdiṣṭau daivena gatacetasau🔽tac chrutvā lakṣmaṇo vākyaṃ prāptakālaṃ hitaṃ tadā
analyzed: āhāra artham tu saṃdiṣṭau daivena gata cetasau  tat śrutvā lakṣmaṇaḥ vākyam prāpta kālam hitam tadā
translated: You two, your minds gone, have been sent by fate for the purpose of food.

original: uvācārtisamāpanno vikrame kṛtaniścayaḥ
analyzed: uvāca ārti samāpannaḥ vikrame kṛta niścayaḥ
translated: Hearing those words, Lakshmana, who was in distress, but had made up his mind to act, then spoke this timely and beneficial speech:

original: tvāṃ ca māṃ ca purā tūrṇam ādatte rākṣasādhamaḥ
analyzed: tvām ca mām ca purā tūrṇam ādatte rākṣasa adhamaḥ
translated: That vile rakshasa is quickly carrying off both you and me.

original: tasmād asibhyām asyāśu bāhū chindāvahe gurū
analyzed: tasmāt asibhyām asya āśu bāhū chindāvahe gurū
translated: Therefore, let us quickly cut off his heavy arms with our swords.

original: tatas tau deśakālajñau khaḍgābhyām eva rāghavau
analyzed: tatas tau deśa kāla jñau khaḍgābhyām eva rāghavau
translated: Then those two Raghavas, who knew the right place and time,

original: acchindatāṃ susaṃhṛṣṭau bāhū tasyāṃsadeśayoḥ🔽dakṣiṇo dakṣiṇaṃ bāhum asaktam asinā tataḥ
analyzed: acchindatām su saṃhṛṣṭau bāhū tasya aṃsa deśayoḥ  dakṣiṇaḥ dakṣiṇam bāhum asaktam asinā tatas
translated: with great delight cut off his arms at the shoulders with their swords.🔽With his sword, Rama quickly cut off his right arm, which was not attached,

original: ciccheda rāmo vegena savyaṃ vīras tu lakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: ciccheda rāmaḥ vegena savyam vīraḥ tu lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: and the hero Lakshmana cut off his left.

original: sa papāta mahābāhuś chinnabāhur mahāsvanaḥ
analyzed: sa papāta mahā bāhuḥ chinna bāhuḥ mahā svanaḥ
translated: The mighty-armed one, with his arms cut off, fell down with a loud noise,

original: khaṃ ca gāṃ ca diśaś caiva nādayañ jalado yathā
analyzed: kham ca gām ca diśaḥ ca eva nādayam jaladaḥ yathā
translated: making the sky, the earth and the directions resound like a cloud.

original: sa nikṛttau bhujau dṛṣṭvā śoṇitaughapariplutaḥ
analyzed: sa nikṛttau bhujau dṛṣṭvā śoṇita ogha pariplutaḥ
translated: Seeing his arms cut off and his body drenched in blood,

original: dīnaḥ papraccha tau vīrau kau yuvām iti dānavaḥ
analyzed: dīnaḥ papraccha tau vīrau kau yuvām iti dānavaḥ
translated: the demon, in a pitiful state, asked those two heroes, Who are you two?

original: iti tasya bruvāṇasya lakṣmaṇaḥ śubhalakṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: iti tasya bruvāṇasya lakṣmaṇaḥ śubha lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Thus spoke the one with auspicious marks, Lakshmana,

original: śaśaṃsa tasya kākutsthaṃ kabandhasya mahābalaḥ
analyzed: śaśaṃsa tasya kākutstham kabandhasya mahā balaḥ
translated: the immensely strong one, to Kabandha about Kakutstha.

original: ayam ikṣvākudāyādo rāmo nāma janaiḥ śrutaḥ
analyzed: ayam ikṣvāku dāyādaḥ rāmaḥ nāma janaiḥ śrutaḥ
translated: This descendant of the Ikshvaku lineage, known to people as Rama,

original: asyaivāvarajaṃ viddhi bhrātaraṃ māṃ ca lakṣmaṇam
analyzed: asya eva avarajam viddhi bhrātaram mām ca lakṣmaṇam
translated: know him to be my younger brother, and me as Lakshmana.

original: asya devaprabhāvasya vasato vijane vane
analyzed: asya deva prabhāvasya vasataḥ vijane vane
translated: This one, with the splendor of a god, dwelling in the desolate forest,

original: rakṣasāpahṛtā bhāryā yām icchantāv ihāgatau
analyzed: rakṣasā apahṛtā bhāryā yām icchantau iha āgatau
translated: his wife was abducted by a rakshasa, desiring to find her, we have come here.

original: tvaṃ tu ko vā kimarthaṃ vā kabandha sadṛśo vane
analyzed: tvam tu kaḥ vā kimartham vā kabandha sadṛśaḥ vane
translated: But who are you, and for what purpose, O Kabandha, do you wander in the forest,

original: āsyenorasi dīptena bhagnajaṅgho viceṣṭase
analyzed: āsyena urasi dīptena bhagna jaṅghaḥ viceṣṭase
translated: with a gaping mouth on your chest, your thighs broken, writhing about?

original: evam uktaḥ kabandhas tu lakṣmaṇenottaraṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ kabandhaḥ tu lakṣmaṇena uttaram vacaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Lakshmana, Kabandha,

original: uvāca paramaprītas tad indravacanaṃ smaran
analyzed: uvāca parama prītaḥ tat indra vacanam smaran
translated: delighted, spoke these words in reply, remembering the words of Indra.

original: svāgataṃ vāṃ naravyāghrau diṣṭyā paśyāmi cāpy aham
analyzed: svāgatam vām nara vyāghrau diṣṭyā paśyāmi ca api aham
translated: Welcome to you, O tigers among men! By good fortune I see you both.

original: diṣṭyā cemau nikṛttau me yuvābhyāṃ bāhubandhanau
analyzed: diṣṭyā ca imau nikṛttau me yuvābhyām bāhu bandhanau
translated: And by good fortune these two arm-fetters of mine have been severed by you.

original: virūpaṃ yac ca me rūpaṃ prāptaṃ hy avinayād yathā
analyzed: virūpam yat ca me rūpam prāptam hi avinayāt yathā
translated: And as to this disfigured form of mine, which I have obtained through lack of self-control,

original: tan me śṛṇu naravyāghra tattvataḥ śaṃsatas tava
analyzed: tat me śṛṇu nara vyāghra tattvataḥ śaṃsataḥ tava
translated: listen to that, O tiger among men, as I relate it to you in truth.

original: purā rāma mahābāho mahābalaparākrama
analyzed: purā rāma mahā bāho mahā bala parākrama
translated: O Rama, O mighty-armed one, O you of great strength and prowess,🔽in ancient times, in the Krita age, there was a great sage named Vishvamitra,

original: rūpam āsīn mamācintyaṃ triṣu lokeṣu viśrutam
analyzed: rūpam āsīt mama acintyam triṣu lokeṣu viśrutam
translated: My form was inconceivable and famous in the three worlds,

original: yathā somasya śakrasya sūryasya ca yathā vapuḥ
analyzed: yathā somasya śakrasya sūryasya ca yathā vapuḥ
translated: Like the bodies of Soma, Shakra, and Surya.

original: so 'haṃ rūpam idaṃ kṛtvā lokavitrāsanaṃ mahat
analyzed: saḥ ham rūpam idam kṛtvā loka vitrāsanam mahat
translated: Having assumed this form, which greatly frightens the world,

original: ṛṣīn vanagatān rāma trāsayāmi tatas tataḥ
analyzed: ṛṣīn vana gatān rāma trāsayāmi tatas tatas
translated: I terrorize the sages who have gone to the forest here and there, Rama.

original: tataḥ sthūlaśirā nāma maharṣiḥ kopito mayā
analyzed: tatas sthūlaśirāḥ nāma mahā ṛṣiḥ kopitaḥ mayā
translated: Then a great sage named Sthulashira became angry with me.

original: saṃcinvan vividhaṃ vanyaṃ rūpeṇānena dharṣitaḥ
analyzed: saṃcinvan vividham vanyam rūpeṇa anena dharṣitaḥ
translated: While he was collecting various forest products, he was molested by this form.

original: tenāham uktaḥ prekṣyaivaṃ ghoraśāpābhidhāyinā
analyzed: tena aham uktaḥ prekṣya evam ghora śāpa abhidhāyinā
translated: Seeing me, he spoke these words, threatening me with a terrible curse:

original: etad eva nṛśaṃsaṃ te rūpam astu vigarhitam🔽sa mayā yācitaḥ kruddhaḥ śāpasyānto bhaved iti
analyzed: etat eva nṛśaṃsam te rūpam astu vigarhitam  sa mayā yācitaḥ kruddhaḥ śāpasya antaḥ bhavet iti
translated: Let this very cruel and despicable form be yours.🔽When I was angry, I asked him, May the end of the curse be so.

original: abhiśāpakṛtasyeti tenedaṃ bhāṣitaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: abhiśāpa kṛtasya iti tena idam bhāṣitam vacaḥ
translated: May it be so, he said, for one cursed by me.

original: yadā chittvā bhujau rāmas tvāṃ dahed vijane vane
analyzed: yadā chittvā bhujau rāmaḥ tvām dahet vijane vane
translated: When Rama cuts off your arms and burns you in a deserted forest,

original: tadā tvaṃ prāpsyase rūpaṃ svam eva vipulaṃ śubham
analyzed: tadā tvam prāpsyase rūpam svam eva vipulam śubham
translated: then you will attain your own vast and auspicious form.

original: śriyā virājitaṃ putraṃ danos tvaṃ viddhi lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: śriyā virājitam putram danoḥ tvam viddhi lakṣmaṇa
translated: Know, O Lakshmana, that you are the son of Danu, shining with prosperity.

original: indrakopād idaṃ rūpaṃ prāptam evaṃ raṇājire
analyzed: indra kopāt idam rūpam prāptam evam raṇa ajire
translated: This form was obtained by me through the anger of Indra on the battlefield.

original: ahaṃ hi tapasogreṇa pitāmaham atoṣayam
analyzed: aham hi tapasā ugreṇa pitāmaham atoṣayam
translated: I, through severe austerities, satisfied the Grandfather.

original: dīrgham āyuḥ sa me prādāt tato māṃ vibhramo 'spṛśat
analyzed: dīrgham āyuḥ sa me prādāt tatas mām spṛśat
translated: He granted me a long life, and then delusion touched me.

original: dīrgham āyur mayā prāptaṃ kiṃ me śakraḥ kariṣyati
analyzed: dīrgham āyuḥ mayā prāptam kim me śakraḥ kariṣyati
translated: I have obtained a long life, what will Shakra do to me?

original: ity evaṃ buddhim āsthāya raṇe śakram adharṣayam
analyzed: iti evam buddhim āsthāya raṇe śakram adharṣayam
translated: Thinking thus, I challenged Shakra in battle.

original: tasya bāhupramuktena vajreṇa śataparvaṇā
analyzed: tasya bāhu pramuktena vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: With his hundred-knotted thunderbolt released from his arm,

original: sakthinī ca śiraś caiva śarīre saṃpraveśitam
analyzed: sakthinī ca śiraḥ ca eva śarīre saṃpraveśitam
translated: my thighs, head, and body were pierced.

original: sa mayā yācyamānaḥ sann ānayad yamasādanam
analyzed: sa mayā yācyamānaḥ san ānayat yama sādanam
translated: Even though I begged him, he brought me to Yama's abode.

original: pitāmahavacaḥ satyaṃ tad astv iti mamābravīt
analyzed: pitāmaha vacaḥ satyam tat astu iti mama abravīt
translated: He told me, Let the grandfather's words be true.

original: anāhāraḥ kathaṃ śakto bhagnasakthiśiromukhaḥ
analyzed: anāhāraḥ katham śaktaḥ bhagna sakthi śiraḥ mukhaḥ
translated: How can I, without food, with broken thighs, head, and face,

original: vajreṇābhihataḥ kālaṃ sudīrgham api jīvitum
analyzed: vajreṇa abhihataḥ kālam su dīrgham api jīvitum
translated: struck by the thunderbolt, live for a very long time?

original: evam uktas tu me śakro bāhū yojanam āyatau
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu me śakraḥ bāhū yojanam āyatau
translated: Thus addressed, Shakra gave me arms extending a yojana,

original: prādād āsyaṃ ca me kukṣau tīkṣṇadaṃṣṭram akalpayat🔽so 'haṃ bhujābhyāṃ dīrghābhyāṃ samākṛṣya vanecarān
analyzed: prādāt āsyam ca me kukṣau tīkṣṇa daṃṣṭram akalpayat  saḥ ham bhujābhyām dīrghābhyām samākṛṣya vanecarān
translated: and made my mouth in my belly with sharp teeth.🔽With those long arms, I dragged the forest-dwellers

original: siṃhadvipamṛgavyāghrān bhakṣayāmi samantataḥ
analyzed: siṃha dvipa mṛga vyāghrān bhakṣayāmi samantataḥ
translated: and devoured lions, elephants, deer, and tigers all around.

original: sa tu mām abravīd indro yadā rāmaḥ salakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: sa tu mām abravīt indraḥ yadā rāmaḥ sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Indra told me, When Rama with Lakshmana

original: chetsyate samare bāhū tadā svargaṃ gamiṣyasi
analyzed: chetsyate samare bāhū tadā svargam gamiṣyasi
translated: will cut off your arms in battle, then you will go to heaven.

original: sa tvaṃ rāmo 'si bhadraṃ te nāham anyena rāghava
analyzed: sa tvam bhadram te na aham anyena rāghava
translated: You are Rama, blessed are you, O Raghava, I cannot be killed by anyone else

original: śakyo hantuṃ yathātattvam evam uktaṃ maharṣiṇā
analyzed: śakyaḥ hantum yathātattvam evam uktam mahā ṛṣiṇā
translated: as it was said by the great sage.

original: ahaṃ hi matisācivyaṃ kariṣyāmi nararṣabha
analyzed: aham hi mati sācivyam kariṣyāmi nara ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among men, I will assist you with my intellect

original: mitraṃ caivopadekṣyāmi yuvābhyāṃ saṃskṛto 'gninā
analyzed: mitram ca eva upadekṣyāmi yuvābhyām saṃskṛtaḥ agninā
translated: and I will give you a friend, purified by the fire of your union.

original: evam uktas tu dharmātmā danunā tena rāghavaḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu dharma ātmā danunā tena rāghavaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Danu, the righteous Raghava,

original: idaṃ jagāda vacanaṃ lakṣmaṇasyopaśṛṇvataḥ
analyzed: idam jagāda vacanam lakṣmaṇasya upaśṛṇvataḥ
translated: spoke these words in the presence of Lakshmana:

original: rāvaṇena hṛtā sītā mama bhāryā yaśasvinī
analyzed: rāvaṇena hṛtā sītā mama bhāryā yaśasvinī
translated: My illustrious wife Sita was abducted by Ravana,

original: niṣkrāntasya janasthānāt saha bhrātrā yathāsukham
analyzed: niṣkrāntasya janasthānāt saha bhrātrā yathāsukham
translated: when I left Janasthana with my brother, happily.

original: nāmamātraṃ tu jānāmi na rūpaṃ tasya rakṣasaḥ
analyzed: nāma mātram tu jānāmi na rūpam tasya rakṣasaḥ
translated: I know only his name, not his form,

original: nivāsaṃ vā prabhāvaṃ vā vayaṃ tasya na vidmahe
analyzed: nivāsam vā prabhāvam vā vayam tasya na vidmahe
translated: we do not know his abode or power.

original: śokārtānām anāthānām evaṃ viparidhāvatām
analyzed: śoka ārtānām anāthānām evam viparidhāvatām
translated: Thus we wander, afflicted with grief, helpless,

original: kāruṇyaṃ sadṛśaṃ kartum upakāre ca vartatām
analyzed: kāruṇyam sadṛśam kartum upakāre ca vartatām
translated: you should show compassion to us and help us.

original: kāṣṭhāny ānīya śuṣkāṇi kāle bhagnāni kuñjaraiḥ
analyzed: kāṣṭhāni ānīya śuṣkāṇi kāle bhagnāni kuñjaraiḥ
translated: Bring dry wood, broken by elephants in season,

original: bhakṣyāmas tvāṃ vayaṃ vīra śvabhre mahati kalpite
analyzed: bhakṣyāmaḥ tvām vayam vīra śvabhre mahati kalpite
translated: we will eat you, O hero, in a great pit prepared.

original: sa tvaṃ sītāṃ samācakṣva yena vā yatra vā hṛtā
analyzed: sa tvam sītām samācakṣva yena vā yatra vā hṛtā
translated: Tell us about Sita, by whom and where she was abducted.

original: kuru kalyāṇam atyarthaṃ yadi jānāsi tattvataḥ
analyzed: kuru kalyāṇam atyartham yadi jānāsi tattvataḥ
translated: If you know the truth, do what is extremely beneficial.

original: evam uktas tu rāmeṇa vākyaṃ danur anuttamam
analyzed: evam uktaḥ tu rāmeṇa vākyam danuḥ anuttamam
translated: Thus addressed by Rama, Danu, skilled in speech,

original: provāca kuśalo vaktuṃ vaktāram api rāghavam
analyzed: provāca kuśalaḥ vaktum vaktāram api rāghavam
translated: spoke these excellent words to the speaker, Raghava:

original: divyam asti na me jñānaṃ nābhijānāmi maithilīm
analyzed: divyam asti na me jñānam na abhijānāmi maithilīm
translated: I do not possess divine knowledge. I do not know Maithilee.

original: yas tāṃ jñāsyati taṃ vakṣye dagdhaḥ svaṃ rūpam āsthitaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ tām jñāsyati tam vakṣye dagdhaḥ svam rūpam āsthitaḥ
translated: I will tell you about the one who will know her, assuming his own form after being burned.

original: adagdhasya hi vijñātuṃ śaktir asti na me prabho
analyzed: adagdhasya hi vijñātum śaktiḥ asti na me prabho
translated: O lord, I have the power to know only one who is not burned.

original: rākṣasaṃ taṃ mahāvīryaṃ sītā yena hṛtā tava
analyzed: rākṣasam tam mahā vīryam sītā yena hṛtā tava
translated: That greatly powerful rakshasa by whom Sita was abducted from you,

original: vijñānaṃ hi mahad bhraṣṭaṃ śāpadoṣeṇa rāghava
analyzed: vijñānam hi mahat bhraṣṭam śāpa doṣeṇa rāghava
translated: O Raghava, his great knowledge has been lost due to the curse.

original: svakṛtena mayā prāptaṃ rūpaṃ lokavigarhitam
analyzed: sva kṛtena mayā prāptam rūpam loka vigarhitam
translated: I have obtained this form despised by the world due to my own deeds.

original: kiṃ tu yāvan na yāty astaṃ savitā śrāntavāhanaḥ
analyzed: kim tu yāvat na yāti astam savitā śrānta vāhanaḥ
translated: But as long as the sun has not set, and the tired horses are not yoked,

original: tāvan mām avaṭe kṣiptvā daha rāma yathāvidhi
analyzed: tāvat mām avaṭe kṣiptvā daha rāma yathāvidhi
translated: throw me into a pit, and burn me properly, O Rama.

original: dagdhas tvayāham avaṭe nyāyena raghunandana
analyzed: dagdhaḥ tvayā aham avaṭe nyāyena raghunandana
translated: O descendant of Raghu, when I am burned by you in a pit according to the rules,

original: vakṣyāmi tam ahaṃ vīra yas taṃ jñāsyati rākṣasaṃ
analyzed: vakṣyāmi tam aham vīra yaḥ tam jñāsyati rākṣasam
translated: O hero, I will tell you about the one who will know that rakshasa.

original: tena sakhyaṃ ca kartavyaṃ nyāyyavṛttena rāghava
analyzed: tena sakhyam ca kartavyam nyāyya vṛttena rāghava
translated: O Raghava, you should make friendship with him, who is of righteous conduct.

original: kalpayiṣyati te prītaḥ sāhāyyaṃ laghuvikramaḥ
analyzed: kalpayiṣyati te prītaḥ sāhāyyam laghu vikramaḥ
translated: Delighted, he, of swift prowess, will provide you assistance.

original: na hi tasyāsty avijñātaṃ triṣu lokeṣu rāghava
analyzed: na hi tasya asti avijñātam triṣu lokeṣu rāghava
translated: O Raghava! There is nothing unknown to him in the three worlds.

original: sarvān parisṛto lokān purā vai kāraṇāntare
analyzed: sarvān parisṛtaḥ lokān purā vai kāraṇa antare
translated: In the past, for some reason, he roamed all the worlds.

original: evam uktau tu tau vīrau kabandhena nareśvarau
analyzed: evam uktau tu tau vīrau kabandhena nareśvarau
translated: Thus addressed by Kabandha, those two heroic lords of men,

original: giripradaram āsādya pāvakaṃ visasarjatuḥ
analyzed: giri pradaram āsādya pāvakam visasarjatuḥ
translated: approaching a mountain cave, released the fire.

original: lakṣmaṇas tu maholkābhir jvalitābhiḥ samantataḥ
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ tu mahā ulkābhiḥ jvalitābhiḥ samantataḥ
translated: But Lakshmana, with great fireballs blazing all around,

original: citām ādīpayām āsa sā prajajvāla sarvataḥ
analyzed: citām ādīpayām āsa sā prajajvāla sarvatas
translated: set fire to the funeral pyre, which blazed everywhere.

original: tac charīraṃ kabandhasya ghṛtapiṇḍopamaṃ mahat🔽medasā pacyamānasya mandaṃ dahati pāvaka
analyzed: tat śarīram kabandhasya ghṛta piṇḍa upamam mahat  medasā pacyamānasya mandam dahati pāvaka
translated: That body of Kabandha, huge like a lump of ghee,🔽the fire slowly burned as the fat cooked.

original: sa vidhūya citām āśu vidhūmo 'gnir ivotthitaḥ
analyzed: sa vidhūya citām āśu vidhūmaḥ gniḥ iva utthitaḥ
translated: Shaking off the funeral pyre quickly, he arose like a smokeless fire,

original: araje vāsasī vibhran mālāṃ divyāṃ mahābalaḥ
analyzed: araje vāsasī vibhran mālām divyām mahā balaḥ
translated: wearing spotless garments and a divine garland, the immensely strong one.

original: tataś citāyā vegena bhāsvaro virajāmbaraḥ
analyzed: tatas citāyāḥ vegena bhāsvaraḥ viraja ambaraḥ
translated: Then, with force from the funeral pyre, radiant, wearing spotless garments,

original: utpapātāśu saṃhṛṣṭaḥ sarvapratyaṅgabhūṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: utpapāta āśu saṃhṛṣṭaḥ sarva pratyaṅga bhūṣaṇaḥ
translated: he quickly rose up, delighted, adorned with every limb ornament.

original: vimāne bhāsvare tiṣṭhan haṃsayukte yaśaskare
analyzed: vimāne bhāsvare tiṣṭhan haṃsa yukte yaśaskare
translated: Standing in a radiant chariot yoked to swans, bringing fame,

original: prabhayā ca mahātejā diśo daśa virājayan
analyzed: prabhayā ca mahā tejāḥ diśaḥ daśa virājayan
translated: and with his great brilliance illuminating the ten directions,

original: so 'ntarikṣagato rāmaṃ kabandho vākyam abravīt
analyzed: saḥ ntarikṣa gataḥ rāmam kabandhaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Kabandha, in the sky, spoke these words to Rama:

original: śṛṇu rāghava tattvena yathā sīmām avāpsyasi
analyzed: śṛṇu rāghava tattvena yathā sīmām avāpsyasi
translated: Listen, Raghava, to the truth of how you will obtain the limit.

original: rāma ṣaḍ yuktayo loke yābhiḥ sarvaṃ vimṛśyate
analyzed: rāma ṣaḍ yuktayaḥ loke yābhiḥ sarvam vimṛśyate
translated: Rama, there are six methods in the world by which everything is examined.

original: parimṛṣṭo daśāntena daśābhāgena sevyate
analyzed: parimṛṣṭaḥ daśā antena daśā bhāgena sevyate
translated: It is examined by the tenth part, served by the tenth part.

original: daśābhāgagato hīnas tvaṃ rāma sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: daśā bhāga gataḥ hīnaḥ tvam rāma sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: You, Rama, along with Lakshmana, are inferior, occupying the tenth part.

original: yat kṛte vyasanaṃ prāptaṃ tvayā dārapradharṣaṇam
analyzed: yat kṛte vyasanam prāptam tvayā dāra pradharṣaṇam
translated: For whose sake you have encountered this calamity of your wife being abducted,

original: tad avaśyaṃ tvayā kāryaḥ sa suhṛt suhṛdāṃ vara
analyzed: tat avaśyam tvayā kāryaḥ sa suhṛd suhṛdām vara
translated: that friend of yours, O best of friends, must certainly be served by you.

original: akṛtvā na hi te siddhim ahaṃ paśyāmi cintayan
analyzed: a kṛtvā na hi te siddhim aham paśyāmi cintayan
translated: Not having done that, I do not see your success, thinking about it.

original: śrūyatāṃ rāma vakṣyāmi sugrīvo nāma vānaraḥ
analyzed: śrūyatām rāma vakṣyāmi sugrīvaḥ nāma vānaraḥ
translated: Listen, Rama, I will tell you, there is a monkey named Sugriva.

original: bhrātrā nirastaḥ kruddhena vālinā śakrasūnunā
analyzed: bhrātrā nirastaḥ kruddhena vālinā śakra sūnunā
translated: He was banished by his angry brother Vali, the son of Shakra,

original: ṛṣyamūke girivare pampāparyantaśobhite
analyzed: ṛṣyamūke giri vare pampā paryanta śobhite
translated: resides on the excellent mountain Rishyamuka, adorned with the Pampa lake,

original: nivasaty ātmavān vīraś caturbhiḥ saha vānaraiḥ
analyzed: nivasati ātmavān vīraḥ caturbhiḥ saha vānaraiḥ
translated: the self-controlled hero, along with four monkeys.

original: vayasyaṃ taṃ kuru kṣipram ito gatvādya rāghava
analyzed: vayasyam tam kuru kṣipram itas gatvā adya rāghava
translated: O Raghava, go there today and quickly make him your friend.

original: adrohāya samāgamya dīpyamāne vibhāvasau
analyzed: adrohāya samāgamya dīpyamāne vibhāvasau
translated: Having come together without hostility, in the blazing fire,

original: na ca te so 'vamantavyaḥ sugrīvo vānarādhipaḥ
analyzed: na ca te saḥ vamantavyaḥ sugrīvaḥ vānara adhipaḥ
translated: and that Sugriva, the lord of monkeys, should not be disrespected by you.

original: kṛtajñaḥ kāmarūpī ca sahāyārthī ca vīryavān
analyzed: kṛtajñaḥ kāmarūpī ca sahāya arthī ca vīryavān
translated: He is grateful, able to assume any form at will, and powerful, seeking a companion.

original: śaktau hy adya yuvāṃ kartuṃ kāryaṃ tasya cikīrṣitam
analyzed: śaktau hi adya yuvām kartum kāryam tasya cikīrṣitam
translated: For you two are now capable of accomplishing the task he desires.

original: kṛtārtho vākṛtārtho vā kṛtyaṃ tava kariṣyati
analyzed: kṛtārthaḥ vā akṛtārthaḥ vā kṛtyam tava kariṣyati
translated: Whether he has accomplished his purpose or not, he will do what you want.

original: sa ṛkṣarajasaḥ putraḥ pampām aṭati śaṅkitaḥ
analyzed: saḥ ṛkṣa rajasaḥ putraḥ pampām aṭati śaṅkitaḥ
translated: That son of Ṛkṣaraja roams about the Pampa, suspicious.

original: bhāskarasyaurasaḥ putro vālinā kṛtakilbiṣaḥ
analyzed: bhāskarasya aurasaḥ putraḥ vālinā kṛta kilbiṣaḥ
translated: He is the legitimate son of the sun, afflicted by Vali.

original: saṃnidhāyāyudhaṃ kṣipram ṛṣyamūkālayaṃ kapim
analyzed: saṃnidhāya āyudham kṣipram ṛṣyamūka ālayam kapim
translated: Taking up your weapon quickly, go to the monkey dwelling in Ṛṣyamūka.

original: kuru rāghava satyena vayasyaṃ vanacāriṇam
analyzed: kuru rāghava satyena vayasyam vana cāriṇam
translated: O Rāghava, make him your friend, who roams in the forest.

original: sa hi sthānāni sarvāṇi kārtsnyena kapikuñjaraḥ
analyzed: sa hi sthānāni sarvāṇi kārtsnyena kapi kuñjaraḥ
translated: For that elephant among monkeys knows all the places

original: naramāṃsāśināṃ loke naipuṇyād adhigacchati
analyzed: nara māṃsa āśinām loke naipuṇyāt adhigacchati
translated: in the world of flesh-eaters through his skill.

original: na tasyāviditaṃ loke kiṃ cid asti hi rāghava
analyzed: na tasya aviditam loke kim cit asti hi rāghava
translated: O Rāghava, there is nothing unknown to him in the world

original: yāvat sūryaḥ pratapati sahasrāṃśur ariṃdama
analyzed: yāvat sūryaḥ pratapati sahasrāṃśuḥ ariṃdama
translated: as long as the sun, with a thousand rays, shines, O chastiser of enemies.

original: sa nadīr vipulāñ śailān giridurgāṇi kandarān
analyzed: sa nadīḥ vipulām śailān giri durgāṇi kandarān
translated: He will search rivers, vast mountains, inaccessible mountain caves and valleys

original: anviṣya vānaraiḥ sārdhaṃ patnīṃ te 'dhigamiṣyati
analyzed: anviṣya vānaraiḥ sārdham patnīm te dhik gamiṣyati
translated: and with the monkeys will find your wife.

original: vānarāṃś ca mahākāyān preṣayiṣyati rāghava
analyzed: vānarān ca mahā kāyān preṣayiṣyati rāghava
translated: O Rāghava, he will send out huge-bodied monkeys

original: diśo vicetuṃ tāṃ sītāṃ tvadviyogena śocatīm
analyzed: diśaḥ vicetum tām sītām tvad viyogena śocatīm
translated: to search the directions for Sītā, who is grieving due to separation from you.

original: sa meruśṛṅgāgragatām aninditāṃ /
analyzed: sa meru śṛṅga agra gatām aninditām
translated: I will find that faultless one dwelling on the peak of Meru,

original: praviśya pātālatale 'pi vāśritām
analyzed: praviśya pātāla tale vā āśritām
translated: or even if she has entered the nether world,

original: plavaṃgamānāṃ pravaras tava priyāṃ /
analyzed: plavaṃgamānām pravaraḥ tava priyām
translated: The best of monkeys, he will find your beloved.

original: nihatya rakṣāṃsi punaḥ pradāsyati
analyzed: nihatya rakṣāṃsi punar pradāsyati
translated: The best of the monkeys, having killed the demons, will return your beloved.

original: nidarśayitvā rāmāya sītāyāḥ pratipādane
analyzed: nidarśayitvā rāmāya sītāyāḥ pratipādane
translated: Having shown Rama Sita's ornaments,

original: vākyam anvartham arthajñaḥ kabandhaḥ punar abravīt
analyzed: vākyam anvartham artha jñaḥ kabandhaḥ punar abravīt
translated: the one who knows the meaning, Kabandha, again spoke words with meaning:

original: eṣa rāma śivaḥ panthā yatraite puṣpitā drumāḥ
analyzed: eṣa rāma śivaḥ panthāḥ yatra ete puṣpitāḥ drumāḥ
translated: This is the auspicious path, O Rama, where these flowering trees

original: pratīcīṃ diśam āśritya prakāśante manoramāḥ🔽jambūpriyālapanasāḥ plakṣanyagrodhatindukāḥ
analyzed: pratīcīm diśam āśritya prakāśante manoramāḥ
translated: shine beautifully, resorting to the western direction.🔽There are rose-apples, bread-fruits, jack-fruits, fig-trees, banyan trees, dhak trees,

original: aśvatthāḥ karṇikārāś ca cūtāś cānye ca pādapāḥ
analyzed: aśvatthāḥ karṇikārāḥ ca cūtāḥ ca anye ca pādapāḥ
translated: ashvattha trees, karnikara trees, mango trees, and other trees.

original: tān āruhyāthavā bhūmau pātayitvā ca tān balāt
