analyzed: tān āruhya athavā bhūmau pātayitvā ca tān balāt
translated: Having climbed them or having forcibly knocked them down on the ground,

original: phalāny amṛtakalpāni bhakṣayantau gamiṣyathaḥ
analyzed: phalāni amṛta kalpāni bhakṣayantau gamiṣyathaḥ
translated: eating the fruits that are like nectar, you will go.

original: caṅkramantau varān deśāñ śailāc chailaṃ vanād vanam
analyzed: caṅkramantau varān deśām śailāt śailam vanāt vanam
translated: Wandering through the best of countries, from mountain to mountain, from forest to forest,

original: tataḥ puṣkariṇīṃ vīrau pampāṃ nāma gamiṣyathaḥ
analyzed: tatas puṣkariṇīm vīrau pampām nāma gamiṣyathaḥ
translated: then, O heroes, you will go to the lake named Pampa.

original: aśarkarām avibhraṃśāṃ samatīrtham aśaivalām
analyzed: aśarkarām avibhraṃśām sama tīrtham aśaivalām
translated: Free from pebbles, free from uneven ground, with even banks, free from moss,

original: rāma saṃjātavālūkāṃ kamalotpalaśobhitām
analyzed: rāma saṃjāta vālūkām kamala utpala śobhitām
translated: with sandbanks, O Rama, adorned with lotuses and water lilies.

original: tatra haṃsāḥ plavāḥ krauñcāḥ kurarāś caiva rāghava
analyzed: tatra haṃsāḥ plavāḥ krauñcāḥ kurarāḥ ca eva rāghava
translated: There, O Raghava, are swans, waterfowl, curlews, and cranes,

original: valgusvarā nikūjanti pampāsalilagocarāḥ
analyzed: valgu svarāḥ nikūjanti pampā salila gocarāḥ
translated: The auspicious birds, not knowing how to avoid death,

original: nodvijante narān dṛṣṭvā vadhasyākovidāḥ śubhāḥ
analyzed: na udvijante narān dṛṣṭvā vadhasya akovidāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: do not get frightened on seeing men.

original: ghṛtapiṇḍopamān sthūlāṃs tān dvijān bhakṣayiṣyathaḥ
analyzed: ghṛta piṇḍa upamān sthūlān tān dvijān bhakṣayiṣyathaḥ
translated: You will eat those fat Brahmanas, resembling lumps of ghee,

original: rohitān vakratuṇḍāṃś ca nalamīnāṃś ca rāghava
analyzed: rohitān vakratuṇḍān ca nalamīnān ca rāghava
translated: the red, crooked-mouthed fish, and the Nala fish, O Raghava.

original: pampāyām iṣubhir matsyāṃs tatra rāma varān hatān
analyzed: pampāyām iṣubhiḥ matsyān tatra rāma varān hatān
translated: O Rama, in the Pampa, you will kill with arrows the best of fish.

original: nistvakpakṣān ayastaptān akṛśān ekakaṇṭakān
analyzed: nistvakpakṣān ayaḥ taptān akṛśān ekakaṇṭakān
translated: Without skin, wings, iron-heated, lean, with a single thorn,

original: tava bhaktyā samāyukto lakṣmaṇaḥ saṃpradāsyati
analyzed: tava bhaktyā samāyuktaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ saṃpradāsyati
translated: Lakshmana, endowed with devotion to you, will offer them.

original: bhṛśaṃ te khādato matsyān pampāyāḥ puṣpasaṃcaye
analyzed: bhṛśam te khādataḥ matsyān pampāyāḥ puṣpa saṃcaye
translated: While you are eating the fish to your heart's content in the flower-filled Pampa,

original: padmagandhi śivaṃ vāri sukhaśītam anāmayam🔽uddhṛtya sa tadākliṣṭaṃ rūpyasphaṭikasaṃnibham
analyzed: padma gandhi śivam vāri sukha śītam anāmayam  uddhṛtya sa tadā akliṣṭam rūpya sphaṭika saṃnibham
translated: water fragrant with lotuses, auspicious, pleasant and cool,🔽Lakshmana will offer you, O Rama, water free from impurities, resembling silver and crystal,

original: atha puṣkaraparṇena lakṣmaṇaḥ pāyayiṣyati
analyzed: atha puṣkara parṇena lakṣmaṇaḥ pāyayiṣyati
translated: drawn with a lotus leaf.🔽You will see in the Pampa, O best of men,

original: sthūlān giriguhāśayyān varāhān vanacāriṇaḥ
analyzed: sthūlān giri guhā śayyān varāhān vana cāriṇaḥ
translated: fat boars dwelling in mountain caves, wandering in the forest,

original: apāṃ lobhād upāvṛttān vṛṣabhān iva nardataḥ🔽rūpānvitāṃś ca pampāyāṃ drakṣyasi tvaṃ narottama
analyzed: apām lobhāt upāvṛttān vṛṣabhān iva nardataḥ  rūpa anvitān ca pampāyām drakṣyasi tvam nara uttama
translated: approaching out of greed for water, roaring like bulls.🔽In the evening, O Rama, while wandering, you will see

original: sāyāhne vicaran rāma viṭapī mālyadhāriṇaḥ
analyzed: sāyāhne vicaran rāma viṭapī mālya dhāriṇaḥ
translated: trees in the Pampa, O best of men, adorned with flowers.

original: śītodakaṃ ca pampāyāṃ dṛṣṭvā śokaṃ vihāsyasi
analyzed: śīta udakam ca pampāyām dṛṣṭvā śokam vihāsyasi
translated: And seeing the cool water of Pampa, you will cast off your grief.

original: sumanobhiś citāṃs tatra tilakān naktamālakān
analyzed: sumanobhiḥ citān tatra tilakān naktamālakān
translated: There you will see tilaka trees and naktamala trees,

original: utpalāni ca phullāni paṅkajāni ca rāghava
analyzed: utpalāni ca phullāni paṅkajāni ca rāghava
translated: and full-blown lotuses and water lilies, O Raghava.

original: na tāni kaś cin mālyāni tatrāropayitā naraḥ
analyzed: na tāni kaḥ cit mālyāni tatra āropayitā naraḥ
translated: No man there will string those garlands.

original: mataṅgaśiṣyās tatrāsann ṛṣayaḥ susamāhitaḥ🔽teṣāṃ bhārābhitaptānāṃ vanyam āharatāṃ guroḥ
analyzed: mataṅga śiṣyāḥ tatra āsan ṛṣayaḥ su samāhitaḥ  teṣām bhāra abhitaptānām vanyam āharatām guroḥ
translated: There were sages, disciples of Matanga, well-concentrated.🔽For those who were tormented by the burden, bringing wood for the guru,

original: ye prapetur mahīṃ tūrṇaṃ śarīrāt svedabindavaḥ
analyzed: ye prapetuḥ mahīm tūrṇam śarīrāt sveda bindavaḥ
translated: the drops of sweat that quickly fell from their bodies

original: tāni mālyāni jātāni munīnāṃ tapasā tadā
analyzed: tāni mālyāni jātāni munīnām tapasā tadā
translated: became those garlands through the asceticism of the sages.

original: svedabindusamutthāni na vinaśyanti rāghava
analyzed: sveda bindu samutthāni na vinaśyanti rāghava
translated: Those garlands born from drops of sweat do not perish, O Raghava.

original: teṣām adyāpi tatraiva dṛśyate paricāriṇī
analyzed: teṣām adyā api tatra eva dṛśyate paricāriṇī
translated: Even now, there is seen attending on them

original: śramaṇī śabarī nāma kākutstha cirajīvinī
analyzed: śramaṇī śabarī nāma kākutstha cira jīvinī
translated: a female ascetic named Shabaree, a long-lived one, O Kakutstha.

original: tvāṃ tu dharme sthitā nityaṃ sarvabhūtanamaskṛtam
analyzed: tvām tu dharme sthitā nityam sarva bhūta namaskṛtam
translated: But you, always established in dharma, revered by all beings,

original: dṛṣṭvā devopamaṃ rāma svargalokaṃ gamiṣyati
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā deva upamam rāma svarga lokam gamiṣyati
translated: seeing you, Rama, who are like a god, will go to heaven.

original: tatas tad rāma pampāyās tīram āśritya paścimam
analyzed: tatas tat rāma pampāyāḥ tīram āśritya paścimam
translated: Then, Rama, on the western bank of Pampa,

original: āśramasthānam atulaṃ guhyaṃ kākutstha paśyasi
analyzed: āśrama sthānam atulam guhyam kākutstha paśyasi
translated: you will see an incomparable, secret hermitage, O Kakutstha.

original: na tatrākramituṃ nāgāḥ śaknuvanti tam āśramam
analyzed: na tatra ākramitum nāgāḥ śaknuvanti tam āśramam
translated: The elephants are unable to enter that hermitage.

original: ṛṣes tasya mataṅgasya vidhānāt tac ca kānanam
analyzed: ṛṣeḥ tasya mataṅgasya vidhānāt tat ca kānanam
translated: And that forest is due to the arrangement of that sage Matanga.

original: tasmin nandanasaṃkāśe devāraṇyopame vane🔽nānāvihagasaṃkīrṇe raṃsyase rāma nirvṛtaḥ
analyzed: tasmin nandana saṃkāśe deva araṇya upame vane  nānā vihaga saṃkīrṇe raṃsyase rāma nirvṛtaḥ
translated: In that forest, which is like Nandana and is like the celestial forest,🔽you will find delight, O Rama, being filled with various kinds of birds.

original: ṛṣyamūkas tu pampāyāḥ purastāt puṣpitadrumaḥ
analyzed: ṛṣyamūkaḥ tu pampāyāḥ purastāt puṣpita drumaḥ
translated: But Rishyamuka, with blossoming trees, is in front of Pampa,

original: suduḥkhārohaṇo nāma śiśunāgābhirakṣitaḥ
analyzed: su duḥkha ārohaṇaḥ nāma śiśunāga abhirakṣitaḥ
translated: and is protected by young elephants, and is difficult to climb.

original: udāro brahmaṇā caiva pūrvakāle vinirmitaḥ
analyzed: udāraḥ brahmaṇā ca eva pūrva kāle vinirmitaḥ
translated: It was created by Brahma himself in ancient times.

original: śayānaḥ puruṣo rāma tasya śailasya mūrdhani
analyzed: śayānaḥ puruṣaḥ rāma tasya śailasya mūrdhani
translated: O Rama, a man who sleeps on the top of that mountain,

original: yat svapne labhate vittaṃ tat prabuddho 'dhigacchati
analyzed: yat svapne labhate vittam tat prabuddhaḥ dhigacchati
translated: obtains the wealth he sees in his dream when he awakes.

original: na tv enaṃ viṣamācāraḥ pāpakarmādhirohati
analyzed: na tu enam viṣama ācāraḥ pāpa karmā adhirohati
translated: But one of evil conduct and sinful deeds cannot climb it.

original: tatraiva praharanty enaṃ suptam ādāya rākṣasāḥ
analyzed: tatra eva praharanti enam suptam ādāya rākṣasāḥ
translated: The rakshasas seize him while he is asleep and kill him right there.

original: tato 'pi śiśunāgānām ākrandaḥ śrūyate mahān
analyzed: tatas pi śiśunāgānām ākrandaḥ śrūyate mahān
translated: And from there, the loud cries of the young elephants are heard.

original: krīḍatāṃ rāma pampāyāṃ mataṅgāraṇyavāsinām🔽siktā rudhiradhārābhiḥ saṃhatya paramadvipāḥ
analyzed: krīḍatām rāma pampāyām mataṅga araṇya vāsinām  siktāḥ rudhira dhārābhiḥ saṃhatya parama dvipāḥ
translated: O Rama, the elephants that live in the Matanga forest play in the Pampa.🔽The supreme elephants, sprinkled with streams of blood,

original: pracaranti pṛthak kīrṇā meghavarṇās tarasvinaḥ
analyzed: pracaranti pṛthak kīrṇāḥ megha varṇāḥ tarasvinaḥ
translated: move separately, scattered, swift, and having the color of clouds.

original: te tatra pītvā pānīyaṃ vimalaṃ śītam avyayam
analyzed: te tatra pītvā pānīyam vimalam śītam avyayam
translated: Having drunk the pure, cold, and imperishable water there,

original: nivṛttāḥ saṃvigāhante vanāni vanagocarāḥ
analyzed: nivṛttāḥ saṃvigāhante vanāni vana gocarāḥ
translated: they return and enter the forests, wandering in the woods.

original: rāma tasya tu śailasya mahatī śobhate guhā
analyzed: rāma tasya tu śailasya mahatī śobhate guhā
translated: O Rama! On that mountain, there is a great cave,

original: śilāpidhānā kākutstha duḥkhaṃ cāsyāḥ praveśanam
analyzed: śilā pidhānā kākutstha duḥkham ca asyāḥ praveśanam
translated: with a stone door, O Kakutstha, and difficult to enter.

original: tasyā guhāyāḥ prāgdvāre mahāñ śītodako hradaḥ
analyzed: tasyāḥ guhāyāḥ prāc dvāre mahām śīta udakaḥ hradaḥ
translated: In front of that cave, there is a great lake with cool water,

original: bahumūlaphalo ramyo nānānagasamāvṛtaḥ
analyzed: bahu mūla phalaḥ ramyaḥ nānā naga samāvṛtaḥ
translated: full of many roots and fruits, delightful, and surrounded by various trees.

original: tasyāṃ vasati sugrīvaś caturbhiḥ saha vānaraiḥ
analyzed: tasyām vasati sugrīvaḥ caturbhiḥ saha vānaraiḥ
translated: Sugriva resides there with four monkeys.

original: kadā cic chikhare tasya parvatasyāvatiṣṭhate
analyzed: kadā cit śikhare tasya parvatasya avatiṣṭhate
translated: Sometimes he stays on the peak of that mountain.

original: kabandhas tv anuśāsyaivaṃ tāv ubhau rāmalakṣmaṇau
analyzed: kabandhaḥ tu anuśāsya evam tau ubhau rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: Having thus instructed both Rama and Lakshmana,

original: sragvī bhāskaravarṇābhaḥ khe vyarocata vīryavān
analyzed: sragvī bhāskara varṇa ābhaḥ khe vyarocata vīryavān
translated: the powerful Kabandha, wearing a garland and shining like the sun, rose up into the sky.

original: taṃ tu khasthaṃ mahābhāgaṃ kabandhaṃ rāmalakṣmaṇau🔽prasthitau tvaṃ vrajasveti vākyam ūcatur antikāt
analyzed: tam tu kha stham mahābhāgam kabandham rāma lakṣmaṇau  prasthitau tvam vrajasva iti vākyam ūcatuḥ antikāt
translated: As he was standing in the sky, Rama and Lakshmana🔽approached the illustrious Kabandha and said, Go.

original: gamyatāṃ kāryasiddhyartham iti tāv abravīc ca saḥ
analyzed: gamyatām kārya siddhi artham iti tau abravīt ca saḥ
translated: He replied to them, Go for the sake of accomplishing your task.

original: suprītau tāv anujñāpya kabandhaḥ prasthitas tadā
analyzed: su prītau tau anujñāpya kabandhaḥ prasthitaḥ tadā
translated: Having thus obtained their consent, Kabandha departed.

original: sa tat kabandhaḥ pratipadya rūpaṃ /
analyzed: sa tat kabandhaḥ pratipadya rūpam
translated: Having regained his original form,

original: vṛtaḥ śriyā bhāskaratulyadehaḥ
analyzed: vṛtaḥ śriyā bhāskara tulya dehaḥ
translated: Surrounded by prosperity, with a body equal to the sun,

original: nidarśayan rāmam avekṣya khasthaḥ /
analyzed: nidarśayan rāmam avekṣya kha sthaḥ
translated: Pointing out Rama, looking at him in the sky,

original: sakhyaṃ kuruṣveti tadābhyuvāca
analyzed: sakhyam kuruṣva iti tadā abhyuvāca
translated: He said, Make friendship with him.

original: tau kabandhena taṃ mārgaṃ pampāyā darśitaṃ vane
analyzed: tau kabandhena tam mārgam pampāyāḥ darśitam vane
translated: In the forest, shown that path by Kabandha on the Pampa,

original: ātasthatur diśaṃ gṛhya pratīcīṃ nṛvarātmajau
analyzed: ātasthatuḥ diśam gṛhya pratīcīm nṛ vara ātmajau
translated: The two best of men, the sons of the king, set out, facing the western direction.

original: tau śaileṣv ācitānekān kṣaudrakalpaphaladrumān🔽vīkṣantau jagmatur draṣṭuṃ sugrīvaṃ rāmalakṣmaṇau
analyzed: tau śaileṣu ācita anekān kṣaudra kalpa phala drumān  vīkṣantau jagmatuḥ draṣṭum sugrīvam rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: Seeing many trees on the mountains, laden with fruits like honey,🔽Rama and Lakshmana went to see Sugriva.

original: kṛtvā ca śailapṛṣṭhe tu tau vāsaṃ raghunandanau🔽pampāyāḥ paścimaṃ tīraṃ rāghavāv upatasthatuḥ
analyzed: kṛtvā ca śaila pṛṣṭhe tu tau vāsam raghu nandanau  pampāyāḥ paścimam tīram rāghavau upatasthatuḥ
translated: And the two descendants of Raghu, having made their abode on the mountain peak,🔽The two Raghavas approached the western bank of the Pampa.

original: tau puṣkariṇyāḥ pampāyās tīram āsādya paścimam
analyzed: tau puṣkariṇyāḥ pampāyāḥ tīram āsādya paścimam
translated: Having reached the western bank of the lotus lake Pampa,

original: apaśyatāṃ tatas tatra śabaryā ramyam āśramam
analyzed: apaśyatām tatas tatra śabaryāḥ ramyam āśramam
translated: They saw there the beautiful hermitage of Shabaree.

original: tau tam āśramam āsādya drumair bahubhir āvṛtam
analyzed: tau tam āśramam āsādya drumaiḥ bahubhiḥ āvṛtam
translated: Having reached that hermitage, surrounded by many trees,

original: suramyam abhivīkṣantau śabarīm abhyupeyatuḥ
analyzed: su ramyam abhivīkṣantau śabarīm abhyupeyatuḥ
translated: Looking at it with great pleasure, they approached Shabaree.

original: tau tu dṛṣṭvā tadā siddhā samutthāya kṛtāñjaliḥ
analyzed: tau tu dṛṣṭvā tadā siddhā samutthāya kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: Seeing them, the perfected one arose, with palms joined in salutation,

original: pādau jagrāha rāmasya lakṣmaṇasya ca dhīmataḥ
analyzed: pādau jagrāha rāmasya lakṣmaṇasya ca dhīmataḥ
translated: And grasped the feet of Rama and the wise Lakshmana.

original: tām uvāca tato rāmaḥ śramaṇīṃ saṃśitavratām🔽kaccit te nirjitā vighnāḥ kaccit te vardhate tapaḥ
analyzed: tām uvāca tatas rāmaḥ śramaṇīm saṃśita vratām  kaccit te nirjitāḥ vighnāḥ kaccit te vardhate tapaḥ
translated: Then Rama spoke to that female ascetic, who was firm in her vows:🔽Have you conquered obstacles? Have you increased your austerities?

original: kaccit te niyataḥ kopa āhāraś ca tapodhane
analyzed: kaccit te niyataḥ kopaḥ āhāraḥ ca tapodhane
translated: O you who are rich in austerities, is your anger controlled? Is your food controlled?

original: kaccit te niyamāḥ prāptāḥ kaccit te manasaḥ sukham
analyzed: kaccit te niyamāḥ prāptāḥ kaccit te manasaḥ sukham
translated: Have you attained your observances? Are you happy in your mind?

original: kaccit te guruśuśrūṣā saphalā cārubhāṣiṇi
analyzed: kaccit te guru śuśrūṣā saphalā cāru bhāṣiṇi
translated: O you who speak sweetly, have your services to your guru borne fruit?

original: rāmeṇa tāpasī pṛṣṭhā sā siddhā siddhasaṃmatā
analyzed: rāmeṇa tāpasī pṛṣṭhā sā siddhā siddha saṃmatā
translated: Thus asked by Rama, that perfected being, revered by the perfected ones,

original: śaśaṃsa śabarī vṛddhā rāmāya pratyupasthitā
analyzed: śaśaṃsa śabarī vṛddhā rāmāya pratyupasthitā
translated: the aged Shabaree, who was present before Rama,

original: citrakūṭaṃ tvayi prāpte vimānair atulaprabhaiḥ
analyzed: citrakūṭam tvayi prāpte vimānaiḥ atula prabhaiḥ
translated: replied: When you arrived at Chitrakuta, in those incomparable, radiant celestial vehicles,

original: itas te divam ārūḍhā yān ahaṃ paryacāriṣam
analyzed: itas te divam ārūḍhāḥ yān aham paryacāriṣam
translated: from here you ascended to heaven, whom I used to attend upon.

original: taiś cāham uktā dharmajñair mahābhāgair maharṣibhiḥ
analyzed: taiḥ ca aham uktā dharma jñaiḥ mahābhāgaiḥ mahā ṛṣibhiḥ
translated: Those greatly fortunate and great sages, who knew dharma,

original: āgamiṣyati te rāmaḥ supuṇyam imam āśramam🔽sa te pratigrahītavyaḥ saumitrisahito 'tithiḥ
analyzed: āgamiṣyati te rāmaḥ su puṇyam imam āśramam  sa te pratigrahītavyaḥ tithiḥ
translated: said to me: 'Rama will come to this extremely sacred hermitage.🔽He, along with Lakshmana, should be received by you as a guest.

original: taṃ ca dṛṣṭvā varāṃl lokān akṣayāṃs tvaṃ gamiṣyasi🔽mayā tu vividhaṃ vanyaṃ saṃcitaṃ puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: tam ca dṛṣṭvā varān lokān akṣayān tvam gamiṣyasi  mayā tu vividham vanyam saṃcitam puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: And having seen him, you will go to the excellent and imperishable worlds.'🔽O bull among men, I have collected various forest fare for you,

original: tavārthe puruṣavyāghra pampāyās tīrasaṃbhavam
analyzed: tava arthe puruṣa vyāghra pampāyāḥ tīra saṃbhavam
translated: on the banks of Pampa, O tiger among men.

original: evam uktaḥ sa dharmātmā śabaryā śabarīm idam
analyzed: evam uktaḥ sa dharma ātmā śabaryā śabarīm idam
translated: Thus addressed, the righteous one, the descendant of Raghu,

original: rāghavaḥ prāha vijñāne tāṃ nityam abahiṣkṛtām🔽danoḥ sakāśāt tattvena prabhāvaṃ te mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: rāghavaḥ prāha vijñāne tām nityam a bahiṣkṛtām  danoḥ sakāśāt tattvena prabhāvam te mahātmanaḥ
translated: spoke to Shabaree, who was always excluded from the forest,🔽The power of the great sage has been heard by me from Danu.🔽If you think it proper, I desire to see it with my own eyes.🔽Hearing these words that came out of Rama's mouth,

original: śrutaṃ pratyakṣam icchāmi saṃdraṣṭuṃ yadi manyase
analyzed: śrutam pratyakṣam icchāmi saṃdraṣṭum yadi manyase
translated: Shabaree showed them both that great forest.🔽Look, O descendant of Raghu, this forest is like a mass of clouds, filled with animals and birds,🔽and is known as Matanga's forest.🔽Here, O greatly radiant one, my preceptors, whose souls are purified,🔽having performed the sacrifice with mantras, have made this a sacred place.🔽This southern plain is the altar where they, well-honored by me,🔽having offered flowers with trembling hands due to fatigue,🔽even today, O best of Raghus, see by the power of their austerities,🔽the sacrificial stakes, shining with incomparable splendor, illuminating all directions.🔽Unable to proceed further, exhausted by fasting and fatigue,🔽they, with their bodies emaciated by austerities,

original: etat tu vacanaṃ śrutvā rāmavaktrād viniḥsṛtam
analyzed: etat tu vacanam śrutvā rāma vaktrāt viniḥsṛtam
translated: Translation: Hearing these words that came out of Rama's mouth,

original: śabarī darśayām āsa tāv ubhau tad vanaṃ mahat🔽paśya meghaghanaprakhyaṃ mṛgapakṣisamākulam
analyzed: śabarī darśayām āsa tau ubhau tat vanam mahat  paśya megha ghana prakhyam mṛga pakṣi samākulam
translated: Shabaree showed them both that great forest.🔽Look, O descendant of Raghu, this forest is like a mass of clouds, filled with animals and birds,

original: mataṅgavanam ity eva viśrutaṃ raghunandana
analyzed: mataṅga vanam iti eva viśrutam raghunandana
translated: and is known as Matanga's forest.

original: iha te bhāvitātmāno guravo me mahādyute
analyzed: iha te bhāvitātmānaḥ guravaḥ me mahā dyute
translated: Here, O greatly radiant one, my preceptors, whose souls are purified,

original: juhavāṃś cakrire tīrthaṃ mantravan mantrapūjitam
analyzed: juhavān cakrire tīrtham mantravat mantra pūjitam
translated: having performed the sacrifice with mantras, have made this a sacred place.

original: iyaṃ pratyak sthalī vedī yatra te me susatkṛtāḥ
analyzed: iyam pratyak sthalī vedī yatra te me su satkṛtāḥ
translated: This southern plain is the altar where they, well-honored by me,

original: puṣpopahāraṃ kurvanti śramād udvepibhiḥ karaiḥ
analyzed: puṣpa upahāram kurvanti śramāt udvepibhiḥ karaiḥ
translated: having offered flowers with trembling hands due to fatigue,

original: teṣāṃ tapaḥ prabhāvena paśyādyāpi raghūttama
analyzed: teṣām tapaḥ prabhāvena paśya adya api raghūttama
translated: even today, O best of Raghus, see by the power of their austerities,

original: dyotayanti diśaḥ sarvāḥ śriyā vedyo 'tulaprabhāḥ
analyzed: dyotayanti diśaḥ sarvāḥ śriyā tula prabhāḥ
translated: the sacrificial stakes, shining with incomparable splendor, illuminating all directions.🔽Unable to proceed further, exhausted by fasting and fatigue,

original: aśaknuvadbhis tair gantum upavāsaśramālasaiḥ
analyzed: a śaknuvadbhiḥ taiḥ gantum upavāsa śrama alasaiḥ
translated: they, with their bodies emaciated by austerities,

original: cintite 'bhyāgatān paśya sametān sapta sāgarān
analyzed: cintite bhyāgatān paśya sametān sapta sāgarān
translated: Look, the seven oceans have come here, summoned by your thoughts.

original: kṛtābhiṣekais tair nyastā valkalāḥ pādapeṣv iha
analyzed: kṛta abhiṣekaiḥ taiḥ nyastāḥ valkalāḥ pādapeṣu iha
translated: Having performed their ablutions, they have placed their bark garments on the trees here.

original: adyāpi na viśuṣyanti pradeśe raghunandana
analyzed: adya api na viśuṣyanti pradeśe raghunandana
translated: Even now, O descendant of Raghu, they do not dry up in this place.

original: kṛtsnaṃ vanam idaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ śrotavyaṃ ca śrutaṃ tvayā
analyzed: kṛtsnam vanam idam dṛṣṭam śrotavyam ca śrutam tvayā
translated: This entire forest has been seen and heard by you.

original: tad icchāmy abhyanujñātā tyaktum etat kalevaram
analyzed: tat icchāmi abhyanujñātā tyaktum etat kalevaram
translated: Therefore, with your permission, I wish to abandon this body.

original: teṣām icchāmy ahaṃ gantuṃ samīpaṃ bhāvitātmanām
analyzed: teṣām icchāmi aham gantum samīpam bhāvitātmanām
translated: I wish to go to those purified souls,

original: munīnām āśraṃmo yeṣām ahaṃ ca paricāriṇī
analyzed: munīnām āśraṃmaḥ yeṣām aham ca paricāriṇī
translated: to the hermitages of the sages, where I was a servant.

original: dharmiṣṭhaṃ tu vacaḥ śrutvā rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: dharmiṣṭham tu vacaḥ śrutvā rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Having heard those righteous words, Raghava, along with Lakshmana,

original: anujānāmi gaccheti prahṛṣṭavadano 'bravīt
analyzed: anujānāmi gaccha iti prahṛṣṭa vadanaḥ bravīt
translated: with a delighted face, said, I permit you to go.

original: anujñātā tu rāmeṇa hutvātmānaṃ hutāśane
analyzed: anujñātā tu rāmeṇa hutvā ātmānam hutāśane
translated: Permitted by Rama, having offered herself into the fire,

original: jvalatpāvakasaṃkāśā svargam eva jagāma sā
analyzed: jvalat pāvaka saṃkāśā svargam eva jagāma sā
translated: she went to heaven itself, blazing like a burning fire.

original: yatra te sukṛtātmāno viharanti maharṣayaḥ🔽tat puṇyaṃ śabarīsthānaṃ jagāmātmasamādhinā
analyzed: yatra te su kṛta ātmānaḥ viharanti mahā ṛṣayaḥ  tat puṇyam śabarī sthānam jagāma ātma samādhinā
translated: Where those virtuous great sages dwell,🔽she went to that sacred place of Shabaree, absorbed in her own meditation.

original: divaṃ tu tasyāṃ yātāyāṃ śabaryāṃ svena karmaṇā
analyzed: divam tu tasyām yātāyām śabaryām svena karmaṇā
translated: When Shabaree went to heaven by her own deeds,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā cintayām āsa rāghavaḥ
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā cintayām āsa rāghavaḥ
translated: Raghava, along with his brother Lakshmana, reflected.

original: cintayitvā tu dharmātmā prabhāvaṃ taṃ mahātmanām
analyzed: cintayitvā tu dharma ātmā prabhāvam tam mahātmanām
translated: The one with dharma in his soul thought about the power of those great souls.

original: hitakāriṇam ekāgraṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ rāghavo 'bravīt
analyzed: hita kāriṇam ekāgram lakṣmaṇam rāghavaḥ bravīt
translated: Raghava, with a focused mind, spoke to Lakshmana, who was engaged in his welfare,

original: dṛṣṭo 'yam āśramaḥ saumya bahvāścaryaḥ kṛtātmanām
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ yam āśramaḥ saumya bahu āścaryaḥ kṛtātmanām
translated: This hermitage has been seen, O gentle one, full of wonders of those who have perfected themselves.

original: viśvastamṛgaśārdūlo nānāvihagasevitaḥ
analyzed: viśvasta mṛga śārdūlaḥ nānā vihaga sevitaḥ
translated: The deer and tigers are full of trust, and it is frequented by many kinds of birds.

original: saptānāṃ ca samudrāṇām eṣu tīrtheṣu lakṣmaṇa
analyzed: saptānām ca samudrāṇām eṣu tīrtheṣu lakṣmaṇa
translated: O Lakshmana, in these holy places of the seven oceans,

original: upaspṛṣṭaṃ ca vidhivat pitaraś cāpi tarpitāḥ
analyzed: upaspṛṣṭam ca vidhivat pitaraḥ ca api tarpitāḥ
translated: the ablutions have been performed according to the rules, and the ancestors have been satisfied.

original: pranaṣṭam aśubhaṃ yat tat kalyāṇaṃ samupasthitam
analyzed: pranaṣṭam aśubham yat tat kalyāṇam samupasthitam
translated: Whatever inauspiciousness there was has disappeared, and auspiciousness has presented itself.

original: tena tv etat prahṛṣṭaṃ me mano lakṣmaṇa saṃprati
analyzed: tena tu etat prahṛṣṭam me manaḥ lakṣmaṇa saṃprati
translated: Therefore, O Lakshmana, my mind is delighted at this very moment.

original: hṛdaye hi naravyāghra śubham āvirbhaviṣyati
analyzed: hṛdaye hi nara vyāghra śubham āvirbhaviṣyati
translated: For in the heart of that tiger among men, auspiciousness will manifest.

original: tad āgaccha gamiṣyāvaḥ pampāṃ tāṃ priyadarśanām
analyzed: tat āgaccha gamiṣyāvaḥ pampām tām priyadarśanām
translated: Therefore, come, we shall go to that beautiful Pampa,

original: ṛśyamūko girir yatra nātidūre prakāśate
analyzed: ṛśyamūkaḥ giriḥ yatra na atidūre prakāśate
translated: where the Rishyamuka mountain is not too far away and is visible.

original: yasmin vasati dharmātmā sugrīvo 'ṃśumataḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: yasmin vasati dharma ātmā sugrīvaḥ ṃśumataḥ sutaḥ
translated: On that mountain, the righteous-souled Sugriva, son of the sun, resides,

original: nityaṃ vālibhayāt trastaś caturbhiḥ saha vānaraiḥ🔽abhitvare ca taṃ draṣṭuṃ sugrīvaṃ vānararṣabham
analyzed: nityam vāli bhayāt trastaḥ caturbhiḥ saha vānaraiḥ  abhitvare ca tam draṣṭum sugrīvam vānara ṛṣabham
translated: always frightened of Vali, with four monkeys.🔽And I am eager to see that bull among monkeys, Sugriva.

original: tadadhīnaṃ hi me saumya sītāyāḥ parimārgaṇam
analyzed: tad adhīnam hi me saumya sītāyāḥ parimārgaṇam
translated: O gentle one, the search for Sita depends on him.

original: iti bruvāṇaṃ taṃ rāmaṃ saumitrir idam abravīt
analyzed: iti bruvāṇam tam rāmam saumitriḥ idam abravīt
translated: To Rama, who was speaking thus, Saumitri said this:

original: gacchāvas tvaritaṃ tatra mamāpi tvarate manaḥ🔽āśramāt tu tatas tasmān niṣkramya sa viśāṃ patiḥ
analyzed: gacchāvaḥ tvaritam tatra mama api tvarate manaḥ  āśramāt tu tatas tasmāt niṣkramya sa viśām patiḥ
translated: We shall go there quickly, my mind is also in a hurry.🔽Then, having come out of that hermitage, that lord of the people,

original: ājagāma tataḥ pampāṃ lakṣmaṇena sahābhibhūḥ
analyzed: ājagāma tatas pampām lakṣmaṇena
translated: along with Lakshmana, the ruler, went to the Pampa lake.

original: samīkṣamāṇaḥ puṣpāḍhyaṃ sarvato vipuladrumam
analyzed: samīkṣamāṇaḥ puṣpa āḍhyam sarvatas vipula drumam
translated: Looking at the place rich with flowers, with large trees everywhere,

original: koyaṣṭibhiś cārjunakaiḥ śatapatraiś ca kīcakaiḥ
analyzed: koyaṣṭibhiḥ ca arjunakaiḥ śatapatraiḥ ca kīcakaiḥ
translated: with koystis, arjunakas, satapatras, and kicakas,

original: etaiś cānyaiś ca vividhair nāditaṃ tad vanaṃ mahat
analyzed: etaiḥ ca anyaiḥ ca vividhaiḥ nāditam tat vanam mahat
translated: and with these and other various kinds of trees, that great forest

original: sa rāmo vidhivān vṛkṣān sarāṃsi vividhāni ca
analyzed: sa rāmaḥ vidhivān vṛkṣān sarāṃsi vividhāni ca
translated: Rama, while looking at the trees and various lakes in the proper order,

original: paśyan kāmābhisaṃtapto jagāma paramaṃ hradam🔽sa tām āsādya vai rāmo dūrād udakavāhinīm
analyzed: paśyan kāma abhisaṃtaptaḥ jagāma paramam hradam  sa tām āsādya vai rāmaḥ dūrāt udaka vāhinīm
translated: burning with passion, went to the supreme lake.🔽Having reached that water-bearing river from a distance,

original: mataṅgasarasaṃ nāma hradaṃ samavagāhata
analyzed: mataṅgasarasam nāma hradam samavagāhata
translated: Rama entered the lake named Matanga-sara.

original: sa tu śokasamāviṣṭo rāmo daśarathātmajaḥ🔽viveśa nalinīṃ pampāṃ paṅkajaiś ca samāvṛtām🔽tilakāśokapuṃnāgabakuloddāla kāśinīm
analyzed: sa tu śoka samāviṣṭaḥ rāmaḥ daśaratha ātmajaḥ  viveśa nalinīm pampām paṅkajaiḥ ca samāvṛtām  tilaka aśoka puṃnāga bakula uddāla kāśinīm
translated: But Rama, the son of Dasharatha, overwhelmed with grief,🔽entered the lotus lake Pampa, covered with lotuses.🔽With tilas, ashokas, punnagas, bakulas, uddalas, and kasas,

original: ramyopavanasaṃbādhāṃ padmasaṃpīḍitodakām
analyzed: ramya upavana saṃbādhām padma saṃpīḍita udakām
translated: crowded with delightful gardens, with water crowded with lotuses,

original: sphaṭikopamatoyāḍhyāṃ ślakṣṇavālukasaṃtatām
analyzed: sphaṭika upama toya āḍhyām ślakṣṇa vāluka saṃtatām
translated: Filled with water resembling crystal, covered with smooth sand,

original: matsyakacchapasaṃbādhāṃ tīrasthadrumaśobhitām
analyzed: matsya kacchapa saṃbādhām tīra stha druma śobhitām
translated: Crowded with fish and turtles, adorned with trees on the banks,

original: sakhībhir iva yuktābhir latābhir anuveṣṭitām
analyzed: sakhībhiḥ iva yuktābhiḥ latābhiḥ anuveṣṭitām
translated: Surrounded by vines like friends, as if embracing it,

original: kiṃnaroragagandharvayakṣarākṣasasevitām
analyzed: kiṃnara uraga gandharva yakṣa rākṣasa sevitām
translated: Served by kinnaras, serpents, gandharvas, yakshas and rakshasas,

original: nānādrumalatākīrṇāṃ śītavārinidhiṃ śubhām
analyzed: nānā druma latā ākīrṇām śīta vāri nidhim śubhām
translated: Filled with various trees and vines, a beautiful abode of cool water,

original: padmaiḥ saugandhikais tāmrāṃ śuklāṃ kumudamaṇḍalaiḥ
analyzed: padmaiḥ saugandhikaiḥ tāmrām śuklām kumuda maṇḍalaiḥ
translated: Red with lotuses and saugandhika flowers, white with clusters of white lotuses,

original: nīlāṃ kuvalayoddhātair bahuvarṇāṃ kuthām iva🔽aravindotpalavatīṃ padmasaugandhikāyutām
analyzed: nīlām kuvalaya uddhātaiḥ bahu varṇām kuthām iva  aravinda utpalavatīm padma saugandhika āyutām
translated: Blue with clusters of blue lotuses, multicolored like a carpet,🔽Filled with lotuses and blue lotuses, with clusters of lotuses and saugandhika flowers,

original: puṣpitāmravaṇopetāṃ barhiṇodghuṣṭanāditām🔽sa tāṃ dṛṣṭvā tataḥ pampāṃ rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha
analyzed: puṣpita āmravaṇa upetām barhiṇa udghuṣṭa nāditām  sa tām dṛṣṭvā tatas pampām rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha
translated: Surrounded by flowering mango groves, resounding with the cries of peacocks,🔽Seeing that Pampa lake, Rama, Dasharatha's son, the radiant one,

original: vilalāpa ca tejasvī kāmād daśarathātmajaḥ
analyzed: vilalāpa ca tejasvī kāmāt daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: Lamenting out of desire, together with Lakshmana,

original: tilakair bījapūraiś ca vaṭaiḥ śukladrumais tathā
analyzed: tilakaiḥ bījapūraiḥ ca vaṭaiḥ śukladrumaiḥ tathā
translated: With tilaka, beejapura, banyan, white trees,

original: puṣpitaiḥ karavīraiś ca puṃnāgaiś ca supuṣpitaiḥ
analyzed: puṣpitaiḥ karavīraiḥ ca puṃnāgaiḥ ca su puṣpitaiḥ
translated: With flowering karavira and well-flowering punnaga,

original: mālatīkundagulmaiś ca bhaṇḍīrair niculais tathā
analyzed: mālatī kunda gulmaiḥ ca bhaṇḍīraiḥ niculaiḥ tathā
translated: With malati, kunda, bhandira, nicula,

original: aśokaiḥ saptaparṇaiś ca ketakair atimuktakaiḥ
analyzed: aśokaiḥ saptaparṇaiḥ ca ketakaiḥ atimuktakaiḥ
translated: With ashoka, saptaparna, ketaki, and atimuktaka,

original: anyaiś ca vividhair vṛkṣaiḥ pramadevopaśobhitām
analyzed: anyaiḥ ca vividhaiḥ vṛkṣaiḥ pramadā iva upaśobhitām
translated: And with many other kinds of trees, as if adorned by a woman.

original: asyās tīre tu pūrvoktaḥ parvato dhātumaṇḍitaḥ
analyzed: asyāḥ tīre tu pūrva uktaḥ parvataḥ dhātu maṇḍitaḥ
translated: On its bank is the mountain mentioned earlier, adorned with minerals,

original: ṛśyamūka iti khyātaś citrapuṣpitakānanaḥ
analyzed: ṛśyamūkaḥ iti khyātaḥ citra puṣpita kānanaḥ
translated: Known as Rishyamuka, with its forests painted with flowers.

original: harir ṛkṣarajo nāmnaḥ putras tasya mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: hariḥ ṛkṣarajaḥ nāmnaḥ putraḥ tasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: The son of the great-souled Hari, the bear king,

original: adhyāste taṃ mahāvīryaḥ sugrīva iti viśrutaḥ
analyzed: adhyāste tam mahā vīryaḥ sugrīvaḥ iti viśrutaḥ
translated: Dwells there, the greatly valorous one known as Sugriva.

original: sugrīvam abhigaccha tvaṃ vānarendraṃ nararṣabha
analyzed: sugrīvam abhigaccha tvam vānara indram nara ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among men, go to Sugriva, the lord of the monkeys.

original: ity uvāca punar vākyaṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ satyavikramam
analyzed: iti uvāca punar vākyam lakṣmaṇam satya vikramam
translated: Thus he spoke again to Lakshmana, whose prowess was truth.

original: tato mahad vartma ca dūrasaṃkramaṃ /🔽krameṇa gatvā pravilokayan vanam
analyzed: tatas mahat vartma ca dūra saṃkramam  krameṇa gatvā pravilokayan vanam
translated: Then, going by the great path, which leads far,🔽Gradually going and looking at the forest,

original: dadarśa pampāṃ śubhadarśa kānanām /
analyzed: dadarśa pampām śubha darśa kānanām
translated: He saw the Pampa, with beautiful forests,

original: anekanānāvidhapakṣisaṃkulām
analyzed: aneka nānāvidha pakṣi saṃkulām
translated: Filled with many different kinds of birds.
